column55: ['You cant even play single player without being on the web, when my internet came back the next day I installed Diablo 3 and entered the product key, as soon as I went to  enter the key for Reaper, the Blizzard server went down and I couldnt!', 'My first complaints about the game still stand, and yes, Blizzard does have Server Lag issues during peak hours of gameplay as other gamers have pointed out.', 'Could have been better...Blizzard is trying to be a cash cow and exploit the past success with Diablo games to build this one.', "I am so disappointed in Blizzard, that I'm not even disappointed anymore...", 'Things in Hardcore are worth MUCH more than Softcore - yet greedy, horrible Blizzard left the RMAH out.', "RMAH being withheld from the Hardcore server was a move where Blizzard chose to not deal with annoyed customers over money - a genuinely greedy company wouldn't of cared, wouldn't of passed out on the cash cow that RMAH HC could be.Secondly, being mad that someone who works the 9 to 5 and wants to spend some of their hard earned cash on a few items (or more) to make them feel more powerful in game is just insane.", "And while you may not like that you can't play Diablo on your laptop during your wifi absent family vacation, Blizzard doesn't like that pricks out their steal something they worked hard to make.", "And thats when you realize that this game isnt much of a game at all, its more like playing in a virtual economy where the goal is to always get more money.Personally, I don't think that the game being so bad isn't entirely Blizzard's fault.", 'Blizzard failed on this one.', 'Due to DRM In a few years when this is no longer profitable to Blizzard and they shut down the servers you can never play your game again which is total BS and a waste of money, if they are doing that crap the game should be free and pay monthly to play it not pay 60 dollars to have a limited play time.', "I know there is a small contingent who LOVE to repeat it in increasingly difficult levels, but that wasn't me.If you like Dungeon Crawlers, Blizzard or being a witch doctor.", 'All that in the launch and the first week or so of the game is very typical of any "Blizzard" game.', 'Anyone who has bought and played any "Blizzard" game when the game (or expansion) came out knows this.Blizzard/Activision (SP?)', 'To start, I was a long time fan of Blizzard and their games, from Starcraft and Diablo 2 to their usually unheard of Sega Genesis games.', 'This game is sub par for Blizzard.', 'Blizzard is constantly changing and adding new content so every time you beat the game and play again something new is there.', 'For us Blizzard and specifically Diablo fans, this is a huge disappointment.', 'having played D2 for hundreds of hours, I was nervous whether Blizzard would mess this up after so long.', 'Patch 1.08 will enhance the benefits of multiplayer more.The RMAH was a bad idea and is now recognized as a bad idea by Blizzard.', "No sense bringing up the mess that was Blizzard's attempt at forcing us to play a *single-player game* over an always-online connection.", 'It\'s so annoying that I will never pay full price for any "always on" requirement and I hope others will do the same.As far as D3 the game is concerned, there are three things I think Blizzard has done better than the competition.', "The images are also a bit grainy; my guess is that the graininess is because Blizzard began designing the game around a decade ago, before screen resolution got to today's state.", 'But instead, it seems that Blizzard ran out of audio/scripting funds from their long years of inactivity and had to cut the dialogue bank short.', "But after Diablo 3 leeched Diablo 2's fan base dry, I will be a lot less tempted to buy Diablo 4 should Blizzard decide to make it.For those who wonder why I still put up with this, it's because I already invested $35 into it.", "And, of course, Blizzard takes 30% of every dollar spent in the RMAH, and so you realize how they are making their money.. not from selling millions of copies of a $50+ game, but from virtual items that don't actually exist.In the end, I found that I had wasted almost 100 hours of my time playing a video game that I hated.", 'This is not directly Blizzard fault, but say after running the game in inferno a few times, you got like 10 million gold.', "It is as if Blizzard no longer cares about actual fun and game play they are focused on making money and that's it.To this day the game still has an extremely unbalanced feel to it, i cannot image the difference between my Demon Hunter and Witch Doctor.", "Few things on my mind that I'd like to point out.PvP - Blizzard decided to release the game, then patch in PvP months later.", "I had been dying to play my Skeleton raising Necromancer and my Hammerdin from Dibalo 2 but I lost my D2 expansion disk and didn't want to drop $20 again on D2 and plus I'm furious at Blizzard for the abomination that they released and insultingly called it Diablo III.", 'I really hope Blizzard has some expansions in the works for this game because the current classes are lacking.', 'The "pay-to-win" mentality isn\'t Blizzard\'s original evil idea.', "I used to love Blizzard, but after Cataclysm and now this, I'm afraid they are on their way out as a gaming company.", "I have been a Blizzard devotee for over 14 years, have purchased every game they've released since then, and attended Blizzcon last year.", "I have since then leveled a 60 of every class in the game and got a hardcore character to 52 (died due to a server hiccup on Blizzard's server).", 'Blizzard wanted to add an "end game" feel to Diablo 3 and made this difficulty what they call "hard" by making you one-shot every time and coming up with almost invulnerable champion combinations.', "After six days, I contacted Blizzard's CSR reps and was told he/she say the auction failed and asked me what I saw on my screen.", 'I will wait another week, but I have lost all faith in Blizzard and will never purchase another Blizzard game.', 'I will wait another week, but I have lost all faith in Blizzard and will never purchase another Blizzard game.', "It saddens me that a game I had been waiting for seven years has completely destroyed how I feel about Blizzard.Thanks Blizzard, it was a fun 14 years.Update 8/2/2012Still haven't received the money from my one auction.", 'I have since contacted the BBB and filed a complaint against Blizzard Entertainment.', 'This is the first game that Blizzard has failed to progress in terms of gaming and technology.', "The idiots at Blizzard CLEARLY didn't know what the heck they were thinking.", 'Blizzard can not do anything about them because of how the game is.', 'Blizzard, it is not fun to have to farm farm farm farm farm gold just to BUY gear from the AH.', 'Blizzard is greedy and some folks are actually stupid enough to use real money to win this game.', "One day maybe we'll play a Blizzard game that doesn't feel claustrophobic.", 'Does Blizzard ever get tired of boars?', "I'm really &*#&%$ tired of seeing armored boars in Blizzard games.", 'Blizzard knew they had a massive amount of people preordering the game.', 'Instead of preparing for the launch and overcompensating for the huge demand, Blizzard chose to go the bare minimum route to see just how few servers they could get away with to run the game.', 'The game would freeze up for a few seconds, and you would find your character permanently dead after the server re-synced.To this day the game is still unoptimized and people with higher end systems are still experiencing bugs such as the infamous stuttering problem which was present from the beta and never fixed even though Blizzard said it would be for the release.Blizzard famously adopted the "it will be released when its finished" viewpoint on the game.', 'Blizzard even patched the game to make equipment repairs cost more money so youre constantly fixing your gear and not making any money to buy anything.For $60, there just isnt any value in this game.', 'A WoW spinoff and cash-in attempt by Blizzard to exploit their fans for money.Save your money, its just not worth it for what they did to this game.', "This is on purpose as Activision/Blizzard's goal is to drive people to their real money auction house so they can progress in the game.Now I'm expected to either pay additional $$$ for this $60 game to allow my character's progress, or simply quit playing.This is not an improvement over Diablo II, it's an obvious money-grab and Blizzard should be ashamed.", 'Auction house was a very poor effort.Overall - I have purchased almost every single Blizzard game since Warcraft 2, but I will never purchase another Blizzard product again unless they fix the lag and remove the requirement for constant online access.', 'Auction house was a very poor effort.Overall - I have purchased almost every single Blizzard game since Warcraft 2, but I will never purchase another Blizzard product again unless they fix the lag and remove the requirement for constant online access.', 'Pure fail Blizzard!', "It is terrible when either the internet goes out or Blizzard's servers are out.Inferno mode is practically impossible.", 'No offline mode how pathetic.... Internet connection is mandatory and Blizzard guess what?', 'Prices are horribly inflated by people having gotten high level gear/content from pre Blizzard nurf.', 'A ladder system or PvP such as was introduced in D2 would alleviate this, but Blizzard prefers to invest time in their cash cow, the Real Money Auction House (RMAH).Which brings me to my final point, the game is custom designed to make good items hard to find so that players will be forced to resort to buying the items they need to proceed.', "As a long-time fan and active player of the Diablo franchise going all the way back to the release of the original in 1996, it goes without saying that I was eagerly looking forward to this third iteration of the series, and I'm happy to say that I am not the least disappointed with what the master game-craftsmen at Blizzard have turned out.At its heart, the Diablo games have always been simple (one might even argue simplistic): click monster, kill monster, collect reward.", 'Blizzard\'s reasoning behind this change is that by allowing the manual assignment of stat points, it basically forces the game designers to balance the difficulty around players who crunch the numbers and find the mathematically "correct" build, the one that is more viable than all the rest, meaning that any player who doesn\'t use the "correct" build will find it impossible to advance later in the game.', "The other complaint is that the end game is essentially impossible without spending virtual or real gold in Blizzard's auction house.", 'Between Blizzard\'s constant patches that "fix" the game (which actually make it less and less enjoyable with each new "fix"), server downtime that affects your ability to play any part of the game (including single player), and the diminishing player base, the game has become a stressful time sink that I wish I had never wasted a penny on.', 'If you buy this game you will get no account support from Blizzard.', 'Here we go...>>>I just want to put out there...it doesnt matter how long a company has been established , Blizzard ultimately failed at this game.There are so many problems with the game that have ruined what was once fun about the diablo series.', 'You cannot filter by bid value or duration left.The game is designed around a cookie cutter for total morons.Basically Blizzard tells you how to play the game every step of the way.', 'Blizzard wants to encourage people not to play their game legitimately rather than spend their money in the RMAH buying items.The final difficulty mode (Inferno) is designed so that players brick wall upon entering every new act.', 'Blizzard was working hard to stop the gold farmers and bots.', "I can't help but feel that the graphics also suffer so that the game can accommodate the weaker computers of Blizzard fans who thusfar have only played the lower-requirement World of Warcraft.", "It's hard not to balk at all the Warcraft conceits slipping into Diablo, or Blizzard's dodgy servers, or how many ways the game feels scaled back.", "I like competition, but this is jouvanileScheduled Maintenance Overdose - Can't log on to play single-player game cause Blizzard is always fixing something they brokeInferno Brick Wall - This is just another tactic to lead people to the RMAHDesigned for Consoles - Clunky and crappy.", 'I\'m so tired of saying this... yep, the RMAHNo Elective Attributes - Yes folks, you are too stupid to do this yourself so we will do it for youJay Wilson\'s Ego - The guy must mean well, I mean it\'s not his fault if he was told from the beginning to create a Zygna gameError (Pick Number) - The battle cry of Blizzard\'s bad programming and lack of serversExploits Win Inferno - Well that used to be true... now you can just "buy" your way through if you pleaseNo Cross-Act Waypoints - Why?Diablo\'s a Girl - Sorry it needed to be saidGreed before Players - The formula executives have found to maximize profits and literally kill the true gaming experience.', "As opposed to Diablo 3, where if I had a sub-optimal build, I just change builds, and everything is sparkling happiness and rainbows.ALL THE SMALL THINGSAnd then there's the dozens of small things Blizzard did to reduce the chores and the tedium in this game.", "It's absolutely pathetic and makes me think that Blizzard has gone so far downhill that nothing will ever bring them back.", 'So, Blizzard, you failed big on this one.', 'I basically lost 3-4 days worth of game time and all kinds of other things because Blizzard is compromised.', 'Epic fail Blizzard.', "It's insulting, Diablo has effectively been ripped away from us and Blizzard is dead 2 me because of it.", "I don't remember Blizzard's offer ever telling me that this game required an online connection.", 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', 'Few companies have delivered quality games with such consistency as Blizzard has.', "Sadly, that trend of quality seems to have waned in recent years, particularly since Blizzard's merger with Activision in 2008.", "You're forced to play on Blizzard's servers, which have had an embarrassingly high amount of downtime thus far.", "Clearly Blizzard wasn't prepared for this.Needless to say, I've found myself rather bored of this game already.", 'Blizzard must have just picked in house random people as that is the level of talent you get.', 'Blizzard making us play to unlock harder levels just sucks and is hardly exciting.8.)', "Monsters: Blizzard's attempt in being creative has made this game a joke, a very bad, unbalanced joke.", 'Blizzard could fix this with a patch but I have suspicions that they purposelly made the gear drops lousy in order to coerce people into using the Auction House.', 'They informed me (using heated language that wouldn’t be appropriate for this site)  how terrible this game would be, how it was a tragedy to the Blizzard name, and how it was further proof of the downfall of this once great company.I remember this because I had no idea why these guys were standing in line in front of an electronics retailer waiting patiently for the midnight release of a game that would ultimately be the biggest tragedy in recent video game history.', 'And they spent how long on this?The game is designed around the Auction House in every way, from item drops to the requirement to be online regardless of whether you want to play with others or not to the "difficulty" levels of the game.Oh, and Blizzard has yet to learn how to manage and anticipate problems.', 'Blizzard is NOT a poor indie company that randomly got massive unforseen demand.', "Regardless it's UNFORGIVABLE for a company with the resources of Blizzard and with the testing time/metrics/sales predicitions they had at their disposal.Is this a fun game from everything I know?", 'Seriously, Blizzard: After such a long time spent programming this game, how can you mess it up so badly?', 'I really am very disappointed with this game and Blizzard, and having read many forums, I know there happen to be a LOT of people who have run into the same sort of problems and feel the same.', 'So, from now on, no more Blizzard for me!', "The game play lacks the challenge and death penalties of the previous ones, but every game seems to be going that way, so I can't fault Blizzard too much on that as not every gamer is a hardcore gamer these days.", 'Over-hyped with an awful story that includes plenty of "politically correct" characters.I called Blizzard CS (very nice person I talked to btw) and have a refund in progress.', 'Blizzard made quite an improvement to Diablo online game play.', 'Blizzard decided to merge all activities for the same character together between the solo and multiplayer modes.I\'m still not sure if I can go back to see some of the cinematic scenes that I breezed through without having to actually "complete" those ACTs that I have done once before?', 'Thanks Blizzard for requiring us to use a DRM that still allows other people to steal my account and basically pirate away officially purchased game accounts.Bottom line: Wait until you hear in the news that Blizzard have resolved all these issues before you buy.', 'Thanks Blizzard for requiring us to use a DRM that still allows other people to steal my account and basically pirate away officially purchased game accounts.Bottom line: Wait until you hear in the news that Blizzard have resolved all these issues before you buy.', 'Unfortunately that\'s not the case with Blizzard, they are no longer this "quality benchmark" or "standard placer" on the market as the original Warcraft, Starcraft and Diablo games did.', 'I mean, as their crash-n-burn launch was happening, literally, their message from the Blizzard team on their website was regarding how the real-money auction house was delayed for few weeks.....really?', "Worst part is...... that you can't expect anything better than this from Blizzard in the future.", 'I would wait on buying this game until Blizzard fixes the servers.', 'Bought this game directly from Blizzard via download.', 'And naturally, due to infallible Blizzard logic, the unique/hero monsters one-shot you in Inferno mode.', "Whether this is due to hackers or a #$@%-up on Blizzard's part is unknown at this point, but either way, whether it's due to poor security or Blizzard server incompetence, it is inexcusable to let this kind of thing happen.I most definitely will NOT be purchasing any future expansions for this game.", "Whether this is due to hackers or a #$@%-up on Blizzard's part is unknown at this point, but either way, whether it's due to poor security or Blizzard server incompetence, it is inexcusable to let this kind of thing happen.I most definitely will NOT be purchasing any future expansions for this game.", "I personally haven't played a Blizzard game that I didn't enjoy, and this game is no exception.PS I played the game for over 5 hours and not once was I disconnected, and not once did I experience any lag.", 'As a project manager, I can see a manager meeting at Blizzard where they are sitting at a table discussing how much they can get away with by not putting capability and content into the game and still have it make money.', 'If Blizzard keeps to this trend, then other game makers will have a real chance to enter the market by not doing what Blizzard does, and this diversity will only mean better play for all of us in the future.If you are a Diablo fan, I guess you have to have it.', 'If Blizzard keeps to this trend, then other game makers will have a real chance to enter the market by not doing what Blizzard does, and this diversity will only mean better play for all of us in the future.If you are a Diablo fan, I guess you have to have it.', 'This review turned out to be as much about my perception of Blizzard as it is the game.', 'As a matter of fact, this game feels very little like a Blizzard game.', "Player where it's going to be the battle of the credit cards.I will admit that I got more than my money's worth and it was fun at times, but this franchise has been ruined and this is by FAR the worst Blizzard game I have ever played.", "Looking further into it, I saw that it was because Blizzard, FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER in a Diablo game, requires you to ALWAYS be connected to their servers in order to play.This means that if the server is down, you can't play.", "It's like Blizzard is patting us all on the head and handing us a little trophy just for playing the game.", 'If you\'re just angry at the fact that Blizzard "went there," but could certainly play D3 with its Internet requirement, don\'t deprive yourself.', "(I'm now getting a full refund after getting my bank involved)In closing I would say avoid this game & just stay away from Blizzard titles in general.", 'Diablo 3 has been fun, but Mac users beware--while Blizzard says this game is supported for the Mac, any Mac with the Nvidia 9400M video card (which is many Macbooks, including my 2010 13in Macbook Pro) will NOT play the game satisfactorily.', 'Wait to see if Blizzard fixes this, and the game might be cheaper by then too.', "This isn't a MMORPG like WoW, and These idiots over at Blizzard need to understand, and many others, that pirates will ALWAYS find a away to pirate your product, but they're a low, LOW majority.", 'There have been a lot of negative reviews posted here and majority of them are complaining about the fact that the game is always connected to Blizzard servers.', 'Blizzard has been doing that for their past 2 games; StarCraft 2 and World of Warcraft.', "Blizzard has a history of supporting their games for decades, I don't see that changing now.The pros however are that your characters are always saved on the server, so you can never loose your character due to your computer crashing, hard drive wipe, corrupted file, etc.", 'Blizzard, as one of few game developers in the world, managed to hype Diablo 3 into supernova proportions and living up to those expectations would probably be too much even for God himself.', "Blizzard's Battle.net serve as the platform for the game, giving you an online auction house for in-game gold and another for real money trading.", 'Blizzard has had the annoying habit lately to streamline their games into such "perfection" that it leaves no rough edges to explore.', 'The secret Whimsyshire "Pony level" is so whacky and wonderful it could only exist in a Blizzard game.Like I said in the beginning, 12 years of Internet hype and Blizzcon bonanzas could not stop the freight train of disappointment once the game was released.', "Lastly, while connection problems occurred in the first day of release with millions of people banging on the servers, by the third day technical issues have gone away completely, I played 10+ hours yesterday without a single hiccup.This is a very fun game, even more so with a friend or a sibling, heck only reason I'm here instead of playing is because I wanted to order diablo 3 mouse and saw these terrible reviews here.Only drawback I see is that the game lost some of its gritty feel and feels abit more generic fantasy than previous games in the series, not worth taking a star away for, but I do hope Blizzard takes note.", "Though I'm guessing that there will be the eventual expansion with additional characters and levels, and I will probably be one of those people purchasing that as well.So to anyone from Blizzard who might read this, I have to say that this is the first time I have felt a little let down, in that the game does feel a little dumbed down, but it's still fun to play.", 'Bad voice acting, bad storyline, and neat but ultimately forgettable cinematics (probably the cause of all the delay -- Blizzard having to pay for and film the equivalent of a movie within a game).', "I haven't said much about the DRM and heavy server lag because everyone already knows the game is going to be somewhat crippled for a little while longer until either more people quit or Blizzard improves capacity.", "D3 just isn't in the same league as the other games mentioned, and it just isn't worth paying that much for a temporary game that will be unplayable the day Blizzard decides to pull the plug on their servers, which could be tomorrow or could be 10 years from now (the mighty can fall - just look at the banks and GM).In the end, you aren't paying for a game, you're paying for a subscription to their (laggy) servers, a MMORPG without the RPG and without the MM.Games which are IMO bettersome NWN games (NWN2 Mask of the Betrayer comes to mind, as do the expansions for the first NWN)Baldur's Gate series (and anything else made by Bioware with the infinity engine, including Planescape Torment and Icewind Dale)Dragon Age OriginsGuild Wars seriesElder Scrolls seriesTorchlight series", 'Blizzard went exactly the wrong way: they added even more varieties of the useless items.', 'Unless Blizzard makes HUGE changes to this game I would be seriously surprised if this game continues to sell its copies.To be clear, I did not by this game.', "Blizzard spent a long time making both these games, but I'm not really sure what it was they were doing.", 'How can Blizzard -- yes, *that* Blizzard -- have miserably failed to plan for server demand, resulting in a memorably bad rollout?', 'How can Blizzard -- yes, *that* Blizzard -- have miserably failed to plan for server demand, resulting in a memorably bad rollout?', 'Blizzard is trying to innovate with the auction house concept in a way that extends the scope of the game while also providing a new source of revenue.', "But it get's old fast, even if you start playing after Activision Blizzard manages to get their login and game play servers working.", "Especially since there's no PvP, there's no real world money involved yet (RMAH)... What happened at Blizzard?", 'I am a hardcore fan of the Diablo series and it is clear that Blizzard made horrible decisions in the production of this game.1) Online Only Play2) Only 4 People can Play Together instead of 8 in Diablo 23) Every Character will have Every Spell in Equal Amounts.', 'I watched a Blizzard developer in an interview basically say that they had a hard time balancing skill point development so they just got rid of it.', 'Ever since Blizzard screwed up SC2 (fast paced click fest now) I have questioned how they just remake a game, but screw it up and call it a sequel.', 'Forget about agonizing over how to develop your character, because Blizzard has decided to dumb it down for you and make everything possible at any time.', "It's also laughable that Blizzard is trying to squeeze even more money out of their fans pockets with the Auction House, which no normal person would (or could) actually use to try to make money off of the game.", 'What a hassle to use those items when Blizzard could just simplify the game to get rid of them, and instead allow players to press a button at any time to magically teleport themselves back to town (complete with a silly animation of the players crouching and white energy balls emanating from their hands), right?', 'I have been playing Blizzard games for 15 years now and they have an amazing team and always work hard to get game play back on track.', 'It sad that Blizzard could create such a complex game which is ultimately dull.Im not going to be overly critical about the server being down.', 'Blizzard had the obligation of giving a working piece of software for all of us that payed the price for it in advance, and they get away with a lame excuse in their website?', 'Blizzard really drives a hard bargain.', 'Yes, i expect a powerhouse like Blizzard to be on top of things, but hundreds of thousands of people trying to get on a game, I can understand the server trouble.', "There are various things you can do to minimize the occurrence of each of these issues, but I'm really hoping Blizzard pumps out a patch soon to resolve the most common of these (like the entire game hanging up and booting you out when you join multiplayer games that overtax your video GPU).>>>GRAPHICS / ART DESIGN: I said earlier that the visuals are WoW-esque, and I still stand by that (the skill icon design, architecture, UI layout, etc.)", 'I had read earlier Blizzard might or I should say was going to an online requirement for this game!', 'Blizzard is having a few issues getting the servers going.', "You net a few billion annually Blizzard, on top of running the leading online games - how can you justify such trash?On the game: No character customization, no class customization.Game lacks the Diablo 'feel' of the previous games.", "Feels like 75% a dash of WoW, 25% Diablo.You're bad Blizzard, and you should feel bad.", 'Blizzard could not control the hacking on battle.net, and so the solution is to force everyone onto battle.net, where the same hackers could attack the servers I am forced to use, and possibly attack the ports on my network that battle.net uses.4) "You are not rating the game, you are rating battle.net.', "It is merely an access kit to a game, which is stored somewhere on Blizzard's server farms.", 'Everything in "your game" -- your data, your gear, your characters -- is actually Blizzard\'s, parked on one of their servers.', 'It seems a lot of people have already encountered the source of my frustration.Why the hell would Blizzard release a single-player game whose execution depends on their server??', "It is just IDIOTIC to disallow people who paid for a single-player game from playing just because Blizzard's servers are down!", '?I am VERY DISAPPOINTED at Blizzard, I expected more wisdom and intelligence from them.', "Just bought and installed the game, can't even play 1 minute of the game, constantly getting error messages , Blizzard are f..ing clowns.", "Yes, I had some of the problems that others had getting into the game and yes Blizzard, requiring a constant internet connection to play DOES INDEED SUCK, but it's the first day of launch and one of the most anticipated PC games since the LAST Starcraft game is back to suck time out of our hands once again.I remember getting a hold of Diablo II back in 2002 to play while I was out sick and it dominated my life for nearly 4 months and in that time, I had to upgrade my PC twice so that it would run properly.", 'However, Blizzard needs to seriously fix the server issue because the forums have be lit ablaze by angry gamers who really wanted to get their fix and due to numerous server outages, were unable to do so.', "So first of all if you go to Blizzard's battle.net site they have plenty of bandwidth for you to purchase and download/install the game ASAP.", "Blizzard is tired of the exploits and I don't blame them.If you've learned anything from Diablo 2, it should have been that Blizzard took this series in a multiplayer focused direction, and this installment doesn't change that, it enhances it.", "Blizzard is tired of the exploits and I don't blame them.If you've learned anything from Diablo 2, it should have been that Blizzard took this series in a multiplayer focused direction, and this installment doesn't change that, it enhances it.", "Yet somehow, the thing needs to constantly pull data from the Internet - even though there's no one in dungeon but you.You click, you wait, you die - often with no idea why.But let's assume for a minute that Blizzard figures out its servers eventually and the lag returns to a semi-acceptable level where the game is playable.", 'Thank you for respecting our position.Regards,Blizzard EntertainmentDiablo III Customer Support[...]POOR POOR BLIZARD', "This game is poorly crafted and I will not be buying anything made by Blizzard for a long time, maybe even never again as they've obviously changed their standards to conform to profit-margin agenda of the corporation that bought them.", 'This alone knocks points off the game, and as Blizzard has no intention of changing that, I see no reason why this review will ever rise above a three star.', "If it's your 1 day off a week where you can get time to play a game you were a fan of the franchise and Blizzard is having trouble with their servers?", "Blizzard not removing such a thread says a lot for them as far as I'm concerned.In general I

column1: find the game very laggy which makes it difficult to play.""
column2: 'Blizzard as well as their fanboys and undercover employees place absolute blame on the individuals who had the hacked account.The game is very short in general.'
column3: ""I'm completely shocked Blizzard would do something like this.""
column4: 'It took an hour and a half before I could even log in to the game

column6: ""I didn't have any problems with the download
column9: I didn't even try until about 15 hours after game launch.I read the Blizzard forums and saw all the bad reviews of the game... Kind of reminds you of all the World of Warcraft failures
column10: doesn't it?Well I didn't expect much better.""

column2: ['It was fun at first, felt like a time machine going back to when I would stay up all day and night playing D2, hearing my mom yell that my meals where ready.', "I'd recommend just going back to D2 and playing that or buying it, you'll have much more fun and if you have never played the first two, before playing D3 just go back to though before continuing forward, and if you do proceed with caution.", 'I played through most of D2, never played D1, so that clears that one up.', 'Go to titanquest(dot)net a very friendly very legal website and look under their modding tab and find the D2 Immortal mod and download it.', "I never played D1 or D2, so I don't know if those were immensely more fun, but I can say this; Diablo 3 has been a completely enjoyable experience so far and I don't regret my purchase in the slightest.", "So having Diablo tied into such can only be a good thing for Diablo fans in the long run.One more thing...for those complaining about going through the plot line too fast before the game becomes a loot-grind; you obviously never played a Diablo game before.For my ratings: 5 full stars for fun factor, as I am already addicted.4 stars overall because I acknowledge some flaws, and because I am a spoiled gamer that never got into D2 untilDiablo Battlechest [new version] was released and I want D3's expansion sooner than later!", 'Blizzard could have done better seeing as how D2 was well polished at the end.', 'The original D2 members are off doing their own thing with Guild Wars and Torchlight.', 'I loved D1 and D2.', "I'll start out saying I didn't like D1 or D2, but enjoy dungeon crawlers such as Dungeon Siege/NWN/Torchlight/Borderlands.", 'Not as fun as D2, but fun nonetheless I suppose.', "---I've never played D1 or D2, so some of these things may have been the same in previous games as well---*********************************************************************************Diablo 3 isn't garbage, but it's not that great.I definitely do not think that it is worth $60.", 'only the ones with invincibility excel, no other contributing factor-the levels move almost exactly like D2, really...all you could do is send us to 1 new place??', 'In that case, it was understandable; D2 was the first big foray into a managed online environment.', 'This is further hurt by many reports that the maps are very similar to D2 maps.11.', 'This is further hurt by many reports that the maps are very similar to D2 maps.12.', 'Played D2 all the way through many times.Diablo 3 is great.', 'I don\'t get a sense like i did in D2 that this is "my unique character build".- replay ability ( i fear that once i level up about 3-4 different characters there will be no need for me to start a new "build" of the same class with different stats, skills b/c i can just change or upate the skills of my current character)  something i did countless times in Diablo 2- can only handle 4 players in multiplayer (D2 had 8)Overall still very fun and i feel blizzard is really committed to making everything balanced and feels right no matter what skills you are trying to use.', 'I don\'t get a sense like i did in D2 that this is "my unique character build".- replay ability ( i fear that once i level up about 3-4 different characters there will be no need for me to start a new "build" of the same class with different stats, skills b/c i can just change or upate the skills of my current character)  something i did countless times in Diablo 2- can only handle 4 players in multiplayer (D2 had 8)Overall still very fun and i feel blizzard is really committed to making everything balanced and feels right no matter what skills you are trying to use.', "Its a great game, don't let the knee jerk reactionaries fool you into thinking its the same as D2 or a watered down RPG: Its solid, will suck your time away, and you'll love every minute.", 'Everywhere I go I see mostly the same things being said, and the themes are: "Not enough like D2" or "It sucks because it\'s Online only."', "I've been too busy killing monsters).Population of Monsters:  Much like D2, this game starts out easy.", 'Though it does seem like you have to wait longer to get the good ones on a couple of them.Gear:  Gear is handled in much of the same way as D2, and Torchlight.', "I don't know, I can't really remember playing D2 or D1 since it's been over 10 years since I've played either.", 'Looks much better than D2, and has many more cool surprises such as mobs clinging to the sides of buildings, etc.Others have complained about having to be online to play, but I like this.', 'In D2; as you leveled and completed certain tasks, you were rewarded with attribute points and skill points.', 'The 3/4 perspective is nice and proportionally sets out distances better than D2 did.', 'This is kind of disappointing since D2 and the D2 expansion had some epic music that fit the themes of each act well.', 'This is kind of disappointing since D2 and the D2 expansion had some epic music that fit the themes of each act well.', 'The sound effects are also very memorable if you played D2 and sound just like enemies did back then.', 'But if you do enjoy replaying and having replay value, then D3 has it since the game gets progressively harder the further you level and more rewarding the more you play through the story in harder difficulties.I had played D1 and D2 (+expansion) for several years continuously.', 'Nothing is annoying me, and it has the familiar sound effects for things like town portals socketing gems.--------Graphics--------These are pretty good, better than D2 obviously.', 'If you are a diehard D2 fan, and think D2 was perfect or near perfect ...', 'If you are a diehard D2 fan, and think D2 was perfect or near perfect ...', "In D2 the loot made things interesting, but in D3 the loot is super randomized and always improving but doesn't feel special.Think about it... would you rather play 60 hours of content on one difficulty level, or play 15 hours of content, four times repeated?", 'Everyone wanted more from D3 than they remembered from D2, and I think most people got much less than they were hoping for.', 'Another game I could compare the graphics style to is Kingdoms of Amalur.SOUND: Blizz did reuse some of the old D2 sound effects like when an item drops out of a mob or off your pack, it does that swish-swoosh sound similar to D2.', 'Another game I could compare the graphics style to is Kingdoms of Amalur.SOUND: Blizz did reuse some of the old D2 sound effects like when an item drops out of a mob or off your pack, it does that swish-swoosh sound similar to D2.', "Also, the sound effects you hear when you turn over a corpse and gold drops off it's body, yup it's the same exact sound file from D2.", "If you've played D2, you can easily drop into this game without difficulty.", "I loved D1 and D2,and I am going to love this game,too.I already do.There is nothing more fun in a game than to kill wave after wave of zombies,skeletons,exploding mods who have little imps growing them.I'm sorry for you guys who are so angry.", 'This could be a valid concern in that one of the best parts about D2 was strategically planning an interesting build for your character.', "It's still enjoyable, but it's quite different than D2 in this regard.", 'I really enjoyed D1 and D2, as most people did to make them the landmark games they were.', 'For some reason I expected this game to be much longer and expansive compared with D2, similar to how D2 was much more immense in scope compared with D1.', 'For some reason I expected this game to be much longer and expansive compared with D2, similar to how D2 was much more immense in scope compared with D1.', 'GO FROM A > B > C > D...)More so than D1 or even D2, D3 is super linear.', 'This mostly is a result of the lack of character development/customization (and by that, I mean inability to assign attribute points or selectively develop/specialize skills as in D2) and the overall similarity to D2.', 'This mostly is a result of the lack of character development/customization (and by that, I mean inability to assign attribute points or selectively develop/specialize skills as in D2) and the overall similarity to D2.', "After uninstalling D3 (after 6 days of gameplay getting my Demon Hunter up to lvl 50 and finishing on nightmare difficulty), I decided to see how D2 looked and played (haven't played it since 2001, after getting the LOD expansion pack) after all these years.Well, D2/LOD is still great!", "D2, on the other hand, had a reasonably interesting and fairly well thought out (if not particularly original) story of the 'Dark Wanderer' (your character from D1), which provides the backdrop for D2.", "D2, on the other hand, had a reasonably interesting and fairly well thought out (if not particularly original) story of the 'Dark Wanderer' (your character from D1), which provides the backdrop for D2.", "4-PLAYER CO-OP LIMITEight player co-op games in D2 are great -- too bad you're limited to only four players in D3.", "Glad I bought the collector's edition for it.Game play- If you like the click and point fighting, it's more of the same from D2, which is perfectly fine.", "I'll update specifics in the sections below, but a couple key points are a) a lot of my negative first impressions turned positive as I adjusted to the changes in gameplay / mechanics b) the skills and items REALLY open up and gain depth as you gain levels... much more so than in D1 or D2, and in ways you don't really anticipate at the lower levels.", "c) the storyline in D3 goes from being awesome to being sort of silly, but, as it turns out, it doesn't matter, since D3 is really designed around the endgame / replayability experience, not the story itself.--- --- --->>>OVERALL: Diablo III, in my experience so far, is a polished and addictive game that makes major tweaks to the tried-and-true formula of D2 that will spark divided opinions among returning players.", 'The difficulty curve is more forgiving than in D1 / D2.', "Sure, the lines could be silly in D2 as well, but at least you didn't have extended cartoony dialogue from the bosses like in D3.>>>SOCIAL / DRM / ONLINE: Blizzard did a pretty good job making it easy to find and add your friends, and to invite them to your party/game.", 'I loved playing D2 and LOD on my LAN though.', "So again, in D3 Blizzard made another major decision restricting players' freedom: internet only.With D2, I had no problems with hacking or server lag, because I abandoned Battle.net.", '"That is true, but remember that many of us had been playing D2 for 12 years, and we were used to the freedom of being able to play offline.', "And eventually, the community figured out what the most optimal combination was, so if you didn't do exactly one method, then your character was simply worse than the others.Although D1 and D2 gave you a wide range of options, there were only a few really good options.", 'D2 is superior to this game in every way.', 'D1 and D2 are much more fun!', 'D3 has sold like hot cakes because no game has successfully emulated the addictive nature of D2 in its genre in over a decade, and therefore gamers were waiting for a very long time to find a legitimate replacement for D2.', 'D3 has sold like hot cakes because no game has successfully emulated the addictive nature of D2 in its genre in over a decade, and therefore gamers were waiting for a very long time to find a legitimate replacement for D2.']
column4: ['Looking forward to the RoS expansion!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------3/12/2014A good, solid, fast paced game that is very reminiscent of D1 and D2 - if a little outdated.', 'having played D2 for hundreds of hours, I was nervous whether Blizzard would mess this up after so long.', "But you can't please everyone in this life, the days of single player D2 is in the past.", "I had been dying to play my Skeleton raising Necromancer and my Hammerdin from Dibalo 2 but I lost my D2 expansion disk and didn't want to drop $20 again on D2 and plus I'm furious at Blizzard for the abomination that they released and insultingly called it Diablo III.", "I had been dying to play my Skeleton raising Necromancer and my Hammerdin from Dibalo 2 but I lost my D2 expansion disk and didn't want to drop $20 again on D2 and plus I'm furious at Blizzard for the abomination that they released and insultingly called it Diablo III.", 'Your attributes are given and only affected by items, a grand detour from D2 and a bad decision imo.', 'A ladder system or PvP such as was introduced in D2 would alleviate this, but Blizzard prefers to invest time in their cash cow, the Real Money Auction House (RMAH).Which brings me to my final point, the game is custom designed to make good items hard to find so that players will be forced to resort to buying the items they need to proceed.', 'Back to D2, I guess (Error 37 forces my hand anyway :p )Edit (5-6 days later):After the patch 1.0.2b, the game became unplayable as error messages followed one after another.', "It's a catch-22 to say that this game isn't enough like D2.", 'Where as in D1 and D2, gear pieces had such similar looks to other pieces.', 'D2 and D1 made it where you had to constantly browse public games set up by other players and then join to hope that someone was at the same part of the story/game-progression as you.', 'With regards to D3, the criticism is not really a case of "this isn\'t Diablo [II] enough" but rather, this is all the bad sides of D2, with none of the good aspects (namely character customization and sort of a sandboxey go-where you like when you like feeling.', "It's a game that doesn't force you to think too hard, it's pretty to look at and everyone who has ever played D1 or D2 knows how to play.", 'NOT VERY INTERESTING TO PLAY THE FIRST TIME)This game is basically D2 with updated graphics and worse voice acting and absolutely zero atmostphere.', 'The maps seem so familiar that you could probably do the entire game from memory even if you have never played it before, as long as you have played D2.', "It's shocking actually, and it does not help that the acts are so similar to D2.", "The over-simplication (and let's not forget that D2 was a pretty simple game to begin with... hardly real RPG type character development or gameplay) really is the downfall of this otherwise serviceable game.", 'For me, it provided less than a week of gameplay, unlike D2 that I played for months and months.', "In D2 (and other RPGs), you fix your gear so that it doesn't break because typically you can't just weld a broken sword back together again!And of course, don't forget that monsters now drop HEALTH ORBS that raise your life instantly when you walk over them, instead of health potions that needed to be then be consumed in order to get healed.So, yes -- Diablo 3 has been SIMPLIFIED and DUMBED DOWN to the level of an arcade side shooter game.", 'And that sickening DRM always online, cant play offline is a joke and insult.Playing it it actually feels less fun the D2 that I was playing all week leading up to this.', 'First off, this game has nowhere near the armor and weapon selection D2 has.', 'The game play is OK but worse than D2, music similar but d2 had that feeling, graphics- D2 still rules.', 'The game play is OK but worse than D2, music similar but d2 had that feeling, graphics- D2 still rules.', 'But the majority of D2 players are still angry at this game because it turned out to be an mediocre action game stripped of any meaningful customization.']

column2: ["i think over the years, Blizzard has perfected the click-to-death Diablo franchise to be a game that's easy enough for anyone to pick up, while maintaining the challenges that hardcore gamers like myself love about the franchise.", "i think over the years, Blizzard has perfected the click-to-death Diablo franchise to be a game that's easy enough for anyone to pick up, while maintaining the challenges that hardcore gamers like myself love about the franchise.", 'You ruined the best PC franchise!!!', 'If you are new to the franchise, you may want to check it out.', 'Ive been through the first the second diablo the expansion, anyone from that time period who enjoyed the franchise for what it was would be a fool not to have purchased d3 from launch.', 'you have laid off workers to make more money, you have screwed the community into buying this game based on a franchise that used to be reputable.', '*On a side note:  Torchlight 2 appears to be the real successor to the Diablo franchise.', "Don't get me wrong, I still am a great fan of Diablo 2, and am not comparing the franchise directly with the other RPGs out there, but still, they could have done so much more in the time available, especially after having seen what is going on in the gaming world.", 'WoW is still having a major negative impact on an interesting and innovative MMO coming out, because there is so much pressure to if not be a lot like WoW, to at least sell a lot of copies like WoW.I love action RPGs, but playing Diablo III has me convinced that Blizzard will fumble with patches, the obligatory expansion, and maybe a self degrading sequel because they started with the "how can we make a ton of money off of Diablo" foot and not the "what would be something cool, new, and fun to do with the franchise" foot.', "Most if not all the original makers of the Diablo franchise left Blizzard years ago for other companies (Torchlight/ Torchlight 2), leaving a crew that's basically made WoW.", 'But the Diablo franchise is a very different, yet fantastic experience.', 'My first impression of Diablo 3 was that it was a good attempt to further the franchise.']
column4: ['I had long heard of the Diablo franchise but had never waded in.', 'It is unfortunate because, BLIZZARD has proved in the past that they can produce games with a very good back-story, such asStarcraft II.However, this a game franchise that is heavily invested on the Judeo-Christian culture of the Devil.', 'They killed this franchise for themselves.', 'But for a Blizzard/Diablo game, it is a horrific abomination of a franchise, on par with final fantasy 14.', "As a long-time fan and active player of the Diablo franchise going all the way back to the release of the original in 1996, it goes without saying that I was eagerly looking forward to this third iteration of the series, and I'm happy to say that I am not the least disappointed with what the master game-craftsmen at Blizzard have turned out.At its heart, the Diablo games have always been simple (one might even argue simplistic): click monster, kill monster, collect reward.", 'Probably a hundred odd people standing in a line that wrapped around the building, waiting for the ball to drop for a franchise that had been dormant for 12 years.I’ll always remember the people in front of me.', "Player where it's going to be the battle of the credit cards.I will admit that I got more than my money's worth and it was fun at times, but this franchise has been ruined and this is by FAR the worst Blizzard game I have ever played.", 'This game is a blight on the franchise that Spawned this type of game especially after a 12 year wait.', 'If this game had a different name then diablo it would be easier to swallow but it felt like they spit in the eye of the franchise with this.', "If it's your 1 day off a week where you can get time to play a game you were a fan of the franchise and Blizzard is having trouble with their servers?"]

column2: ['While it lasted in story mode, it was fun.', 'I enjoyed the graphics and "Lore".They did add a lot of content but what I personally think is they need a offline mode like they did for Starcraft 2, They need to add a bit more to the game like "PVP" then it will be a lot better.This is all my personal opinion of this game and do keep in mine it is rated MA 17+ meaning it is not intended for children.', 'I loved the gamed until after you finish with normal mode other modes like nightmare to inferno are just exactly the same thing as you did in normal but harder.', 'Before long, the Inferno mode will be a moderate increase in challenge when compared to the mode before it, and those who managed to complete the game in Inferno pre-nerf will be awarded with some special achievement.', 'Before long, the Inferno mode will be a moderate increase in challenge when compared to the mode before it, and those who managed to complete the game in Inferno pre-nerf will be awarded with some special achievement.', 'Basically the gameplay itself is fun, until you get to Inferno mode, in which case you need really good gear to progress.', 'I thought it was just right for me, but hardcore button smashers would probably think normal mode is too easy.', "Don't spend more than 10 seconds analyzing gear, just vendor it and go to the gold AH.Conclusion:Buy it if you like mindless grinds, but don't take D3 seriously and certainly don't torture yourself with money generating Inferno mode.", 'Combat and skills work nicely together, yet when you finish the game on normal mode, theres not much more reason to play.', 'This game was over 11 years in the making and when it finally was released it was filled with bugs, exploits, server issues, and no single player offline mode.', 'i was expecting it to be more like Starcraft 2, where you had to login to battlenet to play, but you could still play in offline mode.', 'You cant be disconnected in hardcore mode or you will automatically lose your character, even if the problem is caused by blizzards server you cannot request for a revive or have your 100+ hours of work returned to you, you lose not because you played the correct way but because blizzard lacks the responsibility to maintain a safe and secure network.', 'It is fun the first time you go through the acts and kill Diablo on normal mode, but the replay value is almost nil.', 'In hell mode, not even inferno mode, with max gear bought off the auction house, I die in 1 hit from normal mobs.', 'In hell mode, not even inferno mode, with max gear bought off the auction house, I die in 1 hit from normal mobs.', 'You will not be able to do a play-through of an act in later difficulty with the same players because death is so frequent people simply give up.-HOPELESS HARDCORE MODE-In hardcore mode you will be lucky to make it past nightmare difficulty.', "mind you that is today, I can't imagine 4-5 years from now.-bosses only drop loot the first time you kill them, no matter what the mode of difficulty-inferno isn't fun, 1 shotted from off screen = not fun, 1 shotted from everything = not fun, it's not even challenging, it's just stupid-once you hit inferno act 1, be prepared to farm farm farm for cash before you can progress to act 2...for days-character growth/scaling is insane...at level 50 you are using a 200 dmg weapon i believe, by 55 500, by 60 1600. the scaling makes no sense, why linear growth the entire game until the end then exponential.-max character level is only 60, you are 60 long before you beat inferno, this appears to be a decision late in the development process which i imagine contributes to the terrible character scaling in the 50s.-most classes get their best abilities by 20, ...why-auction house constantly down/very laggy-some classes (DH, Monk) are WAY better than others at the moment, this can only lead to character normalization or everyone playing the same class.", 'Easy mode is too easy and inferno mode is too hard.', 'Easy mode is too easy and inferno mode is too hard.', "Easy mode bores me to death while inferno mode I can't find a random team that can even survive act 2....WE UNDERSTAND THAT INFERNO NEEDS TO BE CHALLENGING!", "Easy mode bores me to death while inferno mode I can't find a random team that can even survive act 2....WE UNDERSTAND THAT INFERNO NEEDS TO BE CHALLENGING!", "I have a level 40 Wizard in Nightmare mode which I have no further desire to play with since I've maxed out his abilities and really can't progress further.", 'Join online anytime and you will likely have others playing around the same level.I highly recommend trying to finish the solo story on your own so that you can enjoy it without being rushed through via multiplaying mode.', 'Also the map generator is still in the game as in previous titles, just not in main story mode places.The the auction house is really nice if you just cant find that level 30 item you need because you cant find anything better then what you found at level 18.', 'First, in my opinion this game should have a completely balanced offline single player mode, which builds on the legacy of previous Diablo products and ensures those with no internet can enjoy.', "It doesn't matter how much HP or armor you have.I am almost done with Hell mode, and I have yet to see a single unique or set item dropped in game.", 'Blizzard made good item drops so scarce that the only plausible way to deck yourself out in adequate gear is to go to the auction halls.My brother summed up Inferno mode pretty well:  "You paid Blizzard to have anti-fun".', "In normal mode you'll get most of the Gold items from bosses.", 'It is not designed to be played once on "normal" mode and then put aside, so if you are not the kind of gamer who likes to replay content a few times with increased difficulty, then Diablo 3 may not be for you, because this is the core mechanic of the game, and the core design idea that carried through from Diablo 2 as well.', "Graphics and gameplay are really good, im glad blizzard didn't change it to a first person mode or any other gameplay mode.", "Graphics and gameplay are really good, im glad blizzard didn't change it to a first person mode or any other gameplay mode.", "This is the ONLY game with multiplayer mode I've ever experienced that you had to turn OFF the options for your friends to just POOF!", 'This is rewarding and reinforcing.Tons and tons of skills to learn.Cooldowns are a nice addition but..... (read below)Lots of good loot.You can revive alliesThe game isnt as linear as several claimNo loot hogging, loot appears only on the individuals screenThe game is fairly long.Normal mode is challengingGreat boss battlesYou never know how bad a group of monsters will be.', "Don't get me wrong, when you're actually able to play the game it looks very nice and I think it could be fun, but as of now I just don't know, and the thought that I'll have to put up with going online just to play in the single player mode is really annoying.I know many people are saying that complaining about launch day problems is dumb, but remember this is not just an issue you'll have on launch day.", "The lag can be crippling, but it's not crippling often.The game is excellent, but the lack of an offline mode is still pretty ridiculous, so I'm rating it 4/5."]
column4: ['Even the forced top-down perspective mode of gameplay, which most people would agree is outdated, does not deter from the addictiveness of the gameplay.D3 is a fast paced hack-n-slash game with all the trappings of its predecessors.', 'The other problem is that this game has no offline mode, just have to be connected to the internet to play the game.', 'There might be an option to turn off mouse-click movement, but in the default mode it is not very good for ranged classes.- You MUST have Internet access to play this game at all.', "The problem is, the stuff you need for Inferno mode costs so much, that it's practically impossible to get.", 'After you finish the game once, you enter Nightmare mode, and so forth.', 'It took about a week for the log in issues to be resolved, but even after that, the people that could finally log in were greeted with horrible server lag and pings that were in the 250-700 range which meant huge delays with what was happening on screen, and even more trouble for people who attempted to play hardcore mode.', 'The storyline for the game was also pretty boring and uninspired and you can tell the people that did the original games had nothing to do with this one.Inferno mode which is the highest difficulty, just turns into grinding mobs to farm high end gear.', "Pure fail!Then there are issues with the game's difficulty as it makes you play the game out on beyond easy mode where I lost 3 friends to boredom.", "If you get to a section you can't get past just buy some gear off the auction house and more than likely you're back to god mode again.Last point I want to touch on is that the game's end game is nonexistent.", "It is terrible when either the internet goes out or Blizzard's servers are out.Inferno mode is practically impossible.", 'No offline mode how pathetic.... Internet connection is mandatory and Blizzard guess what?', 'Why not add a single player mode only that cannot then be transferred online for play for those who wish to enjoy the game when the internet is not an option or the servers are out?Aside from the glaring requirement of being connected in order to play there are the issues with the game play itself.', 'Blizzard wants to encourage people not to play their game legitimately rather than spend their money in the RMAH buying items.The final difficulty mode (Inferno) is designed so that players brick wall upon entering every new act.', 'With elective mode you can put any skill on 1-4 numbers and left/right clicking.With that said, you start being forced into a few builds in order to survive in inferno difficulty.', 'That means you need to log into the game to play, and no offline mode to play by yourself.', 'None of the other stuff like updating my system, disabling my anti-virus, running in compatibility mode or anything made this game work.', "Constant internet connection should never be required for single player mode and for sixty dollars I should at least have a copy for single player instead of a useless disc I can't even use.", 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', 'If the game is too hard, we can always select an easier mode.', 'Im on my 2nd playthrough of the game as a monk on hell mode and the game is still really fun to me.', 'So I just finished Diablo III this past weekend on Normal mode.', 'And i refuse to play it on a harder mode till they fix the dam lag.', 'Give me a break.You can finish the game in normal mode in a day or two, just to have the ability to play it in nightmare mode from the beginning again.', 'Give me a break.You can finish the game in normal mode in a day or two, just to have the ability to play it in nightmare mode from the beginning again.', 'And naturally, due to infallible Blizzard logic, the unique/hero monsters one-shot you in Inferno mode.', "These abilities, although they are stupid,  were tolerable in Hell mode, because most enemies couldn't kill you in one or two hits.", 'THAT IS NOT GOOD GAMEPLAY.Also, as of yesterday (Friday 5/26/2012), thousands of players on Hell difficulty mode have had their accounts completely "emptied":  their characters have lost all items on their character or in their stash, and have no gold either.', "Unlike SC2, however, Diablo 3 can't be played in an offline mode once the game has been authenticated on the battle.net servers, but instead is actually played on the servers themselves, even when played in single player/non-public mode.", "Unlike SC2, however, Diablo 3 can't be played in an offline mode once the game has been authenticated on the battle.net servers, but instead is actually played on the servers themselves, even when played in single player/non-public mode.", 'Multiplayer is very boring, you just go through single player in co-op mode, there is no real interaction between players.', 'But instead everyone is required to have an active internet connection to even play single player mode.', 'Yes, the mandatory online is crap and there should be an offline mode.', 'No off-line mode killed this game.', 'Playing in single player mode, a gamer can find themselves rubber-banding across the screen and unable to properly enjoy the experience.', 'Everyone is playing solo mode because the game provides zero incentives or fun.)', 'If you like that sort of game you will still not like D3 due to the bugs and connection issues, but when (presumably later in 2012) they get their house in order, the game should be enjoyable for you.For me, D3 fails on all levels: not story-driven, and bugs and connection-issues are so frequent that it reduces the fun in single-player mode, leading to frustration.', "It's still pretty upsetting that there's no offline mode, and I can't play the game in single player mode when the servers go down (often).", "It's still pretty upsetting that there's no offline mode, and I can't play the game in single player mode when the servers go down (often).", 'So it turns out that this game requires constant internet access even for single player mode.', 'The game has NO offline mode which makes the product completely worthless for the time being.']

column2: ['It has been about a year since the release of Diablo 3 and lots of things have been patched into the game to address the many faults it had at launch.', 'The game has its fair share of problems, but they were mainly during launch with a plethora of glitches, balancing, and server issues.', 'Diablo 2 was a great game and still manages to hook players in for being more than 10 years old which is a testament to how good it was.Diablo 3, however, was a letdown and failure in every possible way, and a slap in the face to fans who have been waiting so long for the third installment.First problem, was of course the launch.', 'Ive been through the first the second diablo the expansion, anyone from that time period who enjoyed the franchise for what it was would be a fool not to have purchased d3 from launch.', "They had a pretty bad launch for the game, though most everything seems to be running smoothly now, overall anyway :-) I'm not too keen on the Real Money Auction House they are planning on putting in, and most likely will barely give it a look once it goes live.", 'They used to take twice or three times longer to release a game to make sure it is ready for launch.', "There's enough reviews on the internet here to tell you all about Diablo 3, I just wanted to add my two cents to the legions of nerds that are giving this amazing game a very low score because during the first few hours they had launch issues.", "Ok I don't know where to start...I bought this game expecting to run into server issues that comes with a launch of a title like this.", "As for now though, the launch and current gameplay isn't worth $59.99.", 'A lot of complaints seem to come from the first day launch players.', 'I refused to play the beta, since I think it can detract from the fun of launch and trying a new game.', 'Lowering my review to one star -- considering the development time, expectations, cost, and launch state, IMHO, this is the greatest catastrophe in the history of online gaming.', "But don't let this concern alone turn you away from experiencing this otherwise amazing game.One final comment: I'm amused by all of the negative reviews from folks who clearly bought the game, often even pre-ordered, stated how they waited eagerly all 12 years, took off work to play...and yet were surprised by the persistent internet connection requirement or that there were launch issues.", "If it were any other developer in the world (except maybe EA); if they hadn't BETA-tested the game for many months and hadn't performed a public stress test two weeks prior to launch; if they didn't have the experience with WoW and SC2, it would be almost forgivable.", "I've been using Google Plus 'Hangouts' to chat with my teammates, and that works well.>>>TECHNICAL ISSUES: the server bugs seem to have been resolved in the week since launch, but many of my friends still have connectivity or graphics/system issues... getting booted from games, losing connection, computer freezing, etc.", 'During the cataclysm launch i was able to get into WoW after 5 mins after it launched.. so i have to say i was a bit down on the fact i coudnt get in right away.', "Don't get me wrong, when you're actually able to play the game it looks very nice and I think it could be fun, but as of now I just don't know, and the thought that I'll have to put up with going online just to play in the single player mode is really annoying.I know many people are saying that complaining about launch day problems is dumb, but remember this is not just an issue you'll have on launch day.", "Don't get me wrong, when you're actually able to play the game it looks very nice and I think it could be fun, but as of now I just don't know, and the thought that I'll have to put up with going online just to play in the single player mode is really annoying.I know many people are saying that complaining about launch day problems is dumb, but remember this is not just an issue you'll have on launch day.", 'I would expected better after all the time they took to bring this game online considering the first launch date was moved from 2006 but none the less still good.', 'DO NOT BUY.Edited Review:About a week after launch, the servers are fairly stable now.']
column4: ['This game at launch was very typical of Activision/Blizzard (SP?)', 'All that in the launch and the first week or so of the game is very typical of any "Blizzard" game.', 'made a few "promises" and at launch failed to deliver all of them and even now with all the updates still have a few "promises" they have yet to deliver.That being said it was still a fun game to me.', "Server Issues - I didn't buy it at launch, so I can't say anything about the initial server overload mess.", 'I waited to buy this game because of all the launch issues it was having.', 'Ever;- Never buy ANY game until a couple of months have passed since launch date.', 'Instead of preparing for the launch and overcompensating for the huge demand, Blizzard chose to go the bare minimum route to see just how few servers they could get away with to run the game.', 'There has only been one night since launch that I have been unable to play due to the server being down; however, your mileage may vary.', 'Difficulty levels vs. classes are completely dis-balanced.Diablo 3 sold over 6 mil at launch, the sales that are solely based on the promise and reputation of the past games.', "But with Diablo 3, I didn't bother to read Amazon's reviews thinking the low ratings were the result of angry gamers reacting to online issues that are normal with the launch of major games.", 'If you were one of the thousands of people who skipped work to play on launch day you got a nice 6 hour break in the middle of the day when your game was unplayable.', 'Servers being crap on launch week = Horrible, but forgivable.', 'Unstable servers: Its only been 2 weeks since launch, but the servers have been down for maintenance at least 5 times already.', 'I mean, as their crash-n-burn launch was happening, literally, their message from the Blizzard team on their website was regarding how the real-money auction house was delayed for few weeks.....really?', "This isn't a one star game even if the launch was problematic.", 'Every game has people like that, who race through the game and beat it the day after launch and complain about everything in between (eventhough they skipped through all the dialogue and ran straight to the objectives).', "But frankly, the bumpy launch due to this feature notwithstanding, this doesn't bother me one bit.", 'The launch of the game was rocky, they had to restart the servers several times, and bring them down for patches.', 'Not only were the servers screwed up on launch day, not allowing anyone on until about 4pm eastern time, but anytime their servers are clogged, your SINGLE PLAYER game gets lagged an unplayable.', "The randomly generated dungeons are absent (short of the possibility to launch 'events' which are short random fights) leaving you to slog through the exact same content over and over again.", 'Because I began playing the game about four days after launch date.', "Let's face it, Diablo 3 had a TERRIBLE launch.", 'The servers went through a multitude of problems on launch day, the day after launch, a few rolling restarts and server/game crashes.', 'The servers went through a multitude of problems on launch day, the day after launch, a few rolling restarts and server/game crashes.', 'People are not rating this game on game play but on launch date.', "I will try to express my disappointment and concern because I believe this game is a clear beacon as to to where video game developers are heading as of late, and a blatant case of how a company becomes so arrogant that it manages to neglect all inputs and feedback from its loyal fan base.So let's start with one of the biggest gripes people have had: the launch day fiasco.", 'But no, the had all the data, all the experience and all the means of supporting the launch for the game, and they miserably failed at it.', 'For what it is this game should have been much, much cheaper at launch.', 'I decided to give in (perhaps inspired by seeing a card at gamestop where you can buy and get the down-loadable copy of the game) and i ended up buyin the game on battle.net in hopes to play it when it launched just to be part of the "launch experience" so to speak.', "Yes, I had some of the problems that others had getting into the game and yes Blizzard, requiring a constant internet connection to play DOES INDEED SUCK, but it's the first day of launch and one of the most anticipated PC games since the LAST Starcraft game is back to suck time out of our hands once again.I remember getting a hold of Diablo II back in 2002 to play while I was out sick and it dominated my life for nearly 4 months and in that time, I had to upgrade my PC twice so that it would run properly.", 'I am not reacting to the bad launch.', 'I have never been soooooo disappointed in all my gaming days as I have been with this launch and gameplay of Diablo 3.']

column2: ["Let's chalk this one off as ...tribute.GRINDING BUILDS CHARACTER.The bad news is that it builds exactly the same kind of character for everyone.", 'There is no choice when creating your character, everyone is exactly the same.', "I don't want to rehash what everyone else has been saying, but for a decent brain-dead time waster it would be worth $15-$20 bucks.", "It isn't perfect but its damn better than 98% of the crap on the market today.You can't please everyone in this life.", "Then, everyone who has great gear and/or gold to sell will pvp'ers tripping over themselves to 'gear up'.", "I know everyone seems to be in agony because this game didn't turn out as they'd hoped, but I find the game actually pretty awesome.", "It is in Blizzard's best interests to make good items hard to get, because if everyone can get them on their own no one will sell them in the RMAH and Blizzard will not receive its commissions.", "Absolutely, and given Blizzard's reputation for perfection (everyone forgets Rock'n'Roll Racing) that may cost it more points than it would another game.", "I had a lot of fun chatting with my followers and getting to know their backstories, and everyone knows the Jeweler is just plain awesome.Admittedly, the story isn't perfect.", "mind you that is today, I can't imagine 4-5 years from now.-bosses only drop loot the first time you kill them, no matter what the mode of difficulty-inferno isn't fun, 1 shotted from off screen = not fun, 1 shotted from everything = not fun, it's not even challenging, it's just stupid-once you hit inferno act 1, be prepared to farm farm farm for cash before you can progress to act 2...for days-character growth/scaling is insane...at level 50 you are using a 200 dmg weapon i believe, by 55 500, by 60 1600. the scaling makes no sense, why linear growth the entire game until the end then exponential.-max character level is only 60, you are 60 long before you beat inferno, this appears to be a decision late in the development process which i imagine contributes to the terrible character scaling in the 50s.-most classes get their best abilities by 20, ...why-auction house constantly down/very laggy-some classes (DH, Monk) are WAY better than others at the moment, this can only lead to character normalization or everyone playing the same class.", 'And most of the 1 star reviews are also fans of diablo 2, but dont like it since its more of a "mainstream" game thats tailored to everyone instead of being some "hardcore" oldschool game from the 90\'s that they all grew up on.', 'I was big fan of Blizzard, I practically grew up playing their games and saw how they came up from being my favorite "small video game company" to this titan corporation on the market, and I couldn\'t be happier.However, is very apparent to everyone that is not completely blinded by their fanatism for Blizzard, or lacks one cent of objectivity, that Blizzard has transformed into this 100% profit seeking-board pleasing corporation with no other priority other than making as much money as possible no mather what.', 'Really have no idea what everyone is complaining about, this is a great game.',
