(read below)Lots of good loot.You can revive alliesThe game isnt as linear as several claimNo loot hogging, loot appears only on the individuals screenThe game is fairly long.Normal mode is challengingGreat boss battlesYou never know how bad a group of monsters will be.', "I'm no fan boy, just being realistic from a business perspective.In the end, the game is great, fun and full of enough loot to choke on.", 'If you love dungeon crawling, loot and a solid story telling experience pick the game up.', "It's still fun to prowl the dungeon with your friends, mowing down monsters and incrementally supping up your character with better loot.", 'You can find and manufacture gems that give bonuses to your stats (basic stats or other stats like your % chance to find magical loot or bonus XP per kill).', 'The auction house is gone and the loot is far more enjoyable.', 'With the new loot system, you will get equipment that changes the way your skills behave.', "The music is dark and ominous, the sounds of battle are sharp and exciting, and the happy noise of picking up some loot is always welcome.Overall, this is not just a game, it's an experience."]
column4: ['You can play multiple different character classes, basically as a warrior (Barbarian class in Diablo), or a mage, a combination, etc.Over time I found myself sucked into this game to see what cool new loot (weapons and armor) I could acquire, and I increased the difficulty to increase the challenge.', "There is just something about the hellish/demonic angle of the game, the utter fun of hacking'n'slashing all these demons into a red gooey mess with body parts flying everywhere and of course the shiny loot gathering.", 'I think part of that has to do with how terrible the loot is.', "95% of the loot you find is worse than the same equipment you found ages ago and 99% of the loot is for a different class then you're playing.", "95% of the loot you find is worse than the same equipment you found ages ago and 99% of the loot is for a different class then you're playing.", 'I do NOT recommend this game as it is an endless cycle of poorly designed loot tables.', 'This is really a game for people who want loot.', 'Why do you want this loot so bad?', "Personally I think I would just play my humble random drop builds in perpetuity before I'd pay in-game-gold or real money for loot necessary to keep playing.", 'But that\'s just me.I still don\'t know if I\'m going to get into the game enough to play over and over and over to get the "bestest loot ever".', 'For a loot based game, the loot sucks.', 'For a loot based game, the loot sucks.', 'These people, for the most part, work out places like Korea and China, dedicating untold hours to grinding the game in order to gather their loot which they then sell at premium prices to those too ignorant or desperate to know better than to buy them.This game was fundamentally flawed in the way it was developed, released, and is now currently being managed.', "But don't think that automatic stat point distribution leaves the theorycrafters out in the cold because individual stats can still be buffed with +stat gear which gives loot drops added value that was missing from previous games.", 'Even the handful of areas with fixed borders have many random elements within, such as the placement of monsters (of course; the loot they drop is also randomized), treasure chests, random cave and dungeon entrances, and events.', 'You cannot progress in the game by relying on loot drops.', 'However, the other specialist is the Armor/Weapon Smith... he turns out to be a TOTAL waste of time because the stuff he can make for you is almost ALWAYS sub par over what you can find in the loot from your battles.', "I often find myself randomly running around in circles as I'm trying to click on enemies that are moving or clicking on the ground to loot.", 'The whole point of the game is to GRIND for loot and work your way through the higher difficulties, so this AH defeats the purpose of the game.', "It is our goal to literally collect every-single-unique-item in a given game, and Diablo has, historically, been our Grail among Grails.Many others have expanded on the points of always on DRM, small parties, excessive downtime, and the auction house, so I'll skip those - I'm writing from the perspective of a single-player who isn't bothered with the need to be online all the time, one who isn't bothered with pings, or downtimes, or even with the gear-check requirements of the upper difficulty levels.The only reason I play ARPGs is to collect loot - because let's face it - gameplay mechanics in ARPGs aren't going to win any rewards.", 'As soon as the loot drops from elites or bosses in the game, this is where your focus goes towards.', "They can't help you with loot storage or sell your crap items for you.", 'Unfortunately the loot distribution and balancing in Diablo 3 is broken atm.', "My experience with this game has been first rate and I've really gotten addicted to exploring the game and finding new loot.", 'There is less loot overall in nightmare and NO rare loot on end bosses.', 'There is less loot overall in nightmare and NO rare loot on end bosses.', 'Yes, loot drops are random and yes, some aspects of the dungeons are random as well, but if you are not into loot hunting and auction house whoring-the game could lose its appeal.', 'Yes, loot drops are random and yes, some aspects of the dungeons are random as well, but if you are not into loot hunting and auction house whoring-the game could lose its appeal.', "Elites and even regular mobs will kick your ass unless you upgrade your very quickly.To make matters worse the game PUNISHES YOU for playing co-op on Inferno, the already disgustingly difficult mobs become near godly and unless you and your friends are supremely geared it's going to be an excruciating exercise in futility.Problem is that 95% of the loot you get in Inferno is literally garbage, so bad that even the NPC vendors will be reluctant to accept them.", '!As stated Inferno is so ridiculously difficult and the loot generally so bad that the ONLY WAY to progress is to use the Auction House.I only managed to beat the game by bidding low gold on items and shopping intelligently, but it took wayyyy longer than it should have.', "The difficulty is absurd at inferno, many of the bosses are basically gear-checks (can only be beaten with certain amounts of DPS) and the loot is so bad that you have no choice but to use the Auction House.This game is a money grab, it's pay to win, and I'm not sticking around for when they implement Player vs.", 'The entire point of the game is getting loot, not doing quests.', "So it's both a surprise and perhaps a little bit expected that their third instalment in the Diablo saga is slightly disjointed.The game recipe is pretty much the same, the ingredients therein are also more or less the same; reign destruction upon enemies, loot - rinse and repeat.", 'The fanbois and blizz will say you need to farm prior content, but this is complete bs since nightmare loot is crap and not even close enough to what you need to make it in inferno.', "No, we're forced to have ALL of our chat functions in a single frame that is constantly drowned out by loot spam and NPC chattering.", 'Tons of loot as expected.', 'And as a player you will be forced to use the auction house if you want to progress, because loot you can use is about as common as finding hundred dollar bills laying on the ground.Lastly, the game shipped with exploits and dupes and gosh knows how many economy breaking bugs...', "For a game where you kill creatures and collect loot, you'd expect that you could just pay sixty bucks and do so.", "I can only think of a handful of other titles in the past couple of decades that I felt this strongly about) at this point.This is the largest failure of the single player portion of a game due to technical reasons (note: not game design ones, I've seen enough in the Beta which was playable to know that it's an average action-RPG, hack, slash, loot, that's what they're all about) that I have ever seen."]

column2: ['Hint: use the Auction House while you still can.The only thing I found missing is the ability to add sockets to magical items and enchant regular ones.THE AUCTION HOUSE: BRILLIANT!', 'I did like the new gem ability which will raise stats of items significantly.', 'Fine, but what it also does is limit your ability to play a product you paid for, you cannot play if you have no internet connection, if the servers are down or out, or your connection is not "stable"  (NZ and Australian players know this fact!).', 'with everyones stats the same per character and the ability to change skills to anything you want it really make characters differ only by the gear they wear.', 'I don\'t get a sense like i did in D2 that this is "my unique character build".- replay ability ( i fear that once i level up about 3-4 different characters there will be no need for me to start a new "build" of the same class with different stats, skills b/c i can just change or upate the skills of my current character)  something i did countless times in Diablo 2- can only handle 4 players in multiplayer (D2 had 8)Overall still very fun and i feel blizzard is really committed to making everything balanced and feels right no matter what skills you are trying to use.', 'I really enjoy the companions and ability to hop in and play with friends who are Battlenet friends.', "Wish there wasn't such a long cooldown on the Barbarian's leaping ability, which would have made him more of a contender), which is good, because I don't really have a problem picking a distance character or a hand to hand character to compliment whomever I'm playing with at the time.", "Additionally, I apparently get a lot of information from the servers because I have had beasts 'teleport' (not the special ability) from one side of the screen to the other.", 'The ability to get into some action quickly and start gathering loot is very satisfying.', 'To paraphrase:  We do not guarantee the ability to actually be able to play the game.', 'If you are of moderate ability as far as gaming goes you can expect to finish the story within 7 hours at most.', 'Do they not understand we want MORE ability to create out own custom characters?']
column4: ['But obviously if you lack connectivity or have a connectivity issue the "always on" requirement will indeed affect your ability to play the game.', 'Other things lost that are being demanded by fans to be brought back are a way to ID all things in stash (which was recently patched in after a year of demands), a weapon swap ability, interconnected waypoints through acts, ability to make named games in battle net, ability to fight previous bosses without having to back out of a game to start a game on that specific quest, PVP, etc.While some of those things may not matter much to everyone, there is one thing that should and that is PVP.', 'Other things lost that are being demanded by fans to be brought back are a way to ID all things in stash (which was recently patched in after a year of demands), a weapon swap ability, interconnected waypoints through acts, ability to make named games in battle net, ability to fight previous bosses without having to back out of a game to start a game on that specific quest, PVP, etc.While some of those things may not matter much to everyone, there is one thing that should and that is PVP.', 'Other things lost that are being demanded by fans to be brought back are a way to ID all things in stash (which was recently patched in after a year of demands), a weapon swap ability, interconnected waypoints through acts, ability to make named games in battle net, ability to fight previous bosses without having to back out of a game to start a game on that specific quest, PVP, etc.While some of those things may not matter much to everyone, there is one thing that should and that is PVP.', 'Demon Hunter for the long range sniping and shooting ability.', 'Between Blizzard\'s constant patches that "fix" the game (which actually make it less and less enjoyable with each new "fix"), server downtime that affects your ability to play any part of the game (including single player), and the diminishing player base, the game has become a stressful time sink that I wish I had never wasted a penny on.', 'Give me a break.You can finish the game in normal mode in a day or two, just to have the ability to play it in nightmare mode from the beginning again.', 'Instead it\'s left to the player to try out the abilities and their subtle changes with the "runes" that changes the way the ability acts or plays.', 'No replayability.I guess we can face it that this is an action game with customizable armor, but where apparently the physical damage of a held weapon determines your ability to shoot fire and lighting from your palms.', "The tinkering of an always on, always patched game become apparent.If you didn't dislike a lot about this game already, the unavoidable re-balancing, modifications of characters, and the lack of any sort of in-game update to ability descriptions should definitely put you off.", 'There is very little exploration you can do except for on the world maps, and even then there are blockades that need to be unlocked as part of some quest or another, limited your ability to explore.OVERALL=======It is still a fun game but very disappointing in many ways.', "Understanding the game, its mechanics and its horrible DRM scheme are critical to your enjoyment - and even your ability to play.I'll dissect the game in categories for easy readability.", 'Being a Diablo 1 fan originally, this was hard for me to swallow at first, but now I think its for the best.Instead of being childish about being unable to play without online DRM etc, why not invest in ATVI stock and directly benefit for the increased sales as a result of the lack of the ability to pirate the game.', 'The story is poorly composed, and the gameplay is clearly targeting people of low ability as far as gaming go.Like many people say, this is a $40 game with a $60 price tag.']

column2: ['Someone needs to tell marketers, just because a castle sells on Ebay from Ultima Online some years back for a grand, does not mean that millions of gamers who buy games without monthly fees will buy virtual items for real money.', "There are some characters you can't make and some items you cannot use without the expansion, but still very playable now.", 'LOOT NEVER CHANGES.Well designed and clearly labeled items make all the difference in the world.', 'I would love for Borderlands 2 items to have such a clear Damager-Per-Second (DPS) number to make comparisons easier.', 'Pair this with an inventory that is big enough and free of the need to play item-Tetris in (all items take up either one or two vertical squares) and you have yourself almost loot haven.', 'Almost because you still get too many unusable items, mostly because of class restrictions.You can stash such items in your common stash to share with your other heroes (on the same BattleNet account) but make sure to find the necessary...700,000 gold to pay for all the extra stash space.', 'Almost because you still get too many unusable items, mostly because of class restrictions.You can stash such items in your common stash to share with your other heroes (on the same BattleNet account) but make sure to find the necessary...700,000 gold to pay for all the extra stash space.', 'Hint: use the Auction House while you still can.The only thing I found missing is the ability to add sockets to magical items and enchant regular ones.THE AUCTION HOUSE: BRILLIANT!', 'And I have heard the complaints that it is impossible to finish Inferno without Real-Money Auction House (which is clearly not how it is supposed to work) but up to Nightmare, using the Auction House is the only way to get enough money to be able to do the enhancements you want, craft or buy the items you covet and unlock the precious extra stash space you need.CHAINS IN NEED OF BREAKINGI withheld the second star because of the always-online requirement.', "What hasn't changed is the core of the game, skills and items which is where the problem is for D3.First off, if you played Diablo 2 and are looking at Diablo 3 for some more of that great stuff, look somewhere else.", 'You dont find your best items, you buy them on the AH.', "Playing lower level characters hasn't yielded many legnedary items whatsoever.", 'I have 2 tabs in my stash full of low level rare items, but a majority of them are 13-37 weapons and 10-282 armor.', 'I dont understand though why "people" would use ACTUAL real currency to "buy" ingame items.', 'The weapons are better (I have Legendary items from pre v2.0 that have worse stats than the rares I get now) and the armor and weapons you get are more tuned for your character.', 'The quests are remarkably standard and while crafting was available, we were locked out of using items we crafted unless we hit an arbitrary level.', "And so, people are almost forced to buy and sell items through the RMAH (I myself bought something for $45 like a sucker, because I was so frustrated one day that I wasn't finding anything decent in my many rare runs, even with 190% magic find).", 'I tried selling dozens of rare items throughout my play through and only sold one for $1.25.', "The penalty isn't very severe with just 10% durability of all your equipped items taken away, but you can always repair it at a town center.", "I didn't even craft any items really which is a shame.", 'I did like the new gem ability which will raise stats of items significantly.', 'and the drops, especially in inferno are plentiful - a run to Kill Azmodovan with a decent magic find, will net you around 30 or so yellow items, and around 50+ blue items.', 'and the drops, especially in inferno are plentiful - a run to Kill Azmodovan with a decent magic find, will net you around 30 or so yellow items, and around 50+ blue items.', 'Maybe 5 of those 1000 items were good for other classes and might be worth selling in the AH.', 'A clear upgrade over what I have, would be one of the set items, that people sell for 150+ million on the AH.', "I know the other games repeated themselves also but playing through them was still fun somehow it's not nearly as fun playing through this game.Another thing that bothers me is blizzard continually comes out with new and better items to make sure they make money on their real world auction house.", 'I cannot image how much money they make creating new items to make all of the current ones obsolete.', 'Also it felt like Blizzard just wanted you to purchase items using real currency out of their auction house and every update seemed to limit the kind of items you received.', 'Also it felt like Blizzard just wanted you to purchase items using real currency out of their auction house and every update seemed to limit the kind of items you received.', 'I felt like I spent half of my time getting the best items and not playing the game.', 'When I replied, another CSR replied back and responded to me as if I was using the gold AH and told me they cannot recover any items and they cannot proceed with any action.', "It is extremely fun, and I would recommend it for the casual gamer.The Good:1) Great graphics.2) Waypoints are nice to cut down on travel time so that once you reach a location there is way to get back to the town.3) You get followers on the single player game that help you fight.4) Very fun to go to new locations and meet interesting monsters and kill them.The not so good or why there are some negative reviews.1) They should probably put in some random mazes and items so that if you want to replay the game, you don't go through the same mazes.2) They decided to make inferno impossible to play and make an auction house where you need to spend real money to buy items which may still not let you win the game.I doubt I will even try inferno or spend real money on items.", "It is extremely fun, and I would recommend it for the casual gamer.The Good:1) Great graphics.2) Waypoints are nice to cut down on travel time so that once you reach a location there is way to get back to the town.3) You get recommend it for the casual gamer.The Good:1) Great graphics.2) Waypoints are nice to cut down on travel time so that once you reach a location there is way to get back to the town.3) You get followers on the single player game that help you fight.4) Very fun to go to new locations and meet interesting monsters and kill them.The not so good or why there are some negative reviews.1) They should probably put in some random mazes and items so that if you want to replay the game, you don't go through the same mazes.2) They decided to make inferno impossible to play and make an auction house where you need to spend real money to buy items which may still not let you win the game.I doubt I will even try inferno or spend real money on items.", 'However, aside from higher difficulty, different items, and tougher monsters, there is really no difference.', 'The problem with finding good to great items are the affixes.', 'Legendary items are a joke, something to point and laugh at.', 'For them to make money, they have to make it hard to find the items with great properties.', 'Plus, how are you going to win against a class that pays for their gold to get good items compare to your dinky MF items?', 'Plus, how are you going to win against a class that pays for their gold to get good items compare to your dinky MF items?', 'The drops in Diablo 3 have become extremely rare to get anything good, which means you need to go to the auction house to get halfway decent items.', 'YOU will not find any items worthwhile, your only bet to get great gear is playing the stock market aka auction house.', "Either you have the appropriate gear and items to fight or you've run up against a wall and need to buy something extra in the auction house.", 'Using this brilliant feature you can buy items for up to $250 to help you beat a game you already beat 3 times.', ")You get cool followers in single player mode.You get tons of cool spells/moves and passive skills, and they are easy to use and customize.Potions and gems stack, you get better gems, and you can reuse gems.You can improve your blacksmith, jeweler, and stash.New classes make gameplay more interesting.You can redo any quest you did already.You can sell your old items in the auction house.You can carry and stash more stuff than in Diablo 2.Cons__________Can't play offline.", 'Playing as a demon hunter is really fun, and I highly recommend that class.If you buy this game, get items with resist all elements.', 'I can count on one hand, the number of useful items I found while leveling up.', "It is in Blizzard's best interests to make good items hard to get, because if everyone can get them on their own no one will sell them in the RMAH and Blizzard will not receive its commissions.", 'Gone are the nice unique items.', 'You have to pay gold to level the blacksmith, you have to breakdown magic items (rather than sell them) to get materials to make the items, and then you have to pay each time you craft an item, and you may get complete junk for your money and trouble.', 'You have to pay gold to level the blacksmith, you have to breakdown magic items (rather than sell them) to get materials to make the items, and then you have to pay each time you craft an item, and you may get complete junk for your money and trouble.', "Really enjoyed the game, had a 4 man group and we stuck together the whole time.The game itself is a lot of fun, it's just at the end can start feeling unrewarding.My suggestion is if your a blizz fanboy like me, if you do buy the game, tear it up however simply ignore the real money auction house,the prices for items are more than the cost of the game itself.Simply get as far as you can and grind your ass off and try to make the best use out of the gold AH.I'd almost say wait for the price to drop if you don't absolutely have to play it NOW, maybe they will throw in some changes to help the game out.", 'What stats you should gear for, what skills to use, etc.They have consistently let exploiters go unpunished, while at the same time nerfing legitimate player builds citing that they are too powerful.The economy is so inflated due to only being able to post 10 items every 3 days on the auction house.', 'I could have driven 5 minutes to my local game store to buy the disk version.My conclusion: Blizzard is deceptive and greedy, just as so many other reviewers on this site are saying: Blizzard allows items in the Auction House to be so inflated that it is extremely hard to earn enough gold to buy the good gear.', 'The items come in normal and superior (white lettered items); Magic (blue lettered items); Rare (yellow lettered items); Legendary (green OR brown lettered items).', 'The items come in normal and superior (white lettered items); Magic (blue lettered items); Rare (yellow lettered items); Legendary (green OR brown lettered items).', 'The items come in normal and superior (white lettered items); Magic (blue lettered items); Rare (yellow lettered items); Legendary (green OR brown lettered items).', 'The items come in normal and superior (white lettered items); Magic (blue lettered items); Rare (yellow lettered items); Legendary (green OR brown lettered items).', 'The items come in normal and superior (white lettered items); Magic (blue lettered items); Rare (yellow lettered items); Legendary (green OR brown lettered items).', 'The white lettered items are pretty much junk... the blue items are where the value starts, yellow is better yet, and the green & brown ones in theory are the best.The frustration with the game comes in several flavors.', 'The white lettered items are pretty much junk... the blue items are where the value starts, yellow is better yet, and the green & brown ones in theory are the best.The frustration with the game comes in several flavors.', 'All the game maker would have had to do to make the Smith useful is ALLOW you to SPECIFY that the item you want concentrates on for example, Intelligence and Vitality, along with "find more gold" and/or "find more magic items", which are some of the myriad choices that weapons and armor can have bestowed on them.', "That is, you have to bid to get the items, and of course, all the hot items are bid up so fast it's absolutely impossible for you to compete, as there could be many bidders typing in bids while you are trying to figure out what to increase your offer to... the frustration really is needling because the Auction House DOES NOT UPDATE THE PRICE when other bidders are banging on the same product.", "That is, you have to bid to get the items, and of course, all the hot items are bid up so fast it's absolutely impossible for you to compete, as there could be many bidders typing in bids while you are trying to figure out what to increase your offer to... the frustration really is needling because the Auction House DOES NOT UPDATE THE PRICE when other bidders are banging on the same product.", 'A sub-frustration is you can try to sell "good" items yourself, but you can only post up to 10 items.', 'A sub-frustration is you can try to sell "good" items yourself, but you can only post up to 10 items.', 'This was done to force as many people as possible to make cash purchases of items.', "A Grailer is a person who plays specifically to hunt unique items (the 'Holy Grails' of ARPGs) - In D3 terms, that would be Legendaries, Sets, and even Magic Items with their own flavor text.", "There should be some 'unique' items that offer unique stats that would allow for some players to build entire character to capitalize on said items.", "There should be some 'unique' items that offer unique stats that would allow for some players to build entire character to capitalize on said items.", "This is especially true for those level 60 'end-game' items in Diablo 3, because of the fact that with the paired down character stats in Diablo 3 - that 800 DPS facemelt one-handed sword you find for your Barb in Act 2 Inferno, will be just as effective for your Wizard in Act 4 Hell, or your Witch Doctor the second he hits level 60.", "Once you hit level 60, it doesn't really matter what the ilvls of items are - because you are now able to use any item in the game - and that level 60 legendary you just found just isn't going to compete mathematically with 95% of the random blue drops that litter the battlefield.3.", 'Of course, 99% of the time it would be a Nagelring, but the rings were still dropping, and that little boost is all it took to keep you motivated to keep hunting.Unfortunately, for the item hunter, the only things the collector has to look forward to are items with some unique models couple with soul-crushing drop rates.', 'Then it became the sale of in-game vanity items for real cash, in a game that already charges $40 for an expansion every 2 years on top of the existing $15 monthly fee.In Starcraft 2, there was surprisingly very little milking of the product on the surface.', "Not only that, but the magical properties of many of your items are randomly generated so you don't even know if your time and effort will create something your character really benefits from.9.)", 'every item no matter what it is, rare, set, legendary, just gets random + stats...could be int on a sword, some bows come with +stats to witch doctor weapons-no armor types, any class can wear any type of armor, it changes depending on whose holding it - LAME-legendary items can have worse stats than blues of the same level - ???????????????', 'You need to kill elites in order to get the items that you really need to kill THOSE elites.....', "Even so, I've done countless MF runs and pretty much 99% of the items I find, I can't really use.", 'Due to the fact that theres 4 difficulty modes, 5 character classes, millions of items to loot, and an upcoming pvp patch, I think its safe to say this will give me something to do in my downtime over the summer,into winter, and probably into next summer as well :)And as for the mixed reviews, just ignore them :) Most of the 5 stars are just fanboys who LOVE anything related to diablo 2.', 'So many items dropped, so few worth… anything.', 'And forget selling mediocre off class items on the AH; they were abundant there, and no one was buying.-----------------------------------------------------------So why didn’t Blizzard just improve the drop rate?', 'Magic items are better than items of higher rarity because they have an inherently much higher dps.', 'Magic items are better than items of higher rarity because they have an inherently much higher dps.', "Oh, but ya, you're decent items will likely be selling for real world cash now.", "One of the best PC series is back and after several years there's finally a sequel, I've played this game the past 2 weeks and left my PS3 forgotten hehe, but the truth is Blizzard really know how to make gaming fun even after you finished the game and the game was a great addition to the legacy, here are my thoughts:Gameplay:Great, all classes have been enhanced and improved and there's a lot to discover and several hours fun you will get not just by beating the game but by leveling up, gaining new skills, combining these new skills to build up the perfect set of techniques for each battle, even with the same class the skills you select make you fight and play in several different ways and of course the armor and weapons, you will fin yourself playing for hours and hours just to find the next great addition to your swords collection or that nice looking helm that boosts up your strength, etc.. And of course, then the difficulties will make you want the play the game all over again to gain more items, armor, money, skills, etc.. and prove yourself as a grand hero.", "Multiplayer experience is great too and simple, your friends can join your game or you can join theirs and play both together with the same or even more fun, you can also join public games or make your game public to party with other people, your loot is your own and you won't have any issues with anyone, in fact you will end up trading and buying\\selling items in the Auction House and it is fun.", "You can't clear act 2 content without act 3-4 gear on certain classes; this leads to the game being a gold grind inorder to purchase better items off the AH.All of these problems are fixable if blizzard wants to fix it.", 'This is to secure the auction house and keep the sales of items,"in" game safely.', "I've never planned to purchase items or gold with real money.", 'The major problem is that Blizzard has seen fit to design the game so that you will NEED to purchase items and gold from the AH in order to progress without some maddening gear grind that would take a lifetime.', 'Magic find increases the chances of getting yellow items, but chances are they are still crap.There are far too many possible attributes during item rolls, so as a result you will almost always get items which make no sense whatsoever (example: Wizard hat with Strength, or Barbarian sword with Intelligence, etc.)', 'Magic find increases the chances of getting yellow items, but chances are they are still crap.There are far too many possible attributes during item rolls, so as a result you will almost always get items which make no sense whatsoever (example: Wizard hat with Strength, or Barbarian sword with Intelligence, etc.)', "In normal mode you'll get most of the Gold items from bosses.", 'However, in Nightmare it seems like the bosses will only drop Blue items and the gold ones drop off of the Unique monsters.Normal Mode:  Easy until you venture out of the keep in Act III.', 'Dropping ALL of your items and gold whenever you died was unnecessarily punishing as a default option (as a selectable option, sure, but no choice?', "You are no longer subjected to having to wear or use items that aren't exactly what you want.", 'You have no need for items that vendors provide and even those are magical.', 'Instead, the rare drops are actually regular weapons and items with no magical capabilities whatsoever.', 'This was done by Blizzard primarily to limit item duping, because Diablo 3 will soon feature a real money auction house -- that is, an auction house where players can sell their items for real world currency instead of in-game currency.', 'The graphics and soundtrack, though, are very good and the cut scenes are enjoyable to watch even if they\'re just the standard RPG "save the world" nonsense.The crafting is a nice addition and I\'ve gotten several good yellow items by leveling this up instead of just buying stuff from vendors.', "Obviously it will happen as there is only a finite number of combinations, but the number of combinations possible for each item is so large that in practical terms you won't see identical items.", 'Mainly due to oversimplification of the aspects that made prior games so successful, including character customization (skills and items) and story.', 'Similarly, the story seems to be a generic repeat of prior games.All (items, quests) seems to be delivered too fast for me to actually care of the objective or the outcome.', 'Of course, you can be sure that you will ultimately find some great items, but this may require some extra real money using the auction house done for this very purpose.Server DependencySo, there will be instances you are not able to play the game.', "Right now, I'm totally stuck since my items aren't findable, and I can't cancel anything, so I have to wait 40 hours for things to timeout.I'm sure that the current one-star experience will gradually ascend to a four-star level, so I'm giving two stars to be fair.", "* No Town Portal Scrolls, no ID scrolls(You still have to right click to ID Legendary and Rare items, but no longer do you have to waste inventory to do so, like in the Beta)* Achievements to up the replay value after you've gotten past Diablo 3 on Inferno with all 5 characters.", 'You get the standard Soundtrack, Art Book, the making of Diablo 2, but the items that stand out, you get Angelic Wings, which make your characters stand out, you get a unique banner and sigil(If you played in the Beta), Diablo Skull and 4GB Soulstone Flash Drive glows red when in your computer!', '* No guild halls with a stash, again, a great feature that would make it easier to give items to people in different time zones.', "They'll either fix it (I hope and imagine) or after people have beat the game, and no longer want to sell items for a million gold two days after release (the economy is going down fast in this game... way too many resources, no gold sinks, use and sell rares, recover every gem you've ever made...)If you have the money to spare, and want to support a once brilliant company that has been bought out and is all about the money now, go ahead.", "Much of the fun does derive from leveling (read: grinding) and item collection (who doesn't still love to collect rare, unique, and now legendary items?).BAD===1.", ')Yes, the way that you switch between skills is very cumbersome and involves opening up a skills window and then clicking on various tabs to select different skills and their runes (which are not physical items either) that was not intuitive at all at the beginning, and even when you get used to it still prevents easy switching of skills.', 'The fact that most magic items are pre-identified or able to be identified with a simple click takes away the excitement...', "I'll update specifics in the sections below, but a couple key points are a) a lot of my negative first impressions turned positive as I adjusted to the changes in gameplay / mechanics b) the skills and items REALLY open up and gain depth as you gain levels... much more so than in D1 or D2, and in ways you don't really anticipate at the lower levels.", "I'm hoping this changes as I get higher up and rely more on unique items, but then I have to worry that I'll be crippled if I don't shell out real money on the auction house.", "I'm in the fourth act of the game now and most of my gear is Rare items -- still waiting to see if Set or Unique items exist (or Epic / Legendary, like in WoW).", "I'm in the fourth act of the game now and most of my gear is Rare items -- still waiting to see if Set or Unique items exist (or Epic / Legendary, like in WoW).", 'At higher levels, you have to do special quests or get special items to continue crafting better gear.', 'Hope some patches will fix some of the issues like some problems with AH items loading an easier search text feature and better fonts.but i will say this.', "For a time, I played on Battle.net, and eventually collected some good items and had a fairly strong onlne character, but eventually I hated it (thanks to Blizzard's management and policies which did not allow you to host a non-P2P online game, and server lags from time to time).", 'Bid on too high priced items and buy out lower ones.', 'Most are trolling the AH to buy low priced items to re-auction them for higher prices.', "BUT, you can take all your gold and try to find an over priced upgrade on the Auction House, a place where you will compete with hundreds of auction house farmers that sit lurking for reasonably listed items they can buy instantly to relist for a 100x markup... Oh, you could do this too of course, if you don't mind drudging through a spreadsheet seeking items to buy and resell... Sound like fun?", "BUT, you can take all your gold and try to find an over priced upgrade on the Auction House, a place where you will compete with hundreds of auction house farmers that sit lurking for reasonably listed items they can buy instantly to relist for a 100x markup... Oh, you could do this too of course, if you don't mind drudging through a spreadsheet seeking items to buy and resell... Sound like fun?", "That name use to mean great games, now all it means to me is frusteration from server problems, failed releases, blown WOTLK and Cata xpacks, LFR looters that win multiple items and vendor the extras, and oh.. don't forget the automated macro responses you get if you ever email them for help.. What did they ever do with the nice game masters that use to work there?I remember when I first started playing WoW...."]
column4: ['+ Graphics+ Gameplay+ Items+ Character customization- Higher difficulties are not fun at all- Had my account hackedThis game starts off as a ton of fun if you are into these sorts of mindless clicking and killing and picking up items games, especially if your friends are into it also.', 'People play hours and hours a day only to get pathetic items and scrap them.', 'Its boring there are millions of add bots spamming the chat channel this is not a game this is a marketing program for ingame items.', "RMAH being withheld from the Hardcore server was a move where Blizzard chose to not deal with annoyed customers over money - a genuinely greedy company wouldn't of cared, wouldn't of passed out on the cash cow that RMAH HC could be.Secondly, being mad that someone who works the 9 to 5 and wants to spend some of their hard earned cash on a few items (or more) to make them feel more powerful in game is just insane.", 'OP class and can make it easier for you to level other toons or transfer items from your main.Overall: I give it 5 stars for graphics and 3 for gameplay', 'Higher levels are impossible without buying expensive items from the auction house.', 'The game is still currently, "unless I have time to play 8 hours a day or buy a bot (automated program that plays the game for you), I have to pay real money to buy items from people who do play 8 hours a day or use bots all day.', 'Random stats on all items in the game?', 'In the past I kept getting items for other characters all the time.', 'And then I discovered that I had to play act 1 inferno literally hundreds of times in order to find the items necessary to advance past act 2, and I realized the repetitiveness only gets worse.', "And, of course, Blizzard takes 30% of every dollar spent in the RMAH, and so you realize how they are making their money.. not from selling millions of copies of a $50+ game, but from virtual items that don't actually exist.In the end, I found that I had wasted almost 100 hours of my time playing a video game that I hated.", "One thing I didn't do hardly at all was buy items.", 'So you try to buy gear to power through, AH is so expensive, so you sacrifice a lot of MF(magic find) and GF(gold find) to get a lot of + resist all and vitality items.', 'Now items needed cost, on average, $400,000,000.', "The major way you'll receive upgrades in this game is buy collecting gold/using real world money and buying items off their auction house, which leads me to my major complaint.Last week I decided to sell off all of my items and quit the game since it's not fun at all anymore (unlike Diablo 2, which was fun for over five years for me).", "The major way you'll receive upgrades in this game is buy collecting gold/using real world money and buying items off their auction house, which leads me to my major complaint.Last week I decided to sell off all of my items and quit the game since it's not fun at all anymore (unlike Diablo 2, which was fun for over five years for me).", "This means you'll spend countless hours farming to upgrade only to find that you've wasted days upon days only to get crappy items.", 'The highest and supposely best items in the game are the weakest and most pathetic items ever to be seen in a Diablo game.', 'The highest and supposely best items in the game are the weakest and most pathetic items ever to be seen in a Diablo game.', 'Your attributes are given and only affected by items, a grand detour from D2 and a bad decision imo.', 'Botters and farmers have driven prices in the auction house to insane levels where it costs 500 million gold or more for decent items, and the value of gold is dropping daily.', "This game doesn't have any layers because they want you to focus on buying the items and that's it.So there you go.", "I dont' see how they can do pvp with all the game breaking items there exists.", 'No end game content other than farm farm farm, sell your total junk items and hope to get enough money to maybe possibly eventually buy 1 item upgarde off the auction house.', 'A ladder system or PvP such as was introduced in D2 would alleviate this, but Blizzard prefers to invest time in their cash cow, the Real Money Auction House (RMAH).Which brings me to my final point, the game is custom designed to make good items hard to find so that players will be forced to resort to buying the items they need to proceed.', 'A ladder system or PvP such as was introduced in D2 would alleviate this, but Blizzard prefers to invest time in their cash cow, the Real Money Auction House (RMAH).Which brings me to my final point, the game is custom designed to make good items hard to find so that players will be forced to resort to buying the items they need to proceed.', 'The economy of the game is of course broken because the people with all the good items are the botters, hackers, exploiters, and cheaters who took advantage of loopholes and continue to take advantage of the game in order to profit.', 'Now the have "rare" items that are just as random, and just as often nothing but junk, with a few more stats.Game play is uninspired and, frankly, boring.', 'You can spend credits to level up the blacksmith to make items for you, but the item stats are random.', 'You could be a magic use, and get strength and dex items...or worse, small bonuses to XP, or gold drops.', 'You are online the whole time, if your router, a storm comes any sort of problem occurs, you cannot reverse it, your hardcore character is screwed!There are hackers who are depeleting people of their in-game money, hacking peoples accounts and changing login information, there are patches that make the game worse and there is also an auction where you purchase items for your character.', 'Its sad to see that these companies are not respecting anymore what customers want, they are making everything a business and putting down rules that break players freedom in enjoying the game.first there was the change in graphics, the toned down gore, the short story, the lag, the lag spikes, people filling up chat with ads from china, items becoming useless without buying from ah, problems with playing hardcore without being paranoid of blizzards servers, having to wait for maitenance periods.', 'The game is not fun at all, what is the motivation to buy items for a game that is not fun at all.What an utter and complete piece of crap they have developed.', 'Not only that, but it used to be considered cheating to buy items... Bad just bad.', "Normally I wouldn't mind this, especially in game like this where gear is king, but they have stated that the existence of the Auction House factored in the op rate of items (Since people would use the auction house to buy better gear, instead of farming it).", 'Chests, hidden cache, logs, etc may yield items and also gold.', 'The result is, you find stuff and think, "well, I can\'t use it for my Monk, but this might go with my Wizard (see, all items in the storage chest are totally sharable... including all the game gold you get)".', "Unfortunately, it's only after you've wasted hundreds of thousands in gold and special items that you finally figure out he is worthless.", "I was out millions of gold in items, 150,000 gold in definite gold lost from the roll back, a day lost on a character that I was working on, and the lame moderator just makes some snarky comments and says it's all taken care of now.", 'Meanwhile the items I did have depreciated badly because the economy changed so quickly.', "I didn't bother buying anything in the AH while I was playing this act so once I got to the final boss, I couldn't beat him with the crappy gear I had collected from drops so, I had to go to the AH and spend a few hours looking for items in order to beat him (buyout only auctions, I didn't feel like bidding and waiting 1 day to play this supposedly single player game).", 'Which i understand cause it prevents people hacking and cheating and selling items on the AH but at the same time i shouldnt be forced to play online to play a singleplayer game.', 'If all else fails, and collectible items simply have unique models (which is reason enough for some collector to go after them), they should at least be relatively common.', "big part of why my group is no longer playing-drm...you have to play on their laggy, unreliable servers, no hardcore until this is resolved-don't farm for item, buy them at the AH-implemented crafting system, that is worthless - buy your items at the AH-don't farm for gold, buy it at the AH-character customization is very limited, once you reach inferno your already limited customization is usually reduced to 1 build with MINOR variations-rune system is gone, yet even less customization-every class has about -+24 abilities, 1/3 of these are actually useful-some entire classes are just crap - hi witch doctor-inferno is pretty much just for ranged characters.", "i guess they partner with anyone that pays, because you can't tell me at this point in life they aren't aware of spammers, this is far from their first game.-no set bonuses, there are set items, but the bonuses are just normal bonuses like +25 str- itemization as a whole is terrible.", "They can't help you with loot storage or sell your crap items for you.", "it's bad enough when you discover rare items only to reveal them worthless, you will craft many weapons and pieces of armor and be just as disappointed.", "Because you can't survive even though you have so much health and resist, which was recommended to you for survivability, you now have to revert to building a glass cannon build and kite your **** off all day in order to get horrible items.", 'People who actually wanted to play the game were without enough gold to buy items needed to progress.', 'The farther you progress the worst the quality of the items dropped.', "The auction house goes down and is unavailable on a regular basis, and sometimes items you purchase don't get sent to you for up to 24-48 hours which is unacceptable when you need the item NOW for progression.", 'THAT IS NOT GOOD GAMEPLAY.Also, as of yesterday (Friday 5/26/2012), thousands of players on Hell difficulty mode have had their accounts completely "emptied":  their characters have lost all items on their character or in their stash, and have no gold either.', "If the single player was local - no hacking worries-broken auction house playstyle - if you don't go to the auction house to get geared up - your chance of surviving higher level play is nil at best-if you do go to the auction house for items - it ruins the fun of finding things - basically this game is a money scam and I fell for it-the game is starting to resemble WoW - I didn't want to play a point and click WoW clone BLIZZARD!!!!", 'Also there is no good method of searching for items to buy.', '!As stated Inferno is so ridiculously difficult and the loot generally so bad that the ONLY WAY to progress is to use the Auction House.I only managed to beat the game by bidding low gold on items and shopping intelligently, but it took wayyyy longer than it should have.', "The game isn't skill dependent, it is only gear based.PROBLEM IS that the gold prices of items have flown through the roof due to inflation, botters, and exploiters.", "I've seen people spending over $500 (yes real cash) on a SINGLE ITEM, a virtual item folks that will probably be obsolete in the next patch or expansion.I personally don't believe in spending real money on video game items (especially absurd amounts like stated above) but to each his own.-----So I really can't help but feel like the entire game was designed to revolve around the Real Money Auction House.", 'The items are given random stats and the amount of unique stats is dependant on the item quality.', "You don't share gold or have to fight other players for your items.", 'You find blue and yellow items like crazy.', 'Overall online experience in the past suffered from people hacking the game and duplicating items to be traded in both prior releases of the game.', "I didn't really have any inspiration to move on2) Too much items / stupid coin chaseAfter playing just 1 hour..and I had to sell bunch a crap to clear out the inventory.", 'You might find a bow that you would be stupid not to use, since all items are basically equal regardless of race (spell dps is directly relational to weapon dps).~10,000 people were involved in the creation of this game (source: game credits).', 'You are now overwhelmed with low quality items that hardly change anything to the gameplay: Diablo I and II were item based RPGs.', 'Blizzard went exactly the wrong way: they added even more varieties of the useless items.', 'Now players willing to give blizzard more money are basically the winners and the people actually playing to find items will suffer.6) The Monk is overpowered and the Barbarian sucks (I am level 33).7) There are not enough classes.8) Every act is monotonous boring.', 'What a hassle to use those items when Blizzard could just simplify the game to get rid of them, and instead allow players to press a button at any time to magically teleport themselves back to town (complete with a silly animation of the players crouching and white energy balls emanating from their hands), right?', 'There are actually items on the AH that go for millions of gold that are considered decent but not great items.', 'There are actually items on the AH that go for millions of gold that are considered decent but not great items.', 'Did I mention the items have boring and blatantly simple attributes (+dex, +str, +int)?']

column2: ['The first play through was good, maybe 3.5 stars.', "So having Diablo tied into such can only be a good thing for Diablo fans in the long run.One more thing...for those complaining about going through the plot line too fast before the game becomes a loot-grind; you obviously never played a Diablo game before.For my ratings: 5 full stars for fun factor, as I am already addicted.4 stars overall because I acknowledge some flaws, and because I am a spoiled gamer that never got into D2 untilDiablo Battlechest [new version] was released and I want D3's expansion sooner than later!", "So having Diablo tied into such can only be a good thing for Diablo fans in the long run.One more thing...for those complaining about going through the plot line too fast before the game becomes a treasures and magical shiny things to defeat diablo.I ventured forth into Diablo land full of hope with treasure hunting stars in my eyes and and found pile upon pile of useless junk.', "The bottom line here is unless you REALLY HAVE SOMETHING GREAT, don't bother posting it on the Auction House... it will not sell and you are wasting your time.Original review starts here: (note I had originally rated fun at 5 stars, but I dropped it to 3 stars because of the preceding update above)the prior two versions of the game were okay, but were not memorable experiences for me.", "The bottom line here is unless you REALLY HAVE SOMETHING GREAT, don't bother posting it on the Auction House... it will not sell and you are wasting your time.Original review starts here: (note I had originally rated fun at 5 stars, but I dropped it to 3 stars because of the preceding update above)the prior two versions of the game were okay, but were not memorable experiences for me.", 'Due to the fact that theres 4 difficulty modes, 5 character classes, millions of items to loot, and an upcoming pvp patch, I think its safe to say this will give me something to do in my downtime over the summer,into winter, and probably into next summer as well :)And as for the mixed reviews, just ignore them :) Most of the 5 stars are just fanboys who LOVE anything related to diablo 2.', 'Thanks for making a fun game...I was just hoping that I could thank you for making a "GREAT" game.5/30/2012 - OK, had to update it and bump it down one star (it would have been half a star if I could, since I would have originally rated it 3.5 stars).', 'but i feel that it takes out the feeling of having your own unique character to playThe PVE system drew me in like a gun shot, the pve is down right awesome to play in my opinion.i was gonna give this review 3 stars, but ill be honest the PVE in this game carried it to 4 stars.', 'but i feel that it takes out the feeling of having your own unique character to playThe PVE system drew me in like a gun shot, the pve is down right awesome to play in my opinion.i was gonna give this review 3 stars, but ill be honest the PVE in this game carried it to 4 stars.', "Right now, I'm totally stuck since my items aren't findable, and I can't cancel anything, so I have to wait 40 hours for things to timeout.I'm sure that the current one-star experience will gradually ascend to a four-star level, so I'm giving two stars to be fair.", "I intend to update this review with additional commentary and possibly star rating tweaks as time goes on.>>>UPDATE 5/21/2012: I'm upping this to 4 stars now that I've almost completed a full play-through.", 'I will never give it a full 5 stars because of the DRM "must be online" requirement.', 'It gets a total of four stars excluding technical issues because it is decent and entertaining, but it is by no stretch a five star game.']
column4: ['The game is pretty good but the hassle and internet requirement make it impossible to give this game more than 3 stars even though the first 2 Diablo games were absolute masterpieces and I have been anticipating this game for like...10 years!', 'however, the game deserves the rating of 2 stars on content simply because it has nothing i mean nothing in common with the first two diablos gameplay wise.the game is god of war, nothing but a slash and hack game.', "Needless to say, it can be fun to grind eq hoping for that small gain in power, but it's VERY repetitive grinding the same areas over and over and crafting LOTS of times to get something decent (which requires grinding for resources).Blizzard did a lot of work revamping this game and many improvements were made (I added 2 stars as a result).", 'OP class and can make it easier for you to level other toons or transfer items from your main.Overall: I give it 5 stars for graphics and 3 for gameplay', '(4 stars, 1 star taken off due to the super easy diffculty through Hell).- If you are hoping for end game content, or attaining the nice epic gear or sets, the game will get boring really quick and not worth it.', 'No strings attached, no frills.Now where the other two stars disappeared: DRM.', "I shouldn't have the game kicking me out every 5 minutes when I'm just getting up to get the kids something to eat or change a diaper or whatever.So my 1-star rating is actually a 3-star rating for good gameplay (maybe even 4 stars if your expectation really just was for an updated version of exactly the same recipe, no surprises), minus two stars as a punitive measure for hobbling the overall experience so badly with the damnable DRM.Oh look... battle.net kicked me off again while I was writing this.", "I shouldn't have the game kicking me out every 5 minutes when I'm just getting up to get the kids something to eat or change a diaper or whatever.So my 1-star rating is actually a 3-star rating for good gameplay (maybe even 4 stars if your expectation really just was for an updated version of exactly the same recipe, no surprises), minus two stars as a punitive measure for hobbling the overall experience so badly with the damnable DRM.Oh look... battle.net kicked me off again while I was writing this.", "I'm sorry, but a couple of hours of downtime for the biggest PC game to come out does not justify giving this game 1 or 2 stars.", 'I think the lack of player controlled leveling customization may hurt long-term replay value though.I chose to give the game three stars for two reasons.', "This is MMO-light, probably for people who sadly don't have the experience to know what this game is missing.If this wasn't rentware, I'd give it 2 stars for at least having town interiors that reminded me of classic Bioware games.", 'Holy smokes I was blown away by this and is the sole reason why this game gets 2 stars instead of 3 for being just OK.  You have to log onto a server to play this game.', "ymmvI give it 4 stars over all, because I did have to wait like a day and a half to play it due to authentication server issues, single player... That's just bad.", '3 stars for the game -2 stars for bugs and DRM.Could gain another star in my book once they fix the bugs.', '3 stars for the game -2 stars for bugs and DRM.Could gain another star in my book once they fix the bugs.', "The game is reasonably fun (three stars, might push into four) but it's completely unplayable."]

column2: ["i think over the years, Blizzard has perfected the click-to-death Diablo franchise to be a game that's easy enough for anyone to pick up, while maintaining the challenges that hardcore gamers like myself love about the franchise.", "in the past Diablo series, there were only very few worthwhile skills that's worth playing, the rest were subpar and none effective.", "i would say most of Diablo III's skills are useful again bosses and minions, depending on your play style and map environment.", "Drop the price to half or less most places to increase the base of players in the original and then put a few hooks in the original you can't access without the expansion!Well it worked they drew me in as an old Diablo 2 player I wanted to play a good version of Diablo 3 and now that I've wasted (happily) a couple hundred hours of my life, I'm still not buying the expansion till it comes down to half or less, but it was fun to play the patched title without being ripped off at the virtual store.", "Drop the price to half or less most places to increase the base of players in the original and then put a few hooks in the original you can't access without the expansion!Well it worked they drew me in as an old Diablo 2 player I wanted to play a good version of Diablo 3 and now that I've wasted (happily) a couple hundred hours of my life, I'm still not buying the expansion till it comes down to half or less, but it was fun to play the patched title without being ripped off at the virtual store.", 'I am NOT an online gamer anymore but I have all the old Diablo and Warcraft games and I was looking forward to trying Diablo 3 and expansion when the came in the mail.', 'I am NOT an online gamer anymore but I have all the old Diablo and Warcraft games and I was looking forward to trying Diablo 3 and expansion when the came in the mail.', 'Diablo III got better since its last release people!.', 'I loved Diablo and Diablo 2 growing up.', 'I loved Diablo and Diablo 2 growing up.', 'The only downside I see from buying the physical copy is that I had to download the game anyway!The game is fun, Diablo at its very core, if you enjoy Diablo 2 then you will enjoy this one.', 'The only downside I see from buying the physical copy is that I had to download the game anyway!The game is fun, Diablo at its very core, if you enjoy Diablo 2 then you will enjoy this one.', "If you have a steady internet connection, it's not really an issue other than where your DRM ideology falls.If you are a hard-core Diablo fan, the new patch is claimed to have fixed many of the early complaints (which I never experienced).", 'Those familiar with the Diablo series and its gameplay will feel right at home with this title.', 'That being said, this is a great game for those of us who are suckers for nostalgia and simply want a visceral Hack-n-Slash with which to kill 15-20 minutes at a time - complete with the "slurpy", "steely" and "crunching" sounds we\'ve come to expect every time a weapon is swung in the Diablo universe.', 'Overall, Diablo III succeeds at doing what the series does best.', 'is helping you fight Diablo, are you sure who is the Devil and who is not?LOOT.', 'Having played all Diablo available, this has a much better feeling of the play...will be purchasing xbox version shortly in hopes that the game feeling is even better.', 'I loved Diablo 2 but this, this is garbage even after a year this game still blows.', "Diablo 3 has been one of those games that has been labelled as garbage and it's really a shame.", "For the record, I've never used the RMAH- yet I still respect those that make the choice to use it.2)Always Online/Server Error at LaunchAlways online is a feature that many games were forcing long before Diablo (and soon consoles will be forcing it, too).", 'Does no one remember how much a grind fest Diablo 1/2 could be?', 'Ever had a ex bf/gf/friend, where you find yourself missing them until a friend or some other circumstance makes you realize, "Wow, it was never as good as I thought it was..." Diablo 1/2 are GREAT.', 'It has been about a year since the release of Diablo 3 and lots of things have been patched into the game to address the many faults it had at launch.', "What hasn't changed is the core of the game, skills and items which is where the problem is for D3.First off, if you played Diablo 2 and are looking at Diablo 3 for some more of that great stuff, look somewhere else.", "What hasn't changed is the core of the game, skills and items which is where the problem is for D3.First off, if you played Diablo 2 and are looking at Diablo 3 for some more of that great stuff, look somewhere else.", "This is a good game but it really isn't a Diablo game.", 'Sure it was made by Blizzard but all the people from Blizzard North (who made Diablo and Diablo II) have left Blizzard or were left go.', 'Sure it was made by Blizzard but all the people from Blizzard North (who made Diablo and Diablo II) have left Blizzard or were left go.', 'The Diablo series is classic and Diablo III is a very fun, amazing game that I very much enjoy but the always on DRM ruins it.', 'The Diablo series is classic and Diablo III is a very fun, amazing game that I very much enjoy but the always on DRM ruins it.', 'Diablo 3 is a great game which Blizzard continues to refine and improve.', 'The Diablo 3 development team has some great things planned for this game with each of the upcoming patches.', "There's already so many reviews as to the problems of Diablo 3, but I still want to share all my thoughts.", "That will show you exactly why Diablo 3 isn't what it's supposed to be.Sadly, Diablo 3 was none of these.", "That will show you exactly why Diablo 3 isn't what it's supposed to be.Sadly, Diablo 3 was none of these.", "My main problems with Diablo 3 weren't actually the Real Money Auction House, it wasn't the always online DRM (but that isn't alright either), it was how they mutilated the story, how they ruined the atmosphere and music, and how they drug the king of ARPGs down to the filth of mediocrity and monotony.On a first playthrough of Diablo 3, you will probably love it.", "My main problems with Diablo 3 weren't actually the Real Money Auction House, it wasn't the always online DRM (but that isn't alright either), it was how they mutilated the story, how they ruined the atmosphere and music, and how they drug the king of ARPGs down to the filth of mediocrity and monotony.On a first playthrough of Diablo 3, you will probably love it.", 'In Diablo 3, I know exactly where to go and exactly where to look, and it only took one playthrough.', 'What bothers me the most is what they did to the lore and story of the Diablo universe.', 'If you care, there are possible spoilers ahead.Angels vs Demons with humans caught between is one of my favorite settings for any story, and Diablo 2 did that perfectly.', 'The cutscenes were cool, going into the Hellforge was cool, defeating all the brothers of Diablo was cool.', "Anyway, the rest of this act is thwarting Diablo's every move and eventually defeating him on the Pinnacle of Heaven, with a very anti-climatic finishing cutscene.Sure, the story has many twists, with Tyreal becoming human (which is just stupid, what's going to happen when he dies, become an Angel again?)", 'I was planning to re-activate my world of warcraft account so I logged into my account and I see a free trail of the starter edition of Diablo 3 which is essentially first 13 levels of the game.', "I had so far not bought Diablo 3 because I have seen so many negative reviews everywhere and didn't wanted to spend my money on it.", 'So I was like well the starter edition is free till level 13, let me try it first and experience myself the hell-spawn that many are claiming Diablo 3 to be.', 'I have played Diablo 2 and its expansion many years ago..I think almost a decade ago and had great fun with it.', 'And coming to play Diablo 3 so many years later I found it to be a worthy successor to Diablo 2.', 'And coming to play Diablo 3 so many years later I found it to be a worthy successor to Diablo 2.', "I also enjoyed crafting in the game which is exactly how I like a virtual profession to be; not complex or anything just being functional and not boring or becoming a repetitive chore (at least at the normal level).So in a nutshell I will recommend that you at least try the 'starter edition of Diablo 3' (which is free) and make up your own mind.", 'I personally have had great fun playing Diablo 3 and feel my monies spent were worth it.', 'Just like Diablo 2, I will most likely take 2 classes up-to max level via normal difficulty and be done with Diablo 3 until the expansion gets released which I have heard is on its way.', 'Just like Diablo 2, I will most likely take 2 classes up-to max level via normal difficulty and be done with Diablo 3 until the expansion gets released which I have heard is on its way.', 'I love the Diablo series.', 'The box and quality overall that Diablo III is excellent.', 'Torchlight II which is kind of like Diablo 2.5 was made on probably 1/20th the budget and it has deeper gameplay and just more pure fun than Diablo 3.', 'Torchlight II which is kind of like Diablo 2.5 was made on probably 1/20th the budget and it has deeper gameplay and just more pure fun than Diablo 3.', 'Diablo 3 took over a decade to make and had a giant budget but it falls down on all of the key categories that make a game great.', 'Diablo has alway been one of my favorite games.', 'Diablo I and II are great.', "I don't know why exactly, but this didn't draw me back to it the way the first 2 Diablo games did.", "I had fun playing Diablo 3 for awhile but there's little reason to replay it again.", "I think there was one item for my current class and it's stats were way under what I already had from the beginning of the game.If you can pick up Diablo 3 for cheap I'd buy it but there's no reason to pay $60 for it.", 'Anyone who was into the previous Diablo games will love this one too.', 'While the game can be fun, it takes WAY to long to get the enjoyable part....Let me start by saying this, Diablo 3 is great at level 60 hunting down the evils of the world on a hard Monster Power setting.But it takes forever to get to this point.', 'On top of that there are many disappointments.1) Content that repeats itself over and over and over (no randomized levels like Diablo 2)2) Still lacking PVP that was promised....3) No offline mode4) Auction House that is pretty much useless for the most part..... and many many more.So wait until the game goes on sale cheap, if you really want to try it.', 'So I finally got my Diablo 3 today from Amazon, first time owning a blizzard game in my life.took a little while to reach like 2 weeks because its in the Caribbean but thats still good considering its Christmas.Anyways got it for $26 on Amazon for cyber monday.Runs fine on 1080p with 70 fps average in scenes that car calm and intense scenes goes down to 30 fps sometimes 25.', 'Yeah it requires some serious power to run on max but thats the way I like it cause no one can make games like Blizzard and Valve.Infact the Havok Engine of Diablo 3 is superior to Source Engine since valve has yet to be able to animate foliage.', 'I am pleased to be alive on this planet at this time to enjoy this masterpiece we call Diablo 3.', 'Months after release and playing more than 200 hours as well as trying out the other Action RPG competitors, I am glad the direction that Diablo went in.', 'It could just as easily have been an expansion pack to Diablo II.', "I remember playing the original Diablo (pirated, btw) and going onto an MP map and instantly being ganked by some guy with some super-armor that he'd probably hex-edited.So that was stupid.I played the game once through on normal.", 'Diablo 3 never needed to be an online game, that was just the excuse Blizzard used to promote the garbage Auction House that is now gone for good.', 'I am not a super avid gamer but when I find time to play I get pretty addicted to some games, and this is one of them.Starting out, my friends and I agreed that there were a few things lacking compared to Diablo 2 however since all of the new patches and updates things just keep getting better and better.', 'It alone makes Diablo 3 better than the previous.', 'However you can join random games and meet some pretty cool people and team up to play.Overall I highly recommend it if you enjoy any of the other blizzard games especially the previous Diablo 2.', 'I have held healthy addictions to Diablo and Diablo 2 since the beginning, and I had preordered Diablo 3 the moment Amazon had it available.', 'I have held healthy addictions to Diablo and Diablo 2 since the beginning, and I had preordered Diablo 3 the moment Amazon had it available.', 'I have held healthy addictions to Diablo and Diablo 2 since the beginning, and I had preordered Diablo 3 the moment Amazon had it available.', "Most of the major problems have been patched now so I won't spend time complaining about that because I didn't experience any issues apart from the occasional server error.The story in Diablo III is fairly good, but only people who played the last two will truly appreciate it.", 'Not just Diablo, but Azmodan, Mephisto, Belial and many others.', "The art style is absolutely beautiful leaving you with plenty of great scenery to look at.Of course a dungeon crawler isn't one without a lot of loot and Diablo III has an endless amount.", 'Sure you can enjoy the single player, but if you really want to experience the way Diablo was built to be played you must continue on in a second play through on a harder difficulty.', 'The original Diablo, Diablo 2, LoD.', 'The original Diablo, Diablo 2, LoD.', 'There is no new content to explore, no epic boss battles, just the same old, same old.- So basically - if you just want 20-40 hours of fun (hitting 60, while exploring everything you find) Diablo 3 is probably a fun hack and slash.', 'i absolutely loved Diablo and Diablo 2.', 'i absolutely loved Diablo and Diablo 2.', "Diablo III is a very good game, But it didn't seem to last very longlike the older Diablo games.", "Diablo III is a very good game, But it didn't seem to last very longlike the older Diablo games.", 'I played the heck out of the first two editions of Diablo.I played maybe a few sessions of Diablo 3 and became easily disinterested in the linear character development and fairly linear gameplay.', 'Maybe I\'ve "outgrown" this type of game?It seems like the gaming world has advanced quite a bit, but Diablo has not.', 'Buy Titan Quest and install the Diablo II Immortal MOD, below is how to accomplish this.Hear ye, hear ye, this is Diablo II with a graphics update or Diablo III as it should have been...maybe.', 'Buy Titan Quest and install the Diablo II Immortal MOD, below is how to accomplish this.Hear ye, hear ye, this is Diablo II with a graphics update or Diablo III as it should have been...maybe.', 'Buy Titan Quest and install the Diablo II Immortal MOD, below is how to accomplish this.Hear ye, hear ye, this is Diablo II with a graphics update or Diablo III as it should have been...maybe.', 'The point is, if you loved Diablo II and you just want better graphics, then just play this game with the Diablo II character classes.', 'The point is, if you loved Diablo II and you just want better graphics, then just play this game with the Diablo II character classes.', "The one you'll care the most about though, like me, is called Diablo 2 Immortal.", 'Seriously, all you need is this game and the Diablo 2 Immortal Mod and you are set for a good long while.', 'The best I can think to describe it is a hybrid of Diablo 2 and Dragon Age Origins.', 'In other words there is absolutely no character customization, making your character exactly the same as every other of the same class and level.If you played Diablo 2 you know how important mana was for most classes.', 'Diablo 3 completely changed how it works.', 'They still had all that progress without so much as leaving town other than clicking the yes button for summons then teleporting back after the boss died.In Diablo 2 Necromancers were enjoyable to me in part because a part of your strategy was keeping all the pets up while also using direct offensive and defensive spells.', "I played Diablo 1 and 2, and I can say that Diablo 3 just didn't have anywhere near the same feel.", "I played Diablo 1 and 2, and I can say that Diablo 3 just didn't have anywhere near the same feel.", "I've been a fan of Diablo since the first one came out.", "I remember that people were buying gear for Diablo 2 on eBay, and let's not forget about the gold-farmers in WoW.", "I never played D1 or D2, so I don't know if those were immensely more fun, but I can say this; Diablo 3 has been a completely enjoyable experience so far and I don't regret my purchase in the slightest.", 'Experiment with skills and gems all you like, then go back and do it a different way.For those unfamiliar with the series, Diablo 3 really is as good a place as any to start as it is both different enough and good enough to stand on its own merits.', "With Diablo 3 though, it has completely changed how I view the company.Diablo 3's gameplay is very fun and I leveled a witch doctor at midnight on 5/15/12.", "In Diablo 3 though, the loot is so random that even if you did receive the top tier ilvl 63 item, it's likely-hood of being a complete dud is very high.", "So having Diablo tied into such can only be a good thing for Diablo fans in the long run.One more thing...for those complaining about going through the plot line too fast before the game becomes a loot-grind; you obviously never played a Diablo game before.For my ratings: 5 full stars for fun factor, as I am already addicted.4 stars overall because I acknowledge some flaws, and because I am a spoiled gamer
