social and invite others to group with me without the loot pressures of an MMO (i.e.", 'Or if you need help downing a boss, you can open up your game to the public and have others join on the fly.', 'However, the formula for this genre had been played out for quite some time, and others who have been playing dungeon crawler games may be seeking more of a challenge or for Blizzard to re-invent the wheel.', 'A roleplaying game is one where you take a risk, you invest in certain skills and skip others, and your character is a unique creation; you might have picked a good combo, or maybe not, but it was still your choice, your experiment.', 'Playing with others, it was just flat out dull.Basically, I just kept hoping it would get better.', 'There is no agony of choice, dealing with a set of skills that make things more difficult with certain monster types (and, incidentally, driving a need to group with others).', 'And it really sucks that there is no LAN option similar to what Diablo II had.The game itself:After playing so many of the clones like Scared I and II, Titan Quest (one of the best clones) and a few forgettable others, I was glad to say that this was worth the wait.']
column4: ['The first thirteen levels are more than enough for you to know whether you will like or hate the game rather than base your opinions on others.', 'It\'s so annoying that I will never pay full price for any "always on" requirement and I hope others will do the same.As far as D3 the game is concerned, there are three things I think Blizzard has done better than the competition.', 'Game is stable, looks good and plays great.As others have said, the biggest issue with this game is the community, so much anger with little to base it on.The game play is fun and there is a lot to see, levels/quests are very large to huge and (unlike previous installments) there are events to tie it all together.', 'My only wish is that somebody would design a game, something similar to D&D; Online, that had a random scenario generator that could make huge worlds, but was free to play with others online, that is, no monthly fees.', "It is our goal to literally collect every-single-unique-item in a given game, and Diablo has, historically, been our Grail among Grails.Many others have expanded on the points of always on DRM, small parties, excessive downtime, and the auction house, so I'll skip those - I'm writing from the perspective of a single-player who isn't bothered with the need to be online all the time, one who isn't bothered with pings, or downtimes, or even with the gear-check requirements of the upper difficulty levels.The only reason I play ARPGs is to collect loot - because let's face it - gameplay mechanics in ARPGs aren't going to win any rewards.", "Though I don't play for story as much as others, every single piece of dialogue is pure crap.", 'And they spent how long on this?The game is designed around the Auction House in every way, from item drops to the requirement to be online regardless of whether you want to play with others or not to the "difficulty" levels of the game.Oh, and Blizzard has yet to learn how to manage and anticipate problems.', "Follow the story line, kill the monsters, do a little gem crafting make some armor and your done.When started made 4 toons took one up to higher levels and not even going to do the others unless I'm really bored.", 'I like playing the game and having a general chat available with others playing the game.', "This isn't a MMORPG like WoW, and These idiots over at Blizzard need to understand, and many others, that pirates will ALWAYS find a away to pirate your product, but they're a low, LOW majority.", 'The premise is the same as the previous two games and follows suit with others in the same genre.', "That's not really anything to wait 12 years to play.Next, I never really played Diablo for the companionship of others, so did not need an internet connection.", "Yes, I had some of the problems that others had getting into the game and yes Blizzard, requiring a constant internet connection to play DOES INDEED SUCK, but it's the first day of launch and one of the most anticipated PC games since the LAST Starcraft game is back to suck time out of our hands once again.I remember getting a hold of Diablo II back in 2002 to play while I was out sick and it dominated my life for nearly 4 months and in that time, I had to upgrade my PC twice so that it would run properly.", 'Your barbarian character has same stats as millions of others.', "You'll be met with a horde of fanboy's and others who purely want to hate you for not loving whatever scrap is tossed your way after paying to own a game you are unable to play.Online features advertised as being part of the game are non-existant, or full of bugs.", 'Not going to point out all the BS you have to endure in Diablo 3 which makes it completely not worth buying at this time (give it until late 2012 at least), others have already done this enough.']

column2: ['Fix you lag plagued servers or give us offline mode.Update:Now the servers a re even laggier, more disconnects, more rubber banding and blizzard does nothing....also we get the pleasure of having 15+ gold spam request a day in our inbox when we log in....again reported over and over, on the forums...blizzard does nothing.', 'I run a top of the line system and I get lag all of the time which is a drag.', 'Take the one shot mechanics from the aforementioned paragraph and sprinkle in some huge lag spikes and you can watch your characters die over and over to invisible mobs, invisible attacks, melee mobs hitting you clean across your screen, etc.', 'For those that have "seen it all" and "done it all", such as beating the hardest difficulty or mastering the "Hardcore Mode" (another failed attempt to challenge players, what good is a 1 death system when things like lag or framerate issues can kill you as surely as any enemy) this means the game has no replay value whatsoever.', 'For my part, my experience has been excellent with minimal lag and downtime.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'Thanks comrades!Act IV Short - really, did they put this act together in a month?Lag Lag Lag - Lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lag lagGeneral Chat Spams - Love the Korean workforce.', 'So you just get hit, and killed, and re-start, and hope the lag goes away after a few more re-spawns, or if you stop and re-start the game.This shortcoming is just horrendous, unforgivable.', "Throw in the fact the game has to be connected all the time to the servers could lead to many annoying moments with server overload or lag, I recommend saving your 60 dollars until they iron out all these issues.~ Written: 06-12Positive:* Really cool cut-scenes* Most important NPC's have dialog options* Really good soundtrack* Sound effects really polished* Locations and skills look great* Combat is a lot of fun in the earlier difficultiesNegative:* Not the best voice acting except the jeweler.", 'Random disconnects, server resets and lag make this A++ title a B- at best.', "So again, in D3 Blizzard made another major decision restricting players' freedom: internet only.With D2, I had no problems with hacking or server lag, because I abandoned Battle.net.", 'As for those that whine about graphic issues and lag, get better cards.', 'I got no lag time when lots of monster crowded the screen and I was impressed by some of the lighting SFX.', 'Even when the servers are up, I (and everyone I know who plays the game) get pretty colossal lag spikes from time to time.', "The lag can be crippling, but it's not crippling often.The game is excellent, but the lack of an offline mode is still pretty ridiculous, so I'm rating it 4/5."]
column4: ['Thanks for the lag you created designing the game around this greed.', 'It took about a week for the log in issues to be resolved, but even after that, the people that could finally log in were greeted with horrible server lag and pings that were in the 250-700 range which meant huge delays with what was happening on screen, and even more trouble for people who attempted to play hardcore mode.', 'Auction house was a very poor effort.Overall - I have purchased almost every single Blizzard game since Warcraft 2, but I will never purchase another Blizzard product again unless they fix the lag and remove the requirement for constant online access.', 'That makes the game even more fun with lag!Game is terrible.', 'Its sad to see that these companies are not respecting anymore what customers want, they are making everything a business and putting down rules that break players freedom in enjoying the game.first there was the change in graphics, the toned down gore, the short story, the lag, the lag spikes, people filling up chat with ads from china, items becoming useless without buying from ah, problems with playing hardcore without being paranoid of blizzards servers, having to wait for maitenance periods.', 'Its sad to see that these companies are not respecting anymore what customers want, they are making everything a business and putting down rules that break players freedom in enjoying the game.first there was the change in graphics, the toned down gore, the short story, the lag, the lag spikes, people filling up chat with ads from china, items becoming useless without buying from ah, problems with playing hardcore without being paranoid of blizzards servers, having to wait for maitenance periods.', 'Random lag occurs at the most convenient times in this game.', 'So if the server goes down for maintenance, too many people logging on at once, or even server lag is all a factor in the game you purchased.', "Luckily, I find this game mind numbingly boring by myself, so I'm always playing with friends, but it is still immensely annoying (lag and dc's happen to me with an awesome connection; that would bug the hell out of me if I was playing alone).", 'There was no problem other than the considerable lag.', 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', 'while there are server downtimes and occasionaly lag that is to be expected when 3.5 million ppl buy the game.', "I really wanted to like this game but if you can't play because of lag how can you.", 'And i refuse to play it on a harder mode till they fix the dam lag.', "What kills me is i'm a wow player and run the game at max settings and never have lag.", 'I got killed so many times in this game because of the lag.', "There is a lot of server lag where you are in a fight and one second you are toe to toe fighting it out and the next you're on the other side of the screen, so disappointing.The game took me about 25 hours to complete with a level 31 Barbarian.", "I personally haven't played a Blizzard game that I didn't enjoy, and this game is no exception.PS I played the game for over 5 hours and not once was I disconnected, and not once did I experience any lag.", "At the beginning of the game this lag seems tolerable when there are only a few monsters on the screen, but as you progress into more advanced acts the game slows down to the point where all you do is die to unseen hordes stuttering around the screen.This looks like a fun game, but now I've been forced to buy a new computer or ask for a refund--it simply cannot play on Macs with Nvidia 9400M cards!", 'I just had to close the game because I was walking around on a single player game and no mobs were generating lag was making the game unplayable.', "I paid $60 for this game, and I can't play a single player game because of lag?", "I haven't said much about the DRM and heavy server lag because everyone already knows the game is going to be somewhat crippled for a little while longer until either more people quit or Blizzard improves capacity.", "It is simply unplayable (lag, disconnects, 40 minutes of lost progress) at random times, and that's why my review is 1 star instead of 2 stars.Until then, save your money, and buy something else.", 'Until then, expect to lag out of a "single player" game.', 'There are no fixes for server lag, disconnects, and deaths due to lagging out.They are causing anyone who was used to playing a class, alone or with other people in strictly co-op (no PvP yet!!)', 'I thought all the talk about game-killing lag, cartoony graphics and endless errors was probably just a bunch of geeky whiners.', "Yet somehow, the thing needs to constantly pull data from the Internet - even though there's no one in dungeon but you.You click, you wait, you die - often with no idea why.But let's assume for a minute that Blizzard figures out its servers eventually and the lag returns to a semi-acceptable level where the game is playable.", '(continued again)The end of day two on into the third day of release shows massive lag issues continuing randomly when starting new games.']

column2: ["(maybe playing it all week long was too much, but who's counting.", 'Ever.4: In the first week of release, I had more downtime and lost time due to serverside issues, than actual play time.', 'After a week or two my friends really wanted me to go get it.', 'I had heard a lot of tall tales going around about people making big money off the RMAH (real money auction house) so I figured why not give it a try.After a week of playing and getting to Inferno act 2...', 'Connection issues aside, the first week or two of the game was a lot of fun.', "I can't get to the next screen I have tried for 2 week now and every time I call they say they queue is full and hang up.", 'An always online requirement, which limits their choice on how to play the game and eliminated 3rd party modding potential (which in light of the heavily flooded servers during the first week I gained intimate appreciation of), no skill trees, a real money auction house that encouraged a “pay to win”  mechanic, and visuals that were styled in a drastically different manner than previous installments in the series.', "If they didn't have enough servers a week gave them plenty of time to set up more.", 'Hacking problems: Many accounts have been compromised (2 very noticeable waves of this has occurred, once a week ago and again today.', "One week on D3 and I am done; and I stop to check every corner and pick up every dropped coin and item, and I talk to every NPC I can see.2) more story which is good but I can't say I really like the story.", 'We have played for a week now, and after an initial enjoying of the game, by around level 15 or so, we really started noticing things that were bugging us.First of all, we receive an error most times we attempt to log on.', 'My husband is away most of the week working, so we were going to play this together at night when he is away from home, but we may just have to go back to World of Warcraft or I may have to resort to playing Starcraft 2 with him (ick).', 'After a week of mashing my mouse buttons, I feel D3 will very likely have the same effect on me.That said, this is exactly what makes this game so special.', 'It should take another week or so before the logins plateau to a steady line.', 'I will play this for one week at most and then I will probably never play it again.', 'I give any online game a free pass to adjust servers the first week.', "I'm sure this is just... release week issues.", 'I was very lukewarm about this game on its release week, especially with the server/install issues, but have now gotten more comfortable with the changes and am finding it really enjoyable.>>>COMBAT / GAMEPLAY: extremely simple, but fun, at lower levels.', "I've been using Google Plus 'Hangouts' to chat with my teammates, and that works well.>>>TECHNICAL ISSUES: the server bugs seem to have been resolved in the week since launch, but many of my friends still have connectivity or graphics/system issues... getting booted from games, losing connection, computer freezing, etc.", 'The real money auction house version has been pushed back for the third week in a row.', 'DO NOT BUY.Edited Review:About a week after launch, the servers are fairly stable now.']
column4: ["Update:3/16/2014I've been playing this game for about a week and I can honestly say that I'm addicted.", 'All that in the launch and the first week or so of the game is very typical of any "Blizzard" game.', "The major way you'll receive upgrades in this game is buy collecting gold/using real world money and buying items off their auction house, which leads me to my major complaint.Last week I decided to sell off all of my items and quit the game since it's not fun at all anymore (unlike Diablo 2, which was fun for over five years for me).", 'I will wait another week, but I have lost all faith in Blizzard and will never purchase another Blizzard game.', 'It took about a week for the log in issues to be resolved, but even after that, the people that could finally log in were greeted with horrible server lag and pings that were in the 250-700 range which meant huge delays with what was happening on screen, and even more trouble for people who attempted to play hardcore mode.', 'I usually wait about 6 months for glitches to get fixed in software programs that come out but games usually get things ironed out in a week after releases if any come up.', "Because I started the game last week, I doubt I'll ever make more than a few dollars here and there on the auction house versus the thousands some have already made.", 'This feels like some piece of crap game they put together in about a year.Then about a week in my buddy gets hacked and loses all of his stuff.', "Besides, I don't see any real benefit to this online connection, no PVP, no guilds, no raids, etc...I can see myself playing this game for about 1-2 months to beat it since I have a small child and I can only play 1 hour or 2 a few days a week but above all I see no replay value and no portability.I also ran into the gear deficiency issue in Act I, Yes, Act I people!!!", 'Servers being crap on launch week = Horrible, but forgivable.', 'Servers being crap on the following week = WTF.', 'Commodities portion of the AH has been down for like a week already and its unknown when it will be restored.', 'You will get bored of diablo 3 in propably a week or 2.', "Mediocre mechanics, 0 game depth and a story line that a 5th grader could've written better in less than a week.", 'This is a Diablo game mindless hack and slash which is fun to play when you can play it, I have had no problems at playing the game, however with Tuesday maintanence being an issue because the servers are down almost every week this will become a very big problem in the future.', 'For me, it provided less than a week of gameplay, unlike D2 that I played for months and months.', 'And that sickening DRM always online, cant play offline is a joke and insult.Playing it it actually feels less fun the D2 that I was playing all week leading up to this.', "If it's your 1 day off a week where you can get time to play a game you were a fan of the franchise and Blizzard is having trouble with their servers?"]

column2: ['Ever.4: In the first week of release, I had more downtime and lost time due to serverside issues, than actual play time.', 'Even now (patch 1.05 as of the time of this review) I experienced stuttering movement and other latency issues.', 'The game has its fair share of problems, but they were mainly during launch with a plethora of glitches, balancing, and server issues.', "Most of the major problems have been patched now so I won't spend time complaining about that because I didn't experience any issues apart from the occasional server error.The story in Diablo III is fairly good, but only people who played the last two will truly appreciate it.", "It should be fairly simple to install, but should you run into any issues leave me a note and I'll gladly help you out.", "There are really a ton more issues this game has, but that's all I'm writing.", "It's pretty sad that a company wants to charge nearly $60 for something that has so many issues.", 'This game was over 11 years in the making and when it finally was released it was filled with bugs, exploits, server issues, and no single player offline mode.', 'For those that have "seen it all" and "done it all", such as beating the hardest difficulty or mastering the "Hardcore Mode" (another failed attempt to challenge players, what good is a 1 death system when things like lag or framerate issues can kill you as surely as any enemy) this means the game has no replay value whatsoever.', 'Connection issues aside, the first week or two of the game was a lot of fun.', 'To make matters worse, if you own WOW because Blizzard combines all product support with the same customer support staff, you will also not be able to reach support for WOW account issues.', 'Also, that streamlining and the old issues could have been fixed within the old system easily.', 'Will it be worth playing after they get server issues lined out?', "Multiplayer experience is great too and simple, your friends can join your game or you can join theirs and play both together with the same or even more fun, you can also join public games or make your game public to party with other people, your loot is your own and you won't have any issues with anyone, in fact you will end up trading and buying\\selling items in the Auction House and it is fun.", 'Worked fine with no connection issues.', "There's enough reviews on the internet here to tell you all about Diablo 3, I just wanted to add my two cents to the legions of nerds that are giving this amazing game a very low score because during the first few hours they had launch issues.", 'It seems Blizzard has solved their server issues and things are running smoothly.', "how about some more error 37.There's absolutely no excuse for the horrid server issues, single play being online only etc.", 'Eventually this will be a great addition but not until the issues are worked out.', 'Granted some games can have issues when they are first released, Blizzard is usually quick to correct them.', "I haven't experienced any server issues at all, and no downtime either.", "Ok I don't know where to start...I bought this game expecting to run into server issues that comes with a launch of a title like this.", 'I only experienced server issues on day one.', 'I dont have any issues so far and im really surprised that my 5 years old gaming pc still can handle the high setting of this game.', 'On both the game runs perfectly with no issues at all.', "If you can run this on the highest setting with a big screen and good speakers, you'll just emerse yourself into the environment and go at it.I don't have any disconnect issues or any issues at all, really.", "If you can run this on the highest setting with a big screen and good speakers, you'll just emerse yourself into the environment and go at it.I don't have any disconnect issues or any issues at all, really.", "But don't let this concern alone turn you away from experiencing this otherwise amazing game.One final comment: I'm amused by all of the negative reviews from folks who clearly bought the game, often even pre-ordered, stated how they waited eagerly all 12 years, took off work to play...and yet were surprised by the persistent internet connection requirement or that there were launch issues.", "I'm sure this is just... release week issues.", 'I was very lukewarm about this game on its release week, especially with the server/install issues, but have now gotten more comfortable with the changes and am finding it really enjoyable.>>>COMBAT / GAMEPLAY: extremely simple, but fun, at lower levels.', "I've been using Google Plus 'Hangouts' to chat with my teammates, and that works well.>>>TECHNICAL ISSUES: the server bugs seem to have been resolved in the week since launch, but many of my friends still have connectivity or graphics/system issues... getting booted from games, losing connection, computer freezing, etc.", 'i have motion issues and the fixed camera view works well for me though i wish you could zoom in with mouse wheel instead of using Z button.', 'Hope some patches will fix some of the issues like some problems with AH items loading an easier search text feature and better fonts.but i will say this.', 'As for those that whine about graphic issues and lag, get better cards.', "Without it, we'd be North Korea, with NO GAMES.Seriously, the game is fantastic, and the first day issues will be resolved soon.", 'Those issues have seem to gone away for the most part so people can stop freaking out.', 'It lost a full star for the technical issues.', 'It gets a total of four stars excluding technical issues because it is decent and entertaining, but it is by no stretch a five star game.', "Stopping to write this review is hard, but, when I heard of all the 1 star reviews going up due to some temporary login issues I thought I'd hop on.Graphics: I'm playing on a top of the line iMac I bought last year and the game looks absolutely gorgeous.", "You've waited twelve years for this, so, what's a few hours more if you're having some issues."]
column4: ['My first complaints about the game still stand, and yes, Blizzard does have Server Lag issues during peak hours of gameplay as other gamers have pointed out.', 'Loads of Copies sold, Loads of players attempting to log on as soon as it went "Live", loads of people failing to get online to play, loads of crashes, a few up dates to help with the "Crashes", loads of irate players flooding the forums, loads of issues, and a little let down with some "Promised" content not being there like "PVP".', "PvP has been recently added, but as far as I've heard that is no good either (I'm not a PvP person so I can't say whether or not this is true).Strangely, none of these issues are why I don't like Diablo 3.", 'I waited to buy this game because of all the launch issues it was having.', 'It took about a week for the log in issues to be resolved, but even after that, the people that could finally log in were greeted with horrible server lag and pings that were in the 250-700 range which meant huge delays with what was happening on screen, and even more trouble for people who attempted to play hardcore mode.', 'Seems like if blizzard wants to cripple the game that way they have they should at least have such issues resolved or at least some way of smoothly adapting to it.', "Pure fail!Then there are issues with the game's difficulty as it makes you play the game out on beyond easy mode where I lost 3 friends to boredom.", 'Why not add a single player mode only that cannot then be transferred online for play for those who wish to enjoy the game when the internet is not an option or the servers are out?Aside from the glaring requirement of being connected in order to play there are the issues with the game play itself.', 'Things like "rubberbanding" and latency cause your character to just suddenly die, issues further compounded by insane graphical requirements even at the lowest of settings.', 'Currently, their phone support is completely shut down due to Diablo 3 issues.', "Listing too many specific instances doesn't give the reader a since of my frustration or disappointment.So here goes:The patches they had added don't address the real issues and sometimes make the game even less fun.The game appears to not have been tested much at all for inferno levels.The game looses its fun factor extremely fast once you hit inferno.Legendary gear is completely worthless.All the fun affixes that Diablo 2 had are replaced by utterly boring and worthless affixes.You don't feel more powerful as you reach high levels.Grinding gear is slow, painful, and boring for inferno.The voice over acting is horrible.The plot line is thin.The character lines are cheesy, cliche ridden garbage that try to be funny but aren't.", 'This is a review for hardcore players mainly.What are the issues with this long awaited game?you cant play single player offline, you have to be online at all times in order to play the game!', "But with Diablo 3, I didn't bother to read Amazon's reviews thinking the low ratings were the result of angry gamers reacting to online issues that are normal with the launch of major games.", 'No worries right?...Without the need to exaggerate, I would say I lose connection all together or suffer connection issues nearly 25% of the time I play this game.', 'What is driving me away from the game already is the connection issues.', 'It appears that the early server issues have been resolved and there have been two game patches to date to fix some other random issues.', 'It appears that the early server issues have been resolved and there have been two game patches to date to fix some other random issues.', 'The only problem is when battle.net is down for maintenance or IT issues.', 'The AH would’ve still dominated progression.Add that to the ultra punishing release-state inferno difficulty and varying class balance issues and the game felt like a chore to play in end-game; and no one wanted to at a point.', 'ANSWER:  The server issues alone are enough to give the game a 1 star at current time.', 'The game also happens to have issues outside this.', 'Only certain genres like comic books and comedies can pull that off IF DONE RIGHT.Overview:Lets disregard the server issues as that would automatically fail this game as a consideration for purchase.', 'Thanks Blizzard for requiring us to use a DRM that still allows other people to steal my account and basically pirate away officially purchased game accounts.Bottom line: Wait until you hear in the news that Blizzard have resolved all these issues before you buy.', 'I believe the negative reviewers are actually just a very small number of disgruntled people angry over server issues, and the other gamers are just too busy having fun playing the game.', 'There have been countless issues for me personally when either my ISP or Battle.net is slowing down and I will end up getting killed.', "Latency seems to be in check (for the last few days anyways) and I've had no issues with logging in.", "With patches, a lot of those small issues may be resolved, or they might not, I can't read the future.If you are a fan of dungeon crawlers, I say pick it up.", "Lastly, while connection problems occurred in the first day of release with millions of people banging on the servers, by the third day technical issues have gone away completely, I played 10+ hours yesterday without a single hiccup.This is a very fun game, even more so with a friend or a sibling, heck only reason I'm here instead of playing is because I wanted to order diablo 3 mouse and saw these terrible reviews here.Only drawback I see is that the game lost some of its gritty feel and feels abit more generic fantasy than previous games in the series, not worth taking a star away for, but I do hope Blizzard takes note.", 'When a game first comes out the servers fill up and then you have issues.', "Not saying my friends are annoying or anything but with the aforementioned chat issues, you might never seen your friends' messages asking if you want to group with them and they'll just poof in front of you.", 'Hopefully these issues will be fixed in an upcoming patch (downloaded of course after a weekly maintenance for a non MMO game) because as it stands right now, Blizzard/Activision was just not prepared and this game seems to just be dependant on the high fanbase that Diablo2 had as well as Warcraft/Starcraft junkies/fans.', "ymmvI give it 4 stars over all, because I did have to wait like a day and a half to play it due to authentication server issues, single player... That's just bad.", "There are various things you can do to minimize the occurrence of each of these issues, but I'm really hoping Blizzard pumps out a patch soon to resolve the most common of these (like the entire game hanging up and booting you out when you join multiplayer games that overtax your video GPU).>>>GRAPHICS / ART DESIGN: I said earlier that the visuals are WoW-esque, and I still stand by that (the skill icon design, architecture, UI layout, etc.)", 'Blizzard is having a few issues getting the servers going.', 'the installer had a few issues but did finally download the entire game before the servers went live at 3am EST.at about 3:02am i try to log in.', "All I wanted to do was play a single player game and I got repeated messages telling me the server was down.Now I understand sometimes there are going to be server issues, but why should I have to deal with that if I'm not playing the game online with other people?", 'First off, any review that whines about connection issues, lagging, having to have a internet connection, or server wait times; I would just pass on because these are unrealistic DAs.', 'I have no idea when part two, the part where you can actually play the game, will occur.I recommend skipping this game, at least for now.UPDATE:Now that the issues with the Battle.net servers seems to have been solved, I would recommend Diablo 3.', 'When you have millions of people trying to sign in on one game naturally there are going to be issues.', 'I get the idea considering how bad Diablo II was abused but there is no reason with the server issues that they had should a game like this require a constant internet connection just to play.', "The biggest no no here is how they're making an essentially single player game require an internet connection, and constant access to their servers in order to play it.This basically means you do not own this game, if years down the road this company goes bankrupt, you will not play this game again, if you have connection issues, you will not play this game, if you are a soldier without internet access, you will not play this game.Do not support blizzard and their unwarranted greed, buy torchlight 2 instead.", 'Even Witcher 2 had first day server issues and its an SP only game!', '(continued again)The end of day two on into the third day of release shows massive lag issues continuing randomly when starting new games.', 'ALl of these cost less than D3 and are at least as good if not better games, and none of them have the technical issues that D3 has.', 'If you like that sort of game you will still not like D3 due to the bugs and connection issues, but when (presumably later in 2012) they get their house in order, the game should be enjoyable for you.For me, D3 fails on all levels: not story-driven, and bugs and connection-issues are so frequent that it reduces the fun in single-player mode, leading to frustration.']

column2: ['From Act 1 Normal thru Act 2 Inferno D3 plays like a 4.5 rating.', 'It does earn its mature rating for both adult themes and glorious, gratuitious violence though.There are some flaws.', "I think they are trying to fix things, but they have done so many things wrong so far that I just can't give this game a good rating.", 'The average user is going to start to get stuck around late nightmare/early hell difficulty, and either quit in frustration and give the game a 1 star rating or keep running through dungeons trying to get more gold for that next piece of armor or awesome weapon, to get a bit deeper into the game.', "This time, I am giving it a good rating because quite frankly it's an enjoyable game.", "I intend to update this review with additional commentary and possibly star rating tweaks as time goes on.>>>UPDATE 5/21/2012: I'm upping this to 4 stars now that I've almost completed a full play-through.", "The lag can be crippling, but it's not crippling often.The game is excellent, but the lack of an offline mode is still pretty ridiculous, so I'm rating it 4/5."]
column4: ['however, the game deserves the rating of 2 stars on content simply because it has nothing i mean nothing in common with the first two diablos gameplay wise.the game is god of war, nothing but a slash and hack game.', "I shouldn't have the game kicking me out every 5 minutes when I'm just getting up to get the kids something to eat or change a diaper or whatever.So my 1-star rating is actually a 3-star rating for good gameplay (maybe even 4 stars if your expectation really just was for an updated version of exactly the same recipe, no surprises), minus two stars as a punitive measure for hobbling the overall experience so badly with the damnable DRM.Oh look... battle.net kicked me off again while I was writing this.", "I shouldn't have the game kicking me out every 5 minutes when I'm just getting up to get the kids something to eat or change a diaper or whatever.So my 1-star rating is actually a 3-star rating for good gameplay (maybe even 4 stars if your expectation really just was for an updated version of exactly the same recipe, no surprises), minus two stars as a punitive measure for hobbling the overall experience so badly with the damnable DRM.Oh look... battle.net kicked me off again while I was writing this.", 'I am now contacting the BBB as they seem to somehow have a A+ rating which is clearly not a good indication of how this company handles business.', 'You probably already know by my rating that I am not impressed by this game.', '(Does not look disproportionate when running through the landscape)Music/Sound: (3/5) This is my lowest rating.', 'Does that mean fishing and basketball are completely ruined and deserve the lowest rating you can give?', "In hindsight, this probably should have tipped me off as to the quality of the game that I was so eagerly awaiting.CONCLUSION==========Don't believe all those 'expert' reviews on the internet, like the mindboggling 100% rating (!!)", 'It gets a 1 star rating from me because of how much worse of a game in many ways (gameplay, battle.net, etc.)', 'People are not rating this game on game play but on launch date.', 'The health globes are convenient, but they definitely give the game a more childish, side-scroller type of feel, which is in stark contrast to its darker backstory and Mature rating.', 'Blizzard could not control the hacking on battle.net, and so the solution is to force everyone onto battle.net, where the same hackers could attack the servers I am forced to use, and possibly attack the ports on my network that battle.net uses.4) "You are not rating the game, you are rating battle.net.', 'Blizzard could not control the hacking on battle.net, and so the solution is to force everyone onto battle.net, where the same hackers could attack the servers I am forced to use, and possibly attack the ports on my network that battle.net uses.4) "You are not rating the game, you are rating battle.net.', ')The game gets a three star rating from me, period.']

column2: ['And I have heard the complaints that it is impossible to finish Inferno without Real-Money Auction House (which is clearly not how it is supposed to work) but up to Nightmare, using the Auction House is the only way to get enough money to be able to do the enhancements you want, craft or buy the items you covet and unlock the precious extra stash space you need.CHAINS IN NEED OF BREAKINGI withheld the second star because of the always-online requirement.', 'Ok so first of all after actually playing this game the only reason I can imagine anyone would give it only one star is rage toward the real money auction house.', "I might actually knock off a star in the review, but I feel enough people have been unduly harsh.Overall Verdict:I really enjoy the game, and I'm glad that I finally got the opportunity to play it!", 'And most of the 1 star reviews are also fans of diablo 2, but dont like it since its more of a "mainstream" game thats tailored to everyone instead of being some "hardcore" oldschool game from the 90\'s that they all grew up on.', 'Graphics:  When most people including most 5 star reviews note that the graphics are last gen, I believe them.', "I'd say that is worth 1 star :p", "Blizzard didn't reinvent the wheel and this long-time fan is so very glad for that.FYI I take one star off only because it isn't a perfect game, but few are.", 'First, I marked off a star because of the watered down customization, this is a huge issue for me, but may not apply to everyone.', "For this reason, I have deducted one star -- because while the issue doesn't impact me personally, it does impact others and that makes it a less than perfect design, from the game infrastructure point of view.The gameplay of Diablo 3 is quite old school, true to the spirit of the older iterations of the series.", "That, for some reason, has people raging and giving 1 star for a game that is honestly more deserving than what they're finding wrong with it.", 'The average user is going to start to get stuck around late nightmare/early hell difficulty, and either quit in frustration and give the game a 1 star rating or keep running through dungeons trying to get more gold for that next piece of armor or awesome weapon, to get a bit deeper into the game.', 'The amount of detail you see is incredible.--------Online--------So this is what most 1 star reviews are about.', 'Diablo I and II would have gotten full 5 star reviews from me if I had reviewed them back in the day, but I have to admit that being so enamored with them, Diablo III is just a 3.5 star game so far.', 'Diablo I and II would have gotten full 5 star reviews from me if I had reviewed them back in the day, but I have to admit that being so enamored with them, Diablo III is just a 3.5 star game so far.', 'Thanks for making a fun game...I was just hoping that I could thank you for making a "GREAT" game.5/30/2012 - OK, had to update it and bump it down one star (it would have been half a star if I could, since I would have originally rated it 3.5 stars).', 'Thanks for making a fun game...I was just hoping that I could thank you for making a "GREAT" game.5/30/2012 - OK, had to update it and bump it down one star (it would have been half a star if I could, since I would have originally rated it 3.5 stars).', 'Lowering my review to one star -- considering the development time, expectations, cost, and launch state, IMHO, this is the greatest catastrophe in the history of online gaming.', "I intend to update this review with additional commentary and possibly star rating tweaks as time goes on.>>>UPDATE 5/21/2012: I'm upping this to 4 stars now that I've almost completed a full play-through.", "I love how many people give it a 1 star because they couldn't log in when everyone in the entire world was trying to log into the same server.", 'It lost a full star for the technical issues.', 'It gets a total of four stars excluding technical issues because it is decent and entertaining, but it is by no stretch a five star game.', "Stopping to write this review is hard, but, when I heard of all the 1 star reviews going up due to some temporary login issues I thought I'd hop on.Graphics: I'm playing on a top of the line iMac I bought last year and the game looks absolutely gorgeous."]
column4: ['Take away the Auction-House, however, and the always-online requirement becomes a severe and now unjustified hindrance!THE ORIGINAL SINNo, D3 looses its third and final star for being both short and boring at times.', '(4 stars, 1 star taken off due to the super easy diffculty through Hell).- If you are hoping for end game content, or attaining the nice epic gear or sets, the game will get boring really quick and not worth it.', 'ANSWER:  The server issues alone are enough to give the game a 1 star at current time.', "Story:  I'm sorry again, most people even 5 star reviews saying the story is forgettable (if they are kind) and horrible (if they are mean) tells me that the story is simply lack luster.", "Just because you can't log in the first day or don't have internet connection you have to complain and give it one star - unfortunately piracy has this necessary.", 'I just feel long-term replay value may be hurt by this and past Diablo games have been known for replay value.I marked off a second star for the fact that you must have an internet connection to play single player.', "This isn't a one star game even if the launch was problematic.", 'Like other persons reviewing, with online only games one only has to look to the ratings to see the star count drop dramatically.', "Not sure why anyone wouldn't give this game at least a 3+ star.", "Lastly, while connection problems occurred in the first day of release with millions of people banging on the servers, by the third day technical issues have gone away completely, I played 10+ hours yesterday without a single hiccup.This is a very fun game, even more so with a friend or a sibling, heck only reason I'm here instead of playing is because I wanted to order diablo 3 mouse and saw these terrible reviews here.Only drawback I see is that the game lost some of its gritty feel and feels abit more generic fantasy than previous games in the series, not worth taking a star away for, but I do hope Blizzard takes note.", "It is simply unplayable (lag, disconnects, 40 minutes of lost progress) at random times, and that's why my review is 1 star instead of 2 stars.Until then, save your money, and buy something else.", 'I think I would have given the game a four star out of five (with the expansion).', "This isn't as bad as that, but its close.So overall its a two star game for me.", 'It gets a 1 star rating from me because of how much worse of a game in many ways (gameplay, battle.net, etc.)', "Really, it's just fun plain and simple.Customization- well, this is where I a little disappointed, but I'm not going to knock a star because of it.", '3 stars for the game -2 stars for bugs and DRM.Could gain another star in my book once they fix the bugs.', 'This alone knocks points off the game, and as Blizzard has no intention of changing that, I see no reason why this review will ever rise above a three star.', ')The game gets a three star rating from me, period.']

column2: ['Fix you lag plagued servers or give us offline mode.Update:Now the servers a re even laggier, more disconnects, more rubber banding and blizzard does nothing....also we get the pleasure of having 15+ gold spam request a day in our inbox when we log in....again reported over and over, on the forums...blizzard does nothing.', 'I enjoyed the graphics and "Lore".They did add a lot of content but what I personally think is they need a offline mode like they did for Starcraft 2, They need to add a bit more to the game like "PVP" then it will be a lot better.This is all my personal opinion of this game and do keep in mine it is rated MA 17+ meaning it is not intended for children.', 'On top of that there are many disappointments.1) Content that repeats itself over and over and over (no randomized levels like Diablo 2)2) Still lacking PVP that was promised....3) No offline mode4) Auction House that is pretty much useless for the most part..... and many many more.So wait until the game goes on sale cheap, if you really want to try it.', ")You get cool followers in single player mode.You get tons of cool spells/moves and passive skills, and they are easy to use and customize.Potions and gems stack, you get better gems, and you can reuse gems.You can improve your blacksmith, jeweler, and stash.New classes make gameplay more interesting.You can redo any quest you did already.You can sell your old items in the auction house.You can carry and stash more stuff than in Diablo 2.Cons__________Can't play offline.", 'This game was over 11 years in the making and when it finally was released it was filled with bugs, exploits, server issues, and no single player offline mode.', 'i was expecting it to be more like Starcraft 2, where you had to login to battlenet to play, but you could still play in offline mode.', "* Forced into certain builds to even survive in Inferno* Inferno is on big gear check, with drop rate being factored into the existence of the AH* Real Money Auction House will have high fee's* Online only DRM, so no offline solo play.", 'First, in my opinion this game should have a completely balanced offline single player mode, which builds on the legacy of previous Diablo products and ensures those with no internet can enjoy.', 'Loved em and played them like crazy but offline.', 'Honestly, the fact that D3 is also online only and no single player offline is not that big of a deal.', "This is usually the case in all of Blizzard's games.Fun: (4/5) Diablo 2 and the original Diablo were all pretty easy to complete by playing solo (on or offline).", 'I would recommend skipping completely or waiting at least half a year and maybe then everything will be smooth and they will add offline play...', 'Not only is your offline solo game unplayable on the go minus wifi, rest assured that all the real thieves/pirates/hackers out there for whom you are enduring this absurdity are currently enjoying login-free, uninterrupted solo gaming for absolutely free!', '"That is true, but remember that many of us had been playing D2 for 12 years, and we were used to the freedom of being able to play offline.', "All the negative feedback this game has gotten in just one day speak for itself.Not only this adds 0 resale value but you cannot even play your own copy if the servers go down and I'm not even referring to online play but even playing the offline campaign requires an active Internet connection.If you thought Starcraft 2 had a draconian DRM scheme then better not waste your money on Diablo 3 or wait until the price drops to $9.", 'The fact is, most of these problems could have easily been fixed by not requiring an Internet connection to play an offline game.', "The lag can be crippling, but it's not crippling often.The game is excellent, but the lack of an offline mode is still pretty ridiculous, so I'm rating it 4/5."]
column4: ["*Blizzard does require you to be constantly connected to the Internet while playing the game (you cannot play the game offline), but you do not need the Game Disc in the drive once you've registered your copy.", 'The other problem is that this game has no offline mode, just have to be connected to the internet to play the game.', 'There have been plenty of other reviews so I\'ll make it short:Pros:Fun for the first 15-20 hours of gameplayEasy to get intoIntuitive gameplayGood voice actingPretty environmentsCons:No customization of charactersVery shallow end gameTerrible, awful, atrocious money grab for auction houseNo offline gameplay (must be connected to the internet to play by yourself)Near impossible progression of end game for "casual" playersTerrible item dropsFrustrating monster combinations of special skills where luck is more involved than skillI hope you like farming/grinding goldSkill sets are extremely narrow for end game', 'The servers go down every so often and unlike SC2 no offline play at all.', "Also, lack of an offline option is ridiculous, it doesn't stop cheating/piracy and is terrible for loyal customers.", 'No offline mode how pathetic.... Internet connection is mandatory and Blizzard guess what?', 'You are not getting ANY money from me until this game is offline, I want to play it without an internet connection, not everyone has an internet connection all the time.Pathetic.', 'This is a review for hardcore players mainly.What are the issues with this long awaited game?you cant play single player offline, you have to be online at all times in order to play the game!', 'That means you need to log into the game to play, and no offline mode to play by yourself.', "How do I know I can believe that nobody will invade my privacy since I am giving away access to my computer by accepting terms of game?I'd buy this game if I had gaming-only computer, I don't care if someone browses through list of my games, but I don't even wanna give someone opportunity to read my mails...wish there was Diablo III for Playstation 3.Single player games SHOULD be made for offline playing!!", "Unlike SC2, however, Diablo 3 can't be played in an offline mode once the game has been authenticated on the battle.net servers, but instead is actually played on the servers themselves, even when played in single player/non-public mode.", "It's ridiculous how you can't play this game offline when you want, which would be great, because I wouldn't have to deal with random D/C all the time.", 'SC2 requires a login to play, but if servers are down, you can play offline through the campaign.', "Oh, I definitely have a high-speed internet connection, but it's not perfect:  maybe once every 15-45 minutes (I'm guessing), it'll blink offline for a couple of seconds.", "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", 'Yes, the mandatory online is crap and there should be an offline mode.', 'I was foolish enough to buy and install D3 without realizing that there would be no LAN play, and no offline single player.', 'And that sickening DRM always online, cant play offline is a joke and insult.Playing it it actually feels less fun the D2 that I was playing all week leading up to this.', "What they don't mention is that they do not have the bandwidth to allow you to login and actually play the game.Blizzard had to have known this was a purely idiotic plan to couple the offline play to the servers.", 'The author was suggesting you commit suicide in real life if you had a problem with this game being offline.', "It's still pretty upsetting that there's no offline mode, and I can't play the game in single player mode when the servers go down (often).", 'The game has NO offline mode which makes the product completely worthless for the time being.']

column2: ["In fact, it's a little better in the sense that people won't be getting robbed when they make a purchase on eBay (provided that's still possible...)Long-term Play Value and the Challenge of Inferno Mode:As I said, these games come in bursts for me.", 'It makes absolute no sense to force players to use the in-game text chat or other external programs like skype and ventrilo.', "Sure, you'll get a good item here and there but the more you progress the more difficult and the less sense it makes to keep farming.", 'No sense of accomplishmentHardcore Literally Impossible - Self explanatoryFarming lacks purpose - You need the best gear to farm.', "Only a decade between installments... let's all collectively hope that Diablo IV comes along sooner than 2032.The game itself is cool; the physics is great, the environments and immersion, the sense of force and motion.", "Normally at the end of a video game (at least a good one), I feel a sense of happiness and sadness (sad that it's over, happy at how much fun I had with it).", "mind you that is today, I can't imagine 4-5 years from now.-bosses only drop loot the first time you kill them, no matter what the mode of difficulty-inferno isn't fun, 1 shotted from off screen = not fun, 1 shotted from everything = not fun, it's not even challenging, it's just stupid-once you hit inferno act 1, be prepared to farm farm farm for cash before you can progress to act 2...for days-character growth/scaling is insane...at level 50 you are using a 200 dmg weapon i believe, by 55 500, by 60 1600. the scaling makes no sense, why linear growth the entire game until the end then exponential.-max character level is only 60, you are 60 long before you beat inferno, this appears to be a decision late in the development process which i imagine contributes to the terrible character scaling in the 50s.-most classes get their best abilities by 20, ...why-auction house constantly down/very laggy-some classes (DH, Monk) are WAY better than others at the moment, this can only lead to character normalization or everyone playing the same class.", 'I don\'t get a sense like i did in D2 that this is "my unique character build".- replay ability ( i fear that once i level up about 3-4 different characters there will be no need for me to start a new "build" of the same class with different stats, skills b/c i can just change or upate the skills of my current character)  something i did countless times in Diablo 2- can only handle 4 players in multiplayer (D2 had 8)Overall still very fun and i feel blizzard is really committed to making everything balanced and feels right no matter what skills you are trying to use.', 'I feel like the game believes it is important some how which annoys me (makes no sense to say this I know but this is the sense I came away with).3) just like with StarCraft, it feels like there is a plan to bilk more money out of people through follow up material.', 'I feel like the game believes it is important some how which annoys me (makes no sense to say this I know but this is the sense I came away with).3) just like with StarCraft, it feels like there is a plan to bilk more money out of people through follow up material.', 'Magic find increases the chances of getting yellow items, but chances are they are still crap.There are far too many possible attributes during item rolls, so as a result you will almost always get items which make no sense whatsoever (example: Wizard hat with Strength, or Barbarian sword with Intelligence, etc.)', "I'm sure someone will say that makes choosing a weapon easier, but it just makes the game make no sense, unless you look at it from the perspective of the developers not having the time or creativity to actually develop a convincing attack bonus system for casters.In a way, the makers are lucky that people are locked out of the game.", "No, it makes no sense why this character, who was killed in D1, would return (complete with memorable catchphrase), but apparently Blizzard thought this would be some sort of a 'treat' for Diablo fans."]
column4: ['The story had a sense of depth, a sense of epicness, a sense of utter failure should you not complete your goal.Act 1 of Diablo 3 goes along this line pretty well.', 'The story had a sense of depth, a sense of epicness, a sense of utter failure should you not complete your goal.Act 1 of Diablo 3 goes along this line pretty well.', 'The story had a sense of depth, a sense of epicness, a sense of utter failure should you not complete your goal.Act 1 of Diablo 3 goes along this line pretty well.', "No sense bringing up the mess that was Blizzard's attempt at forcing us to play a *single-player game* over an always-online connection.", 'yay?...There are a ton of things that made absolutely no sense for them to do.', 'Seriously, if the classes make sense to you then there should be a Panda village nearby also and there should be a class for them.', 'Once you get it up and running (might require moving to a new town that has the internet), and beating the whole game once, things begin to make sense.', "I'm on the fence with the replacement of mana with job specific meters, but it actually makes sense after thinking about it.That being said, I don't hate the game.", 'It is unlikely I will make use of the real currency auction house but I can see how that could appeal to a dedicated fan base.As a busy person, this game provides me quick bursts of gaming without having to dedicate several continuous hours to get any sense of accomplishment.', "no 'builds'), the sense of deja vu that you get when you play due to the game being so similar in design to Diablo 2, and the small scope of the game.", "It makes no sense for this to happen and is an example of extent of the absurd hand-holding and 'noob-ification' of this game.Another example is the ELIMINATION of the use of TOWN PORTAL or IDENTIFY scrolls.", "No sense paying for a game that you can't play half the time."]

column2: ['I enjoyed the graphics and "Lore".They did add a lot of content but what I personally think is they need a offline mode like they did for Starcraft 2, They need to add a bit more to the game like "PVP" then it will be a lot better.This is all my personal opinion of this game and do keep in mine it is rated MA 17+ meaning it is not intended for children.', "Starcraft II only showed me more perfection (even if it had its own problems, but Starcraft wasn't balanced overnight).", "Starcraft II only showed me more perfection (even if it had its own problems, but Starcraft wasn't balanced overnight).", "Also playing on ultra settings wasn't very impressive, i don't know I guess i'm more of a cod/bf3 graphic guy.For now I'll stick to Starcraft II, way better game.Another note:The game took 12 gigs which isn't much for the average pc gamer but when your solid state disk has 30 gigs left its a lot.", 'i was expecting it to be more like Starcraft 2, where you had to login to battlenet to play, but you could still play in offline mode.', 'Then it became the sale of in-game vanity items for real cash, in a game that already charges $40 for an expansion every 2 years on top of the existing $15 monthly fee.In Starcraft 2, there was surprisingly very little milking of the product on the surface.', 'But for the most part, Starcraft 2 is actually a quality title, and one that I will continue to play and enjoy.Sadly, the same amount of time and effort put into Starcraft 2 was not made here.', 'But for the most part, Starcraft 2 is actually a quality title, and one that I will continue to play and enjoy.Sadly, the same amount of time and effort put into Starcraft 2 was not made here.', "There's not any significant content on the horizon other than the PvP patch (which will get old very quickly), there's no custom user-created content like Starcraft 2 has either (which isn't necessary under normal circumstances, but when there's this little content to the game, it absolutely is necessary).", 'I was more of an RTS PC gamer in the past from loving Warcraft III and Starcraft.', "Their hubris, likely derived from dictating gameplay in titles like Starcraft's knife-edged tuning and World of Warcrafts ongoing and so thoroughly controlled aspects of progression, balance, and player empowerment, are evident in it's inclusion and execution.", 'I own World of Warcraft and Starcraft 2.', 'Currently I have WoW, Starcraft 2 and Diablo on numerous computers.', 'My husband is away most of the week working, so we were going to play this together at night when he is away from home, but we may just have to go back to World of Warcraft or I may have to resort to playing Starcraft 2 with him (ick).', "Much like I heard about Starcraft 2, it wasn't very innovative.", "Since they're pulling so much from WoW and Starcraft, perhaps tabbed chat?", 'its way better then Starcraft 2 in my opinion :-)some of the reviews here are a bit negitive.', 'Starcraft II was the most recent warning, when people discovered that much of the functionality of Starcraft had actually disappeared and live internet was required even for single player campaigns (which also were initially missing 2 of the 3 playable races included in Starcraft 1 by default).', 'Starcraft II was the most recent warning, when people discovered that much of the functionality of Starcraft had actually disappeared and live internet was required even for single player campaigns (which also were initially missing 2 of the 3 playable races included in Starcraft 1 by default).', 'Starcraft II was the most recent warning, when people discovered that much of the functionality of Starcraft had actually disappeared and live internet was required even for single player campaigns (which also were initially missing 2 of the 3 playable races included in Starcraft 1 by default).', 'It reminds me of Warcraft III and the early Starcraft but more beefed up.', 'This time I was prepared and so far, so good.Thank you Blizzard for doing the same as you did with Starcraft and making this installable on both a Mac and a PC as I had no problems installing on either but again, requiring one to be online to play single player was not a good idea!EDIT:Diablo III: Is the trip back to hell worth it?So after 2-3 hrs of waiting for the servers to go online, an hr of phone time with Verizon to reset my internet connection and finally putting four or five hrs in, here is where we stand:Issue #1: Blizzard really dropped the ball on the server issue.', "All the negative feedback this game has gotten in just one day speak for itself.Not only this adds 0 resale value but you cannot even play your own copy if the servers go down and I'm not even referring to online play but even playing the offline campaign requires an active Internet connection.If you thought Starcraft 2 had a draconian DRM scheme then better not waste your money on Diablo 3 or wait until the price drops to $9."]
column4: ['To start, I was a long time fan of Blizzard and their games, from Starcraft and Diablo 2 to their usually unheard of Sega Genesis games.', 'The game suffers from HORRIBLE itemization and Bobby Kotick\'s hand on it, with the stupid DRM, and the absolutly garbage RMAH, and the stupid itemization that blizzard putted, forcing players to get stuff from the RMAH.THE GAME SUCKS, BLIZZARD sucks as a gaming company, long gone are the days of jewels like SC and BW, WC3 and TFT, and WOW vanilla and original.Everything since ACTI MERGE has been bad, with the only possible exception being Starcraft 2, because of the extremely active and massive community iteraction that went to the game, making it the only one "decent" but nowhere near as good as BROODWAR.', 'Unfortunately that\'s not the case with Blizzard, they are no longer this "quality benchmark" or "standard placer" on the market as the original Warcraft, Starcraft and Diablo games did.', 'I will not remember this fondly like I do Diablo 2 or the Starcraft Series.SHAME ON YOU BLIZZARD, THIS GAME IS A SCAM4/10', 'As with Starcraft 2, the game is intended to be played through battle.net.', "It also comes with Diablo and Diablo 2(A $20 value) pre-loaded onto the flash drive, much like Starcraft 2 did with their Collector's Edition.What Diablo 3 has done wrong:* Always online DRM, not everyone has an internet connection, LAN and single player was a very big part of the success of Diablo 2, and well, some people don't want to play the game with other people.", "Seven action slots on a UI bar, this is so mid 90s; however, it works.Summary:If you like the game play of titles such as C&C;, Red Alert, Starcraft, & Dawn of War; you'll like this game.", "Yes, I had some of the problems that others had getting into the game and yes Blizzard, requiring a constant internet connection to play DOES INDEED SUCK, but it's the first day of launch and one of the most anticipated PC games since the LAST Starcraft game is back to suck time out of our hands once again.I remember getting a hold of Diablo II back in 2002 to play while I was out sick and it dominated my life for nearly 4 months and in that time, I had to upgrade my PC twice so that it would run properly."]

column2: ["i think over the years, Blizzard has perfected the click-to-death Diablo franchise to be a game that's easy enough for anyone to pick up, while maintaining the challenges that hardcore gamers like myself love about the franchise.", "Even the things that made the older versions better aren't all there (ie a little less linear character development).General impression: mehI recommend anyone wait it out until it becomes a $9.99 download and play it if you have nothing else going on.", 'Ok so first of all after actually playing this game the only reason I can imagine anyone would give it only one star is rage toward the real money auction house.', 'Do your own math and avoid talking to anyone except people you know and have fun with.16.', 'Ive been through the first the second diablo the expansion, anyone from that time period who enjoyed the franchise for what it was would be a fool not to have purchased d3 from launch.', 'They do game audio better than just about anyone, except maybe Valve.', 'I would argue that if this game did one thing right above anything and anyone else it was how nearly perfect the gameplay was; to send your character into the foray against hundreds of demons and watch them smash them all to literal pieces; to revel in the way passive and active skills synergized to empower each other; to listen to your character taunt the hordes after a single blow levels an entire pack.', "Multiplayer experience is great too and simple, your friends can join your game or you can join theirs and play both together with the same or even more fun, you can also join public games or make your game public to party with other people, your loot is your own and you won't have any issues with anyone, in fact you will end up trading and buying\\selling items in the Auction House and it is fun.", 'I for one really don\'t care about the "RMAH," and I don\'t know anyone else who cares either.', 'Aside from the major rip-off especially for people like me who are traveling for work all the time, I have a major beef with anyone telling me how to use a product when I own it.']
column4: ['The game is well made, updated and its awesome!.I would really suggest anyone to buy it.', 'But anyone who takes an honest assessment of what makes a game a game - gameplay, A.I., story, visuals, depth, etc will see that D3 is a MAJOR improvement.', 'I, unashamed, recommend this game to anyone that reads this review.', 'I have no idea why anyone would even spend real money on gear for their characters in this game when the gear is so unoriginal anyway.', "i guess they partner with anyone that pays, because you can't tell me at this point in life they aren't aware of spammers, this is far from their first game.-no set bonuses, there are set items, but the bonuses are just normal bonuses like +25 str- itemization as a whole is terrible.", "Normal difficulty is as it should be - not so easy that it's boring, but not so hard that anyone is likely to get stuck.", "Not sure why anyone wouldn't give this game at least a 3+ star.", 'Not only were the servers screwed up on launch day, not allowing anyone on until about 4pm eastern time, but anytime their servers are clogged, your SINGLE PLAYER game gets lagged an unplayable.', "Though I'm guessing that there will be the eventual expansion with additional characters and levels, and I will probably be one of those people purchasing that as well.So to anyone from Blizzard who might read this, I have to say that this is the first time I have felt a little let down, in that the game does feel a little dumbed down, but it's still fun to play.", "However this watered down garbage is not worth anyone's time let alone the obscene 60$ price tag.", 'Having said that, I would not buy this game nor recommend it to anyone.', 'There are no fixes for server lag, disconnects, and deaths due to lagging out.They are causing anyone who was used to playing a class, alone or with other people in strictly co-op (no PvP yet!!)', "but it's hard to imagine that anyone would do the same with this game.In the end, I have to say that while fun for awhile, D3 is ultimately a massive disappointment to fans of the series.", 'Can anyone really question the noob-ification and extreme linearness of this game?', 'This is an epic let down to the fans and anyone else that paid $60 for this game and is being treated like they just downloaded a free to play Zynga game.']

column2: ['Someone needs to tell marketers, just because a castle sells on Ebay from Ultima Online some years back for a grand, does not mean that millions of gamers who buy games without monthly fees will buy virtual items for real money.', 'I’ve loved all their games and am a 10 year veteran of World of Warcraft.', 'I am NOT an online gamer anymore but I have all the old Diablo and Warcraft games and I was looking forward to trying Diablo 3 and expansion when the came in the mail.', 'I am a long-time gamer, but I tend to prefer FPS games with the occasional action RPG (Skyrim, Witcher 3) thrown in.', "I have so many online games to play, that if I'm home I play those games.", "I have so many online games to play, that if I'm home I play those games.", 'Pretty hard to live up to the newer style of multi variable choice-outcome games today.', "Diablo 3 has been one of those games that has been labelled as garbage and it's really a shame.", "For the record, I've never used the RMAH- yet I still respect those that make the choice to use it.2)Always Online/Server Error at LaunchAlways online is a feature that many games were forcing long before Diablo (and soon consoles will be forcing it, too).", 'Granted, you have the right to not like the always-online rule, but to DOWNVOTE it is an unfair marker of the games quality - you\'re essentially saying, "Even if this was the best game ever made, because it forces me to always be online, I recommend you don\'t buy it."', 'Its more or less the sign of the times where everything has to be monetized and free-to-play games charge $1000s of dollars to little kids parents.', "The games skill system is weak and lacks depth, the gold and real money AH take away the fun of loot hunting, the graphics are okay but are to bright and not dark enough, and the map aren't random enough.", 'Great game though, would recommend to anybody interested in games of this type.', 'Were to start> well I have been a diablo fan since you now back with the first diablo which I loved and played nonstop back in 96 along side command and conquer:)those were amazing pc games at the time;)diablo 2 was good but I preferred the first better,as far as the third goes I prefer it better than 2 and close to on par with the original:)', "I can't think of many games that I would play through more than two times, and although I no longer play regularly, it's still fun to pickup for a quick grind now and then.", 'Diablo has alway been one of my favorite games.', "I don't know why exactly, but this didn't draw me back to it the way the first 2 Diablo games did.", 'It really is that simple.The most addicting part about these games is farming gear and PVP.', 'Anyone who was into the previous Diablo games will love this one too.', 'I did not get it as soon as it was released as I knew they would have problems right out of the gate, which is also why I bought the actual boxed version, even though most games I buy and download via Steam, Origin and Gameplay.', 'Because lets be real its BLIZZARD, they place gameplay over graphics and their games last over 12 years at a time so why not go the extra mile so the visuals will age well?', 'Yeah it requires some serious power to run on max but thats the way I like it cause no one can make games like Blizzard and Valve.Infact the Havok Engine of Diablo 3 is superior to Source Engine since valve has yet to be able to animate foliage.', 'People now want some sort of MMO content in their games especially where real money is concerned.', 'that I like, but most find these to be the greatest detriments to the game or the areas that need the most improvement.Unlike many games, this game is continually updated and revised.', 'Piracy is killing PC games and yes, blizzard has a right to make a profit.', 'I am not a super avid gamer but when I find time to play I get pretty addicted to some games, and this is one of them.Starting out, my friends and I agreed that there were a few things lacking compared to Diablo 2 however since all of the new patches and updates things just keep getting better and better.', 'However you can join random games and meet some pretty cool people and team up to play.Overall I highly recommend it if you enjoy any of the other blizzard games especially the previous Diablo 2.', 'However you can join random games and meet some pretty cool people and team up to play.Overall I highly recommend it if you enjoy any of the other blizzard games especially the previous Diablo 2.', "And it's one of those games which has such an epic predecessor that I simply had to try despite its accumulative 2-stars.", "The Good: Gorgeous art style, some of the best pre-rendered cut scenes I have ever seen, more loot than you can shake a stick at, varied environments, awesome enemy designs, some tough bosses, lots of replay value, Auction House can be a second incomeThe Bad: Level layout can get boring and tedious, some poor difficulty balancing, game needs to be constantly connected online, requires dedication to get the best loot, loot isn't all that great until higher levelsDiablo III is one of the most long-awaited games in history.", 'Everyone who played the last two games were either in high school or college at the time and are now in their 30′s and 40′s. 12 years in the making with so much turmoil and history to write a novel about.', "I do this as a hobby because I love games, I don't get a cent.", 'Stats get auto incremented with level (previous games involved putting everything on vitality pretty much,
