have reported their accounts compromised by hackers…so if you do plan to get this game, I’d recommend buying an authenticator.', 'The eq is among the best in gaming and requires math, research, and testing to make it work with the huge variety of skills/ways to play your character.Unfortunately the work they did was to finish the game, which was only mediocre when released.', "Wait for a GOTY or package deal and don't pay more than current value for 1 game (around $60).", "Sure, some heads or pieces of wood can be seen to spin for too long, but that is part of the game's appeal, right?", "I wish I had something good to say about the game but I can't think of anything.", 'This is NOT a game that can be played off line.', 'Having played all Diablo available, this has a much better feeling of the play...will be purchasing xbox version shortly in hopes that the game feeling is even better.', "The game obviously doesn't live up to the old ones, but it's still a good game.", "The game obviously doesn't live up to the old ones, but it's still a good game.", 'The game is very short, but it has very good replay value.', "Although this is a good game, the price is much too high, even with Amazon's cheaper price.", 'Such a great game destroyed by the inability to play when I wanted it!', "This is a great game, I enjoy this style of gameplay and really like you don't have to pay a monthly membership to play it is really nice.", 'I loved Diablo 2 but this, this is garbage even after a year this game still blows.', 'The game is OK but not as good as the first two.', 'Enjoyable and simple RPGSomething easy to jump into with friends.I play this game with my girlfriend...and it works!', "You can have the BEST gear in the game, and still get your butt handed to you in Inferno, even with the recent patches (I've played since day 1).", 'Granted, you have the right to not like the always-online rule, but to DOWNVOTE it is an unfair marker of the games quality - you\'re essentially saying, "Even if this was the best game ever made, because it forces me to always be online, I recommend you don\'t buy it."', 'It\'s a dungeon crawler... Of all the complaints I read/hear about the game, I RARELY see "it wasn\'t fun", "the characters suck", "the skills suck", etc.', 'It has been about a year since the release of Diablo 3 and lots of things have been patched into the game to address the many faults it had at launch.', "What hasn't changed is the core of the game, skills and items which is where the problem is for D3.First off, if you played Diablo 2 and are looking at Diablo 3 for some more of that great stuff, look somewhere else.", 'At of the end of the day it is not fun, interesting or worthwhile.So finally on the game itself; its not bad.', 'Soon, youll be on the AH more than the game itself, looking for the best deals or hoping to snatch up an undervalued item.', "This is a good game but it really isn't a Diablo game.", "This is a good game but it really isn't a Diablo game.", 'Great game though, would recommend to anybody interested in games of this type.', 'The Diablo series is classic and Diablo III is a very fun, amazing game that I very much enjoy but the always on DRM ruins it.', "As a game this is a classic and for me a great addition to the series with amazing new and classic moments, but again the always on DRM is it's ruination.", "It was quit fun, but the only thing we didn't like was that we waited years to get this game for it to be kind of short.", 'I loved this game, and for the most part thought it was a GREAT followup to part 2.The storytelling is wonderful (as usual, Blizzard), the graphics are exquisite.', 'Diablo 3 is a great game which Blizzard continues to refine and improve.', 'The Diablo 3 development team has some great things planned for this game with each of the upcoming patches.', 'I enjoyed the game play.', 'I enjoyed the graphics and "Lore".They did add a lot of content but what I personally think is they need a offline mode like they did for Starcraft 2, They need to add a bit more to the game like "PVP" then it will be a lot better.This is all my personal opinion of this game and do keep in mine it is rated MA 17+ meaning it is not intended for children.', 'I enjoyed the graphics and "Lore".They did add a lot of content but what I personally think is they need a offline mode like they did for Starcraft 2, They need to add a bit more to the game like "PVP" then it will be a lot better.This is all my personal opinion of this game and do keep in mine it is rated MA 17+ meaning it is not intended for children.', "You'll think it's awesome, you'll think it's great, you'll think everything is fine and all the complainers are just uptight people who fell into the hype of a game from a massive gaming company.", 'I was planning to re-activate my world of warcraft account so I logged into my account and I see a free trail of the starter edition of Diablo 3 which is essentially first 13 levels of the game.', 'I also find the graphics very nice (on maximum settings), the world is nicely detailed and the dungeons really immerse you into the feeling of what a journey through hell might be and the game very much reminded me of the first two Hellraiser movies.', 'I found the four acts entertaining, nicely paced and boss battles were enjoyable plus I really liked the some of the achievements which looks to be lot more tailored to your game play.', 'Some of the companions story-lines were also engaging and I liked the constant banter with them much like the Dragon Age series as it makes the game world feel a little more alive.', "I also enjoyed crafting in the game which is exactly how I like a virtual profession to be; not complex or anything just being functional and not boring or becoming a repetitive chore (at least at the normal level).So in a nutshell I will recommend that you at least try the 'starter edition of Diablo 3' (which is free) and make up your own mind.", "The disclaimer is that I am a casual player who likes the hack'n'slash genre and is not into any really involved aspects of the game like the pvp (though I may try it if they ever implement team-based battlegrounds) or gearing up your character with the best tier armor/weapons/builds or trying all difficulty levels  etc.", "At first I didn't like the online control of the game,but now I'm sold.", "I think my value for the game would be good at $29.99, though I downloaded it on Blizzard's site for $59.99.", 'I have been a life long fan of Blizzard - every game more amazing than the last except D3.', 'People its only a game, anything more and you need a life.', 'This game would be totally worth the purchase as a $20 steam title but as a full priced AAA title it falls flat on its face.', 'Diablo 3 took over a decade to make and had a giant budget but it falls down on all of the key categories that make a game great.', "I'm Sure it's the Servers problem & NOT the game itself.", 'I enjoyed the game on the first play through, but then the difficulty curve got very steep very fast, and it was the same thing over and over again.', 'It was definitely a fun game and worth checking out though.', 'He says the game works great and no problems.', 'The game totally dropped all hints of love from its predecessors.', "You will have fun for a good 2 to 4 weeks depending on what level of difficulty you keep going for, but eventually you will get burnt out and the game just won't feel the same.", 'They ruined what could have been a great game.', 'The graphics are much better and the game is lots of fun.', "The first act is pretty cool, but after that it's just downhill.Torchlightis an infinitely more fun game and cheaper too.", 'While the game can be fun, it takes WAY to long to get the enjoyable part....Let me start by saying this, Diablo 3 is great at level 60 hunting down the evils of the world on a hard Monster Power setting.But it takes forever to get to this point.', 'On top of that there are many disappointments.1) Content that repeats itself over and over and over (no randomized levels like Diablo 2)2) Still lacking PVP that was promised....3) No offline mode4) Auction House that is pretty much useless for the most part..... and many many more.So wait until the game goes on sale cheap, if you really want to try it.', 'So I finally got my Diablo 3 today from Amazon, first time owning a blizzard game in my life.took a little while to reach like 2 weeks because its in the Caribbean but thats still good considering its Christmas.Anyways got it for $26 on Amazon for cyber monday.Runs fine on 1080p with 70 fps average in scenes that car calm and intense scenes goes down to 30 fps sometimes 25.', 'I was like YES YES YES this is how I like it, generally the worst the game performs the better the Graphics.Why then am I happy about it requiring high requirements?', 'So many scenes in this game I literally stop and gaze and gaze at its beauty not being able to move because of how beautiful the artwork is.Sometimes when playing D3 I have to stop very often sometimes for over 20 minutes and admire the scenery and wonder how can the human mind be so creative to design something like this.', 'We have come a long way from being apes thousands of years ago.In conclusion I would say its a very fun and satisfying game that will keep me going for atleast 5000 Hours or the next 10 years whichever comes first.', "Attributes are automatically distributed when you level, so the game becomes a little more results based.The drop rates are way better than months ago and Inferno difficulty is manageable than there were even 6 months ago.Multiplayer can be fun and as time went on, there are their unethical practices.Video gaming (and especially computer gaming as opposed to console gaming) used to be a true art form and the games stimulated your mind and spirit.The games of the last half decade have grown increasingly dumbed-down, streamlined, simplified, trivialized; they have turned into mainstream Hollywood assembly line of mass-produced garbage.", "Most of these games stimulate the game boring.thenthey added an RMAH/AH to make sure that you don\'t find any of your own gear (the entire point of the game was supposed to be leveling up skills and finding your own gear to make your skills more powerful, ie +1 to all skills) , but no they even removed that "feature" you can\'t level spells and abilities up, every spell you get is as powerful as its ever going to be (no room for improvement), your skills dont even matter, since everything is based off Main-Stat and Weapon Damage, the only reason to change spells is because you dont like the animation or appearance of a spell, since the spells effects are meaningless (they dont do anything but do damage); so all the spells feel bland/feel the same./pointless you could equip "throw squirel" and it would do same damage as "Fire Beam".The wizard is a joke, Teleport is horrible.In Short, if you were a fan of the past 3 Diablo releases (1 2 lod) you will probably be disappointed with this release, hold off till Diablo column2: ['Fun hack and slash...', 'There is no new content to explore, no epic boss battles, just the same old, same old.- So basically - if you just want 20-40 hours of fun (hitting 60, while exploring everything you find) Diablo 3 is probably a fun hack and slash.', 'One of the greatest feelings in these hack and slash games is getting USEFUL gear that makes you go "OH YEA!!!".', "Blizzard succeeded in somehow making the problem of Chinese gold farmers even worse than it already was, and also succeeded in coming off as just another sleezy game company that doesn't care about game balancing or the spirit of fair competition.-CONCLUSION-This is not the laid back and enjoyable hack and slash that hardcore-hell-mode diablo II was, this is a real life nightmare that you can only wake up from by not playing the game.-AWESOME CINEMATICS-The cinematics are awesome, watch them online.", 'Although they didn\'t really change up the formula much (shortcut keys on the keyboard, mouse control, hack and slash RPG dungeon crawler), it definitely has lots of little "oh neat" features and designs.', "I enjoyed the game the first run through - the hack 'em part, anyhow.", 'Like I said, it\'s not exactly "raising the bar" or "setting a new standard" for action-RPGs, but it\'s an addictively fun hack and slash game that I can see keeping me busy for a good part of the summer.', 'Also this will prevent hacking that is so prominent in the older titles.Now to the game play.This is a hack in slash game that its main game play is collecting the best stuff to do it again, but harder difficulty.', 'Diablo 3 is a point and click hack and slash game where the idea is to progress through the game several times, with increasing difficulty each time, as your character advances in levels (more skills and runes) and acquires better gear through loot drops.', "The experience and 'fun' value is better when you join forces with friends or strangers to take down bosses or just to go and hack and slash through dungeons.", "One of the few hack n slash clickers that isn't worth a fraction of it's pricetag.", "These make it more a ... third person tactical dungeon hack minus RPG elements (except for the class choice itself).On a positive note, it's very pretty.", "It just makes me wonder how much of this can be attributed to the DRM system.Still, the game is beautiful and the leveling system, which I haven't even touched upon, is also addictive, simple, customizable, yet perfectly adaptable enough for the kind of builds you can do with your rare & random drops you'll see as you hack your way through thousands of insane and horrific monsters from hell.", 'This is a form of DRM IMO.If the two CONS do not bother you and know that bugs WILL be fixed then take the early dive and buy the game but only if your a fan of hack n slash and the first two games.', 'The game hits hack and slash alright but many other games do it better.']
column4: ['however, the game deserves the rating of 2 stars on content simply because it has nothing i mean nothing in common with the first two diablos gameplay wise.the game is god of war, nothing but a slash and hack game.', 'It all looks way too overused and way too much like an MMORPG instead of a bloody hack and slash horror adventure.', 'Gear grinding, where drops are 99.9% useless, the game is easy, the hack and slash just gets boring.', 'This game is supposed to be a hack and slash.', 'They just want everyone to use their authenticators because they assure everyone is 100% impossible to hack.', "I'm not even saying it was impossible to hack me before, but it shouldn't have been easy.The only light at the end of the tunnel is that I see some changes coming that might make the game worth swallowing in some ways.", "It's a lesser WOW MMORPG wannabe game, designed to be more of a story telling game along with the hack n slash techniques.", 'This is a Diablo game mindless hack and slash which is fun to play when you can play it, I have had no problems at playing the game, however with Tuesday maintanence being an issue because the servers are down almost every week this will become a very big problem in the future.', "Fun to playIt's still fun to play, although it is still the same mindless, hack and slash, quasi-RPG game that the previous two are.2.", "I can only think of a handful of other titles in the past couple of decades that I felt this strongly about) at this point.This is the largest failure of the single player portion of a game due to technical reasons (note: not game design ones, I've seen enough in the Beta which was playable to know that it's an average action-RPG, hack, slash, loot, that's what they're all about) that I have ever seen."]

column2: ['Fix you lag plagued servers or give us offline mode.Update:Now the servers a re even laggier, more disconnects, more rubber banding and blizzard does nothing....also we get the pleasure of having 15+ gold spam request a day in our inbox when we log in....again reported over and over, on the forums...blizzard does nothing.', 'Fix you lag plagued servers or give us offline mode.Update:Now the servers a re even laggier, more disconnects, more rubber banding and blizzard does nothing....also we get the pleasure of having 15+ gold spam request a day in our inbox when we log in....again reported over and over, on the forums...blizzard does nothing.', 'Fine, but what it also does is limit your ability to play a product you paid for, you cannot play if you have no internet connection, if the servers are down or out, or your connection is not "stable"  (NZ and Australian players know this fact!).', "It's a real treat to have a game that looks this good without requiring bleeding-edge hardware to render it.I'm fairly certain that anybody reading this is well aware of Blizzard's controversial decision to make Diablo 3 an online-only game, so anybody contemplating a purchase will have to consider the quality of their internet service and their tolerance for a game that requires constant connection to its servers.", 'You have to wait during "maitenance schedules" which means blizzard turns off the servers and you dont get to play until they are done "fixing" problems which can take anywhere from 4-5 hours or even the whole day.', "But what should be a fun experience with neat strangers gets old fast when a couple scammers jump in your game.Two more downsides are that multiplayer servers hold only 4 people (half of Diablo II's limit) and PVP, a much advertised feature, does not actually exist yet.SUPPORTThe dealbreaker for many.", "Throw in the fact the game has to be connected all the time to the servers could lead to many annoying moments with server overload or lag, I recommend saving your 60 dollars until they iron out all these issues.~ Written: 06-12Positive:* Really cool cut-scenes* Most important NPC's have dialog options* Really good soundtrack* Sound effects really polished* Locations and skills look great* Combat is a lot of fun in the earlier difficultiesNegative:* Not the best voice acting except the jeweler.", 'The servers are still constantly down for some kind of maintenance.', 'That\'s absolute insanity, and the result is that it drives up prices, making the illegitimate "black market" sellers all the more appealing.And of course, there\'s the issue of servers.', 'An always online requirement, which limits their choice on how to play the game and eliminated 3rd party modding potential (which in light of the heavily flooded servers during the first week I gained intimate appreciation of), no skill trees, a real money auction house that encouraged a “pay to win”  mechanic, and visuals that were styled in a drastically different manner than previous installments in the series.', "If they didn't have enough servers a week gave them plenty of time to set up more.", 'That you can count on.UPDATE: As far as the battle.net servers go, they have been running much better than when the game was released.', 'What i discovered was that Blizzard took their sweet time not on the game play, using good servers, or the graphics...but with the AUCTION HOUSE.', 'The servers and public player games were a cesspool of spam-bots advertising trading services or key-logger sites preying on the ill-informed or new players.', "I don't let this bother me too much, I'm honest enough to say that in 10 years I'll have no interest in ever playing Diablo 3 again, but I also have no doubt that the servers will still be running in 10 years.", "Not a big fan of the always online thing, and while I haven't had a problem with the servers most other people have had (I've actually been pretty impressed with the multiplayer), there are disappointments none the less.", 'By this time, Blizz already fixed the servers, it even loaded tons of update setup files during installation.', "Additionally, I apparently get a lot of information from the servers because I have had beasts 'teleport' (not the special ability) from one side of the screen to the other.", '"I can\'t play this game because the servers are not 100% perfect on day one.', 'I give any online game a free pass to adjust servers the first week.', "The servers will eventually be just fine and run as smoothly as the Diablo 2 servers in it's prime!", "The servers will eventually be just fine and run as smoothly as the Diablo 2 servers in it's prime!", 'yes, in some ways, but imagine the incessant screaming that would surely have trumped all of the complaints about the servers if this game was completely changed(ala Dungeon Siege 3)Those of you thinking of returning for a refund?', 'All you own is a key that lets you in to visit the game, so long as Blizzard feels like keeping its servers up and maintaining "your" characters and data during your prescribed visiting hours.', 'Whether the series will continue to devolve into nothing more than a series of lame DLCs hidden on Blizzard servers and locked by $60-100 paygates depends as much on us as it does on them.', 'This time I was prepared and so far, so good.Thank you Blizzard for doing the same as you did with Starcraft and making this installable on both a Mac and a PC as I had no problems installing on either but again, requiring one to be online to play single player was not a good idea!EDIT:Diablo III: Is the trip back to hell worth it?So after 2-3 hrs of waiting for the servers to go online, an hr of phone time with Verizon to reset my internet connection and finally putting four or five hrs in, here is where we stand:Issue #1: Blizzard really dropped the ball on the server issue.', "All the negative feedback this game has gotten in just one day speak for itself.Not only this adds 0 resale value but you cannot even play your own copy if the servers go down and I'm not even referring to online play but even playing the offline campaign requires an active Internet connection.If you thought Starcraft 2 had a draconian DRM scheme then better not waste your money on Diablo 3 or wait until the price drops to $9.", "It also means that even though you may own this game, if Blizzard's servers go down for whatever reason, you can't play.", 'They need more servers how are they this lacking on server space when they are so very wealthy?', "I'm playing solo right now...as in single player and still since you need to connect to their servers to play... YOU CAN'T PLAY!", 'DO NOT BUY.Edited Review:About a week after launch, the servers are fairly stable now.', 'Even when the servers are up, I (and everyone I know who plays the game) get pretty colossal lag spikes from time to time.', 'But after hours and hours of not being able to play and servers being down, most of them went to bed, and forgot about the game.']
column4: ['It was a combination of factors, from the bad reviews the game kept getting, to the constant servers errors I kept hearing about and to me being too busy to take up such a time-eater.', "Yes, the game does offer some gameplay features (namely, the Auction-House) to compensate for the inconvenience but they all give way to anger and frustration whenever BlLIZZARD's servers go down  and you are unable to play a Single-player game for days at a time(!).", 'You can now reliably (servers only down for a few hours on Tuesday for server maintenance)  play the game up to level 160 (60 base levels, 100 paragon levels were patched in later), and have incentive to play public games (more party members = increased XP and magic find).', "If the servers are down you cannot play, if you lose or do not have a constant internet connection you cannot play the game you just paid 60 dollars for and there is no excuse for that....it's beyond stupid and ignorant to the players.", 'Due to DRM In a few years when this is no longer profitable to Blizzard and they shut down the servers you can never play your game again which is total BS and a waste of money, if they are doing that crap the game should be free and pay monthly to play it not pay 60 dollars to have a limited play time.', 'Yeah, I know people hacked but not being able to play if the servers are down is just freaking annoying.', "Plus, there's nothing like starting up a solo game and finding out you can't play because the remote servers are down (yes, it still happens.)", 'Instead of preparing for the launch and overcompensating for the huge demand, Blizzard chose to go the bare minimum route to see just how few servers they could get away with to run the game.', 'The servers go down every so often and unlike SC2 no offline play at all.', "It is terrible when either the internet goes out or Blizzard's servers are out.Inferno mode is practically impossible.", 'You are required to connect to the servers in order to even play a game by yourself, the reasoning behind this is that it prevents people from making illegal copies and/or duping or hacking the game.', 'Why not add a single player mode only that cannot then be transferred online for play for those who wish to enjoy the game when the internet is not an option or the servers are out?Aside from the glaring requirement of being connected in order to play there are the issues with the game play itself.', 'Its sad to see that these companies are not respecting anymore what customers want, they are making everything a business and putting down rules that break players freedom in enjoying the game.first there was the change in graphics, the toned down gore, the short story, the lag, the lag spikes, people filling up chat with ads from china, items becoming useless without buying from ah, problems with playing hardcore without being paranoid of blizzards servers, having to wait for maitenance periods.', "It's hard not to balk at all the Warcraft conceits slipping into Diablo, or Blizzard's dodgy servers, or how many ways the game feels scaled back.", 'It still lags.The first few days the servers were constantly down.', 'Heck many times i lag cause Blizzard servers suck.My third problem is the game gets boring fast, So on my first playthough it was fun, i took my time finished it at around 25 hours, so then i have to play on nightmare mode doing the same thing as normal mode but harder monsters, and then repeat on hell mode and repeat on inferno.', "You're forced to play on Blizzard's servers, which have had an embarrassingly high amount of downtime thus far.", "big part of why my group is no longer playing-drm...you have to play on their laggy, unreliable servers, no hardcore until this is resolved-don't farm for item, buy them at the AH-implemented crafting system, that is worthless - buy your items at the AH-don't farm for gold, buy it at the AH-character customization is very limited, once you reach inferno your already limited customization is usually reduced to 1 build with MINOR variations-rune system is gone, yet even less customization-every class has about -+24 abilities, 1/3 of these are actually useful-some entire classes are just crap - hi witch doctor-inferno is pretty much just for ranged characters.", 'After a few weeks of release, we should have an apology and an acknowledgement that they\'ve royally screwed up, and they should stop throwing up messages 30 minutes after servers go down that there was "scheduled maintenance."', 'Unstable servers: Its only been 2 weeks since launch, but the servers have been down for maintenance at least 5 times already.', 'Unstable servers: Its only been 2 weeks since launch, but the servers have been down for maintenance at least 5 times already.', "There is no Single player option so when servers are down, you can't play.2.)", 'I would wait on buying this game until Blizzard fixes the servers.', 'Just before going to get them, I started reading the stories of the servers crashing and players becoming frustrated because they could not play single player.', "Looking further into it, I saw that it was because Blizzard, FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER in a Diablo game, requires you to ALWAYS be connected to their servers in order to play.This means that if the server is down, you can't play.", "If they ever decide to shut down the servers, you can't play ever again.", 'You should be aware that since you cannot save this game locally you are at the complete mercy of the POS blizzard servers.', "Unlike SC2, however, Diablo 3 can't be played in an offline mode once the game has been authenticated on the battle.net servers, but instead is actually played on the servers themselves, even when played in single player/non-public mode.", "Unlike SC2, however, Diablo 3 can't be played in an offline mode once the game has been authenticated on the battle.net servers, but instead is actually played on the servers themselves, even when played in single player/non-public mode.", 'This is a Diablo game mindless hack and slash which is fun to play when you can play it, I have had no problems at playing the game, however with Tuesday maintanence being an issue because the servers are down almost every week this will become a very big problem in the future.', 'There have been a lot of negative reviews posted here and majority of them are complaining about the fact that the game is always connected to Blizzard servers.', 'SC2 requires a login to play, but if servers are down, you can play offline through the campaign.', 'The launch of the game was rocky, they had to restart the servers several times, and bring them down for patches.', 'Not only were the servers screwed up on launch day, not allowing anyone on until about 4pm eastern time, but anytime their servers are clogged, your SINGLE PLAYER game gets lagged an unplayable.', 'Not only were the servers screwed up on launch day, not allowing anyone on until about 4pm eastern time, but anytime their servers are clogged, your SINGLE PLAYER game gets lagged an unplayable.', "Lastly, while connection problems occurred in the first day of release with millions of people banging on the servers, by the third day technical issues have gone away completely, I played 10+ hours yesterday without a single hiccup.This is a very fun game, even more so with a friend or a sibling, heck only reason I'm here instead of playing is because I wanted to order diablo 3 mouse and saw these terrible reviews here.Only drawback I see is that the game lost some of its gritty feel and feels abit more generic fantasy than previous games in the series, not worth taking a star away for, but I do hope Blizzard takes note.", "D3 just isn't in the same league as the other games mentioned, and it just isn't worth paying that much for a temporary game that will be unplayable the day Blizzard decides to pull the plug on their servers, which could be tomorrow or could be 10 years from now (the mighty can fall - just look at the banks and GM).In the end, you aren't paying for a game, you're paying for a subscription to their (laggy) servers, a MMORPG without the RPG and without the MM.Games which are IMO bettersome NWN games (NWN2 Mask of the Betrayer comes to mind, as do the expansions for the first NWN)Baldur's Gate series (and anything else made by Bioware with the infinity engine, including Planescape Torment and Icewind Dale)Dragon Age OriginsGuild Wars seriesElder Scrolls seriesTorchlight series", "D3 just isn't in the same league as the other games mentioned, and it just isn't worth paying that much for a temporary game that will be unplayable the day Blizzard decides to pull the plug on their servers, which could be tomorrow or could be 10 years from now (the mighty can fall - just look at the banks and GM).In the end, you aren't paying for a game, you're paying for a subscription to their (laggy) servers, a MMORPG without the RPG and without the MM.Games which are IMO bettersome NWN games (NWN2 Mask of the Betrayer comes to mind, as do the expansions for the first NWN)Baldur's Gate series (and anything else made by Bioware with the infinity engine, including Planescape Torment and Icewind Dale)Dragon Age OriginsGuild Wars seriesElder Scrolls seriesTorchlight series", 'When a game first comes out the servers fill up and then you have issues.', 'If you are not connected to Battle.net servers at all times the game WILL NOT function...period!', 'No, there is no SAVE GAME function in Diablo 3, the servers auto save for you at each checkpoint only.Personally, the game content itself could be phenominal and I really wouldn\'t care, the explicit decision to make a  "single player game" a INTERNET ONLY game is absolutely convolted idiocy.', 'This is what you get for $59.95You need to be always on-line during single play, so when they closed down the servers someday you can never play again.You are pretty much renting this game.', "If the servers go down from time to time, we'll decide to go read a book, take a walk, or get something done and come back in a little bit.", 'The servers went through a multitude of problems on launch day, the day after launch, a few rolling restarts and server/game crashes.', "But it get's old fast, even if you start playing after Activision Blizzard manages to get their login and game play servers working.", 'I have not even mentioned the fact that in the first 2-3 days the servers have been down half the time.', 'Just warning because with the constantly dropping internet here lately and when it is up the servers are down.', "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", "Your first adventure will be creating your online account (for an offline single player game), have your character name edited/policed for naughty words (for an offline single player game), sign in to their servers (for an offline single player game) which may or may not even let you log in, then pray that you have a constant internet connection and that their distant servers (for an offline single player game) don't hiccup and kick you out of the game you just paid $60 to play.", "People are mad because they can't log onto the servers, not because the game isn't good.", "I'd say that at least 80% of the reviews on here giving the game a bad review are due to the servers functionality, or lack thereof.", 'Blizzard is having a few issues getting the servers going.', 'Like the rest stated - cannot get online, cannot play, servers constantly going down.', 'the installer had a few issues but did finally download the entire game before the servers went live at 3am EST.at about 3:02am i try to log in.', 'The vast majority servers have been down.', '"For those who like online play and can accept off-and-on laggy servers or down servers at the worst possible moment, that is probably true.', '"For those who like online play and can accept off-and-on laggy servers or down servers at the worst possible moment, that is probably true.', 'Blizzard could not control the hacking on battle.net, and so the solution is to force everyone onto battle.net, where the same hackers could attack the servers I am forced to use, and possibly attack the ports on my network that battle.net uses.4) "You are not rating the game, you are rating battle.net.', 'Everything in "your game" -- your data, your gear, your characters -- is actually Blizzard\'s, parked on one of their servers.', "It is just IDIOTIC to disallow people who paid for a single-player game from playing just because Blizzard's servers are down!", "What if an act of God occurred where the servers are which would require a long time for them to recover, so we can't play the game for an inordinate amount of time?", 'You cannot play this game UNLESS their servers are up.', 'I have no idea when part two, the part where you can actually play the game, will occur.I recommend skipping this game, at least for now.UPDATE:Now that the issues with the Battle.net servers seems to have been solved, I would recommend Diablo 3.', 'While I had no probs getting on very early yesterday, when I came home yesterday afternoon, the servers were down for at least 2 - 3 hrs (which gave me some time to play Max Payne which is a game that reminds me soooo much of Stranglehold which came out in 2007) and trying to log in a few times got so bad, that I actually had to call Verizon to have them reboot and refresh our routers from outside.', "What they don't mention is that they do not have the bandwidth to allow you to login and actually play the game.Blizzard had to have known this was a purely idiotic plan to couple the offline play to the servers.", "The biggest no no here is how they're making an essentially single player game require an internet connection, and constant access to their servers in order to play it.This basically means you do not own this game, if years down the road this company goes bankrupt, you will not play this game again, if you have connection issues, you will not play this game, if you are a soldier without internet access, you will not play this game.Do not support blizzard and their unwarranted greed, buy torchlight 2 instead.", "Yet somehow, the thing needs to constantly pull data from the Internet - even though there's no one in dungeon but you.You click, you wait, you die - often with no idea why.But let's assume for a minute that Blizzard figures out its servers eventually and the lag returns to a semi-acceptable level where the game is playable.", 'The fact that this game is Online ONLY means that as longs as the servers are running well and turned on, you may play.', "If it's your 1 day off a week where you can get time to play a game you were a fan of the franchise and Blizzard is having trouble with their servers?", 'It took an hour and a half before I could even log in to the game, because Blizzard did not take proper actions during beta to test the servers.', "It's still pretty upsetting that there's no offline mode, and I can't play the game in single player mode when the servers go down (often).", "US servers have gone down several times today, it seems they have been down more than up.Don't buy this game yet, wait for Blizzard to iron out the bugs.", 'You literally can not play this game because the developer can not keep the servers up.']

column2: ['No, you just get access to more skills over time... No skill points, no decisions.', "The games skill system is weak and lacks depth, the gold and real money AH take away the fun of loot hunting, the graphics are okay but are to bright and not dark enough, and the map aren't random enough.", "Don't hope too much for PVP unless they drastically improve their skill system.", "And, like the blacksmith, you have to keep paying to raise the jewelcrafter's skill, to combine higher level gems.", "It's not at all unusual to have a new skill unlock that causes you to completely rethink your character build.", "It's worth noting that the skill progression doesn't follow the convention of each subsequent skill simply being a more powerful variation of its predecessor (i.e.", "It's worth noting that the skill progression doesn't follow the convention of each subsequent skill simply being a more powerful variation of its predecessor (i.e.", 'but rather, each new skill is sometimes radically different from the rest.', "Purists aren't all happy with how skills work- unlike Diablo II you can unlock every skill for your character, and they level up automatically as you do.", 'But please, pick whatever you wantCookie Cutter Builds - The dumbed-down skill system was supposed to eliminate this... instead it made it worseToo few Quests - Everything is so linearToo few Events - Same as above... yawnOnly 4 Gems - B-O-R-I-N-GNo Rune Words - Why take these out... oh, cause it wasn\'t about fun, but the simplified "item hunt" which leads to the RMAH... okay got itNo Public Gamelist - Another over-simplification tactic to prevent trades and promote...', 'It takes the mid- and late-game, which was previously locked to the dedicated farmers and expert traders, and makes it so much more accessible to casual players.CHARACTER DEVELOPMENTWhen I first played Diablo 3, I was disappointed that skill trees were gone, especially since skill trees were what I enjoyed most about Diablo 2.', 'It takes the mid- and late-game, which was previously locked to the dedicated farmers and expert traders, and makes it so much more accessible to casual players.CHARACTER DEVELOPMENTWhen I first played Diablo 3, I was disappointed that skill trees were gone, especially since skill trees were what I enjoyed most about Diablo 2.', "While I'm still convinced that there's a middle ground between Diablo 2's skill trees and Diablo 3's user-friendliness, I'm glad Blizzard erred on the side of user-friendliness.In fact, the user-friendly skill system is the other big reason I enjoyed Diablo 3 as much as I did.", "While I'm still convinced that there's a middle ground between Diablo 2's skill trees and Diablo 3's user-friendliness, I'm glad Blizzard erred on the side of user-friendliness.In fact, the user-friendly skill system is the other big reason I enjoyed Diablo 3 as much as I did.", 'The combat has evolved from spamming a single skill to mixing multiple skills, which makes the combat more visceral and more strategic.', 'The more your round up and kill, the more body parts and blood splatters everywhere so you will be trying to get the perfect skill set to demolish and to survive.', '* Firstly, The skill system is strange and constricted.', 'An always online requirement, which limits their choice on how to play the game and eliminated 3rd party modding potential (which in light of the heavily flooded servers during the first week I gained intimate appreciation of), no skill trees, a real money auction house that encouraged a “pay to win”  mechanic, and visuals that were styled in a drastically different manner than previous installments in the series.', 'As a huge fan of Diablo 2 I was skeptical about all the changes that they made to the skill tree and being able to change skills at will...but after playing for a couple weeks I really enjoy being able to try and tweak different skills for different situations.Pros- gameplay is awesome(sound, graphics, character attacks, and story) are great and satisfying- difficulty is tough but i think just right!', 'I have always enjoyed choosing what skill I wanted when I leveled up, I am not use to having it chosen for me.', 'Give me a break.I like the idea that you are able to change your skill set during the game because then you can alter your fighting techniques.', 'In earlier titles in the series, a permanent attribute allocation and skill tree system was followed which permitted a greater degree of uniqueness, in theory, at the cost of a higher risk of completely gimping the character in a permanent way.', 'Instead, various skill and rune loadouts are viable, and players are encouraged to experiment with various combinations to find one that is effective for their own preferred playstyle rather than following one cookie-cutter "optimal" build for each class.', 'great game to play with friendscons: simple combat system, streamlined skill system, replayability.', 'skill system is extremely easy to use and navigate through, but it may be a turn off for people wanting skill trees.', 'skill system is extremely easy to use and navigate through, but it may be a turn off for people wanting skill trees.', "The game has been dumbed down so much I don't know why the developers left what little skill system they did, choices are minimal at best.", 'In D2; as you leveled and completed certain tasks, you were rewarded with attribute points and skill points.', "It's a Dungeon Crawler which is its own beast.In D3 you no longer do a basic attack with your weapon, everything is skill based.", "Each skill can be modified with a rune that will change how the skill behaves, the variance can be quite extreme making the same skill seam like you have many different skills.Combat is you click on something, it dies, you repeat that endlessly in the hopes they'll drop better loot.", "Each skill can be modified with a rune that will change how the skill behaves, the variance can be quite extreme making the same skill seam like you have many different skills.Combat is you click on something, it dies, you repeat that endlessly in the hopes they'll drop better loot.", "Each skill can be modified with a rune that will change how the skill behaves, the variance can be quite extreme making the same skill seam like you have many different skills.Combat is you click on something, it dies, you repeat that endlessly in the hopes they'll drop better loot.", 'The multiplayer is far superior to the single player, as long as you play with people who communicate with you, don\'t go on their own solo tangents into the woods or go afk without telling.The skill system Blizzard were presenting at their latest Blizzcons was vastly different from the released game; some even called it "dumbed down".', 'You can customise your followers with their own skill trees and even with armour and weapons.', 'I assume that blizzard might put in a pvp update to this game but, they had PLENTY of time to figure this out.The new skill tree system has its ups and downs, im glad that everyone now has the same skills, and combat will rely on skill and equipment.', 'I assume that blizzard might put in a pvp update to this game but, they had PLENTY of time to figure this out.The new skill tree system has its ups and downs, im glad that everyone now has the same skills, and combat will rely on skill and equipment.', "However, being one of the most anticipated games of 2012, beating out Mass Effect 3, Max Payne 3, and probably all but Black Ops II, I can assure you that it's worth the wait.The loot system is just as complex as before, the rune system is re-worked so no longer is it item based, it now adds an additional effect to a skill, making certain abilities better for solo play, or group play.", "I'm mixed on the new skill layout or lack of.", "I know this is implemented to add depth to the endgame, but I bet it'll get a bit tedious.>>>SKILLS / CUSTOMIZATION: There's only one skill to enhance for each of the earlier levels, and later, there are only a few runestones to shift, so it's easy to assume the skill system is oversimplified.", "I know this is implemented to add depth to the endgame, but I bet it'll get a bit tedious.>>>SKILLS / CUSTOMIZATION: There's only one skill to enhance for each of the earlier levels, and later, there are only a few runestones to shift, so it's easy to assume the skill system is oversimplified.", 'Well, at level 30, I have to say the skill system gets much more interesting as you start getting into the higher levels.', "There's the system that awards a player with every skill by the time a certain level is attained.", 'This is one thing that Blizzard has allows tried to adhere to but creating a system for multiplayer settings.- A pretty decent skill system.', "As many have said, there isn't really any skill in this game.", 'Strength makes you hit harder and defend better as a barbarian, but it only makes you defend better as a monk - monks hit harder with dexterity).You also gain new abilities as a skill, a rune or a passive skill.', 'Strength makes you hit harder and defend better as a barbarian, but it only makes you defend better as a monk - monks hit harder with dexterity).You also gain new abilities as a skill, a rune or a passive skill.', 'For instance, it may make the skill stronger, or cost less to execute or have a greater duration.', 'A certain skill may be free to cast or triple in effectiveness.', "Now you'll be constantly changing the way you play to maximize your symbiosis between your playing potential, the skill potential of the characters and the gear's potential.It keeps things fresh and fun.>>>SHOULD YOU BUY THIS GAME?It's the most important question to ask.", 'Once I level up, all I need to do is go in, activate the new skill, see if I like my new skill as opposed to my old skill and K.I.M.', 'Once I level up, all I need to do is go in, activate the new skill, see if I like my new skill as opposed to my old skill and K.I.M.', 'Once I level up, all I need to do is go in, activate the new skill, see if I like my new skill as opposed to my old skill and K.I.M.', 'I was so amazed, standing in Mulgore, looking around, and actually manging to get my character stuck (how you do that in Mulgore, it takes skill), and contacting a game master for help, who magically spwaned into the game, set me free and even showed me around Bloodhoof Villiage a little bit... how amazing that was... WAS.Diablo 2 was such an amazing game...']
column4: ['the skill tree is no longer as complex as the past series, in fact, most of the skills are useable.', 'The lack of a skill tree and lack of character customization is also a disappointment, as each character you create will be exactly like other player characters of the same class.', 'and there is still no pvp, not to mention they ruined this game with the skill runes.', 'I even lied to myself the moment I first created my character and found that skill progression was dumbed down to the likes of a Harry Potter game made for children..', 'You basically get 6 skill slots but are restricted to a list of spells for each specific slot, and then can further customize it with rune selection for the spell.The other thing I really like about this game is shared achievements across characters, although they still are mostly really stupid "achievements."', 'What sounds like a dramatic change on paper actually works extremely well in practice.Also gone are skill trees and the act of pouring all of ones points into one or two skills.', 'For example, the Witch Doctor\'s "Plague of Toads" skill set is as follows: the base skill unleashes a handful of toads that deal 130% weapon damage as poison with any enemies they contact; Explosive Toads has them erupt in an explosion of fire that deals 169% weapon damage; Toad of Hugeness summons a giant toad that will gulp down one enemy, taking him out of combat for 5 seconds and dealing 20% weapon damage per second; Rain of Toads calls down a swarm of toads from the sky that cover the ground and deal 130% weapon damage to affected enemies for 2 seconds; Addling Toads deal 130% weapon damage and have a 15% chance to confuse enemies for 4 seconds; and finally, Toad Affinity removes the mana cost from Plague of Toads.', 'For example, the Witch Doctor\'s "Plague of Toads" skill set is as follows: the base skill unleashes a handful of toads that deal 130% weapon damage as poison with any enemies they contact; Explosive Toads has them erupt in an explosion of fire that deals 169% weapon damage; Toad of Hugeness summons a giant toad that will gulp down one enemy, taking him out of combat for 5 seconds and dealing 20% weapon damage per second; Rain of Toads calls down a swarm of toads from the sky that cover the ground and deal 130% weapon damage to affected enemies for 2 seconds; Addling Toads deal 130% weapon damage and have a 15% chance to confuse enemies for 4 seconds; and finally, Toad Affinity removes the mana cost from Plague of Toads.', 'The Auction House and skill system make the game much more accessible to the casual player.', 'Basically you earn skills as you level, and the skills can be modified with runes (1 at a time for each skill) so your barbarian whirlwind could be on fire, or shoot smaller tornadoes from yourself.', 'With elective mode you can put any skill on 1-4 numbers and left/right clicking.With that said, you start being forced into a few builds in order to survive in inferno difficulty.', 'i can\'t believe this game took more than a decade,the game is relatively short (took me 20 hrs) at my slow pace,as other mentioned the  skill system is completely different from that of d2, different but not necessarily bad.the graphic could\'ve been much better, combat same as d2, but what most irritates me  it\'s the freaking "always online" authentication crap, i mean are you serious?...persistent online for "single player game" i regret buying this game, if i could only return it for a refund.', "The game isn't skill dependent, it is only gear based.PROBLEM IS that the gold prices of items have flown through the roof due to inflation, botters, and exploiters.", 'Diablo 3 has replaced this system with automatic skill and attribute gains happen automatically as the character levels, while the player can, at any time (other than in the middle of a battle, due to a cooldown mechanic) switch out skills (6 are active at any one time) and switch out runes for each skill (each rune having significantly different effects on the base skill).', 'Diablo 3 has replaced this system with automatic skill and attribute gains happen automatically as the character levels, while the player can, at any time (other than in the middle of a battle, due to a cooldown mechanic) switch out skills (6 are active at any one time) and switch out runes for each skill (each rune having significantly different effects on the base skill).', 'Diablo 3 has replaced this system with automatic skill and attribute gains happen automatically as the character levels, while the player can, at any time (other than in the middle of a battle, due to a cooldown mechanic) switch out skills (6 are active at any one time) and switch out runes for each skill (each rune having significantly different effects on the base skill).', 'Some players will prefer this system, while players who like to theorycraft themselves and figure out optimal builds before other players do, will not like this system.Another element of streamlining involves various game mechanics, such as town scrolls (no more need to stockpile them, it is a skill everyone has that can be used at any time), potions (no longer chugged, now on a cooldown) and item identification (now a skill, no longer requiring a scroll).', 'Some players will prefer this system, while players who like to theorycraft themselves and figure out optimal builds before other players do, will not like this system.Another element of streamlining involves various game mechanics, such as town scrolls (no more need to stockpile them, it is a skill everyone has that can be used at any time), potions (no longer chugged, now on a cooldown) and item identification (now a skill, no longer requiring a scroll).', 'The action is fast paced, the skill systems are simplistic in design and interface, but yet very complex since each character has nearly endless possible skill combinations.', 'The action is fast paced, the skill systems are simplistic in design and interface, but yet very complex since each character has nearly endless possible skill combinations.', 'The rune system later in the game makes this a little more complex, but is sorta like Contra where you earned different ways of shooting - everyone has access to the exact same runes (skill tweaks) at any time, and you can change them at the drop of a hat.', 'Just listen  to the female monk  and you will stop there.GameplayThat is where the disappointment is the largest: hardly any customization of character: we all follow the same blend generic skill progression path.ImmersionNone whatsoever.', 'Sorry no more skill trees.', "Yes because the skill system isn't as deep as the previous Diablos.", 'I watched a Blizzard developer in an interview basically say that they had a hard time balancing skill point development so they just got rid of it.', "There are various things you can do to minimize the occurrence of each of these issues, but I'm really hoping Blizzard pumps out a patch soon to resolve the most common of these (like the entire game hanging up and booting you out when you join multiplayer games that overtax your video GPU).>>>GRAPHICS / ART DESIGN: I said earlier that the visuals are WoW-esque, and I still stand by that (the skill icon design, architecture, UI layout, etc.)", "I'm not sure why there are more than 5 because just about every character has a cookie cutter skill base that pretty much most use to complete the game on the highest level.", 'Most skills and skill runes are just junk and worthless for progression.', 'Runes change the skill a little.']

column2: ['Almost because you still get too many unusable items, mostly because of class restrictions.You can stash such items in your common stash to share with your other heroes (on the same BattleNet account) but make sure to find the necessary...700,000 gold to pay for all the extra stash space.', "The games skill system is weak and lacks depth, the gold and real money AH take away the fun of loot hunting, the graphics are okay but are to bright and not dark enough, and the map aren't random enough.", 'Fix you lag plagued servers or give us offline mode.Update:Now the servers a re even laggier, more disconnects, more rubber banding and blizzard does nothing....also we get the pleasure of having 15+ gold spam request a day in our inbox when we log in....again reported over and over, on the forums...blizzard does nothing.', "Once you play through it 10 more times, on every character, and have millions of gold, you'll see the issues.To start, the graphics.", 'Speaking of Inferno, the supposed "hard" difficulty is made insanely easy by spending not much gold on the Auction House to vastly improve your gear, and then fly right on through every enemy and boss without so much as using a potion.', 'At first it was fun, but afterwards it was just repetitive grinding (gaining levels and gold).', "I've only ever used the gold auction house for buying, however I have sold some things on the real money auctions and it is a lot of fun to barter and bid!Very fun if you have a closely knit group of 6 friends that all play regularly.", 'To sell in the auction house for in-game gold or real world cash.', 'Really sad.The best loot comes from bosses which are highlighted in gold.', 'You struggle mightitly and spend most of your gold, and power through.', "I'm guessing buying gold is legal ...", "Then, everyone who has great gear and/or gold to sell will pvp'ers tripping over themselves to 'gear up'.", 'When I replied, another CSR replied back and responded to me as if I was using the gold AH and told me they cannot recover any items and they cannot proceed with any action.', 'If you want your 2nd character to START with good (not game-breaking crazy stuff) equipment, your primary can use their gold on the AH and LEGITIMATELY get it for them.', 'Plus, how are you going to win against a class that pays for their gold to get good items compare to your dinky MF items?', "Don't spend more than 10 seconds analyzing gear, just vendor it and go to the gold AH.Conclusion:Buy it if you like mindless grinds, but don't take D3 seriously and certainly don't torture yourself with money generating Inferno mode.", "So at this point you're stuck buying gear off the auction house for either millions of gold or real money.", 'I play a Demon Hunter and most everything can one shot you unless you invested hundreds of million in gold into your gear.', 'You have to pay gold to level the blacksmith, you have to breakdown magic items (rather than sell them) to get materials to make the items, and then you have to pay each time you craft an item, and you may get complete junk for your money and trouble.', 'The only way to get decent equipment together is to buy most of it at the auction house (the gold one, I will never use the cash one).It is clear that most of the development teams focus was on how to best implement the cash auction house, and the best ways to develop the game around it so that they could best benefit from it.', "Really enjoyed the game, had a 4 man group and we stuck together the whole time.The game itself is a lot of fun, it's just at the end can start feeling unrewarding.My suggestion is if your a blizz fanboy like me, if you do buy the game, tear it up however simply ignore the real money auction house,the prices for items are more than the cost of the game itself.Simply get as far as you can and grind your ass off and try to make the best use out of the gold AH.I'd almost say wait for the price to drop if you don't absolutely have to play it NOW, maybe they will throw in some changes to help the game out.", 'So if you are a legit player, you are basically out of luck unless you are willing to pay American dollars for pretend gold from China.', "Blizzard succeeded in somehow making the problem of Chinese gold farmers even worse than it already was, and also succeeded in coming off as just another sleezy game company that doesn't care about game balancing or the spirit of fair competition.-CONCLUSION-This is not the laid back and enjoyable hack and slash that hardcore-hell-mode diablo II was, this is a real life nightmare that you can only wake up from by not playing the game.-AWESOME CINEMATICS-The cinematics are awesome, watch them online.", 'I could have driven 5 minutes to my local game store to buy the disk version.My conclusion: Blizzard is deceptive and greedy, just as so many other reviewers on this site are saying: Blizzard allows items in the Auction House to be so inflated that it is extremely hard to earn enough gold to buy the good gear.', 'It enables the trading of low-level gear and mid-tier gear and actually makes gold actually not worthless.', '(For people doubting the worth of gold in Diablo 3, go play Diablo 2 and tell me what you can actually do with gold other than repair stuff and dump the rest on the gambler.', '(For people doubting the worth of gold in Diablo 3, go play Diablo 2 and tell me what you can actually do with gold other than repair stuff and dump the rest on the gambler.', "And I can't trade using gold since no one wants my maxed out stash of gold.", "And I can't trade using gold since no one wants my maxed out stash of gold.", "And then I whirlwind Diablo to death.As opposed to Diablo 3, where I get to Nightmare and hit a wall, and then I go to the Auction House, drop about 10k gold on several pieces of equipment, become twice as powerful as I was before, and I'm set for the next act or two.And that's why the Auction House is awesome.", 'I think i remember hearing some kind of humming or buzzing noise but I cant be sure.I returned to the magical Diablo land to collect magical Diablo land trash, sell trash to vendor, take gold from trash sale to auction house.', 'The good side, that gives you gold... the bad side, "do I really want to sell that????', 'All the game maker would have had to do to make the Smith useful is ALLOW you to SPECIFY that the item you want concentrates on for example, Intelligence and Vitality, along with "find more gold" and/or "find more magic items", which are some of the myriad choices that weapons and armor can have bestowed on them.', 'So you just wasted precious gold and supplemental stuff used to make that item.The last frustration is the Auction House.', 'It\'s not unusual to see a fresh listing, find an item that "looks good" for say 764 gold, and so you bid on it, and just says, "your bid is not high enough".', '?-introduced new chat system, to promote gold sales/spam from third party vendors?', 'Inflation on the gold auction house spiraled out of control, while gold on the Real Money Auction house plummeted in value.', 'Inflation on the gold auction house spiraled out of control, while gold on the Real Money Auction house plummeted in value.', 'Their alternative was to face the RNG God, who in Diablo 3 proved particularly merciless.You either paid more money for gold, or you scraped by with dull rares that did the job sometimes.', "In the end it is a lose-lose situation (the hacker/farmers gets more gold, which eventually later on when Real Money Auction House goes online, they are there to sell you all the stolen gold) - DO NOT AT THIS MOMENT buy using real money -if they go live- until Blizzard patch/fix the problem.The difficulty ramps up not in nicer way either at some point it feels like you hit a brick wall, and again when you can't progress you're going back to Auction House.", "In the end it is a lose-lose situation (the hacker/farmers gets more gold, which eventually later on when Real Money Auction House goes online, they are there to sell you all the stolen gold) - DO NOT AT THIS MOMENT buy using real money -if they go live- until Blizzard patch/fix the problem.The difficulty ramps up not in nicer way either at some point it feels like you hit a brick wall, and again when you can't progress you're going back to Auction House.", "You can't clear act 2 content without act 3-4 gear on certain classes; this leads to the game being a gold grind inorder to purchase better items off the AH.All of these problems are fixable if blizzard wants to fix it.", 'very easy to buy better weapons with in game gold and to sell your gear too.', 'while i love it i wonder if the market will get too diluted and kill values.- jeweler/blacksmith - i enjoy how you can update each and can craft and remove gems(costs alot of gold though)Cons- stats (str, dex, vita) are auto added based on character.', 'The hacks seem to be all linked to people using the gold auction house during a certain period.', "I've never planned to purchase items or gold with real money.", 'The major problem is that Blizzard has seen fit to design the game so that you will NEED to purchase items and gold from the AH in order to progress without some maddening gear grind that would take a lifetime.', "So expect to see any half decent weapon for at least 10 million gold, which is no small amount of money.So a lot of people have resorted to using the Real Money Auction House and it's absolute chaos.", 'However, in Nightmare it seems like the bosses will only drop Blue items and the gold ones drop off of the Unique monsters.Normal Mode:  Easy until you venture out of the keep in Act III.', 'Dropping ALL of your items and gold whenever you died was unnecessarily punishing as a default option (as a selectable option, sure, but no choice?', 'Why would a hacker take my gold and leave behind all my best (rare) gear.BUG!Play at your own risk, you could lose your progress at any second in this POS game.Sending it back to AMAZON.', 'D3 does away with this by implementing their own auction house that players can sell and buy equipment on using in-game gold currency (and later, IRL money).', 'This makes the in-game gold more meaningful unlike the previous two games.', 'The average user is going to start to get stuck around late nightmare/early hell difficulty, and either quit in frustration and give the game a 1 star rating or keep running through dungeons trying to get more gold for that next piece of armor or awesome weapon, to get a bit deeper into the game.', "Also, the sound effects you hear when you turn over a corpse and gold drops off it's body, yup it's the same exact sound file from D2.", "They'll either fix it (I hope and imagine) or after people have beat the game, and no longer want to sell items for a million gold two days after release (the economy is going down fast in this game... way too many resources, no gold sinks, use and sell rares, recover every gem you've ever made...)If you have the money to spare, and want to support a once brilliant company that has been bought out and is all about the money now, go ahead.", "They'll either fix it (I hope and imagine) or after people have beat the game, and no longer want to sell items for a million gold two days after release (the economy is going down fast in this game... way too many resources, no gold sinks, use and sell rares, recover every gem you've ever made...)If you have the money to spare, and want to support a once brilliant company that has been bought out and is all about the money now, go ahead.", 'You will be required to buy from the AH, so save all your gold and prepare for high prices.', 'My stash is mostly full with stuff I may be able to use and because now I have the blacksmith available, I can break down some of the junk and build better weapons but as soon as I get my 14K of gold, I am buying more stash room!', 'And that is the other thing, you can and will accumulate gold very rapidly so no worries about being able to eventually buying a "Sword of Thrashing" for 5k because in less than 2 hrs you can afford it!Now while people will probably criticize the new leveling system, I like it.', "BUT, you can take all your gold and try to find an over priced upgrade on the Auction House, a place where you will compete with hundreds of auction house farmers that sit lurking for reasonably listed items they can buy instantly to relist for a 100x markup... Oh, you could do this too of course, if you don't mind drudging through a spreadsheet seeking items to buy and resell... Sound like fun?", "The company is more focused on nerfing characters abilities and spots in the game that are player friendly than doing anything for characters who are struggling... Because, you see, in their opinion, you can just use the auction house and be well geared, if you just have a good 100 million gold... in 400 hours of playing across multiple 60's I have made a grand total of 20m gold... that's not even enough to buy an upgrade on the Auction House anymore, lol.If you buy, it's your dime, but don't say you weren't warned.", "The company is more focused on nerfing characters abilities and spots in the game that are player friendly than doing anything for characters who are struggling... Because, you see, in their opinion, you can just use the auction house and be well geared, if you just have a good 100 million gold... in 400 hours of playing across multiple 60's I have made a grand total of 20m gold... that's not even enough to buy an upgrade on the Auction House anymore, lol.If you buy, it's your dime, but don't say you weren't warned.", "Blizzard nor their employees and fanboys don't care; see forum's for evidence of this.Online general chat is filled with chinese spambots trying to sell you in game gold for real money."]
column4: ['They didnt - and the auction house addition, using game gold, is fun.', 'So you try to buy gear to power through, AH is so expensive, so you sacrifice a lot of MF(magic find) and GF(gold find) to get a lot of + resist all and vitality items.', 'No, I spent some gold to buy an item in the AH, because all the drops are terrible.', 'This is not directly Blizzard fault, but say after running the game in inferno a few times, you got like 10 million gold.', 'So read up strategies to farm gold and farm gold to get more gear to... lame.- No replayability, terrible post 60.', 'So read up strategies to farm gold and farm gold to get more gear to... lame.- No replayability, terrible post 60.', 'The cost for 1mil gold is now down to 43 cents.', 'Think about it, I spent 5 hours to make 1mil gold ... Another player can pull 43 cents out of his/her pocket.', 'There are attributes that make certain armor and weapons more appealing, including vitality, regeneration, gold find, and so forth.The Bad, Bad, Bad* Required online log in.', 'Blizzard, it is not fun to have to farm farm farm farm farm gold just to BUY gear from the AH.', 'The auction house has also made gold practically worthless.', 'Botters and farmers have driven prices in the auction house to insane levels where it costs 500 million gold or more for decent items, and the value of gold is dropping daily.', 'Botters and farmers have driven prices in the auction house to insane levels where it costs 500 million gold or more for decent items, and the value of gold is dropping daily.', 'This can be done with gold you earn playing the game...', "At this point you'll need millions of gold per gear piece by Act 2 or simply die in the game.", 'You could be a magic use, and get strength and dex items...or worse, small bonuses to XP, or gold drops.', "The other complaint is that the end game is essentially impossible without spending virtual or real gold in Blizzard's auction house.", "It's not fun at all, just 100% guaranteed death and disappointment because you know your death will be based not on a miss-step, but on an undefeatable foe.-CHINESE BOT-FARM AUCTION HALL-Auto farming bots that farm gold 24/7 have already inflated auction hall prices into the millions of gold for a single item.", "It's not fun at all, just 100% guaranteed death and disappointment because you know your death will be based not on a miss-step, but on an undefeatable foe.-CHINESE BOT-FARM AUCTION HALL-Auto farming bots that farm gold 24/7 have already inflated auction hall prices into the millions of gold for a single item.", 'Blizzard was working hard to stop the gold farmers and bots.', 'Give gold to game exploiters and professional players or maybe even just plain lucky people.', 'Chests, hidden cache, logs, etc may yield items and also gold.', 'Later in the game, dying can easily cost you thousands in game gold to repair your weapons & armor.', "I don't think I will ever get to 60(4), because I cannot survive without getting killed dozens of times, depleting my gold supply.", 'The result is, you find stuff and think, "well, I can\'t use it for my Monk, but this might go with my Wizard (see, all items in the storage chest are totally sharable... including all the game gold you get)".', "Unfortunately, it's only after you've wasted hundreds of thousands in gold and special items that you finally figure out he is worthless.", 'There, if you have game gold, you can attempt to buy stuff from other players who are attempting to get more gold that the dealers inside the game will give you for stuff you want to sell.', 'There, if you have game gold, you can attempt to buy stuff from other players who are attempting to get more gold that the dealers inside the game will give you for stuff you want to sell.', "(I should also say that I think this will add to the hacking and gold selling market; I'm already seeing the spam in chat and it will only get worse).", "I was out millions of gold in items, 150,000 gold in definite gold lost from the roll back, a day lost on a character that I was working on, and the lame moderator just makes some snarky comments and says it's all taken care of now.", "I was out millions of gold in items, 150,000 gold in definite gold lost from the roll back, a day lost on a character that I was working on, and the lame moderator just makes some snarky comments and says it's all taken care of now.", "I was out millions of gold in items, 150,000 gold in definite gold lost from the roll back, a day lost on a character that I was working on, and the lame moderator just makes some snarky comments and says it's all taken care of now.", 'I haven\'t even gone into it yet, because I don\'t feel like trying to farm the 5-6 different pieces required and the 100,000 gold item to make the level and not gain anything from it other than maybe a few giggles while slaughtering a unicorn.So far the only words that can describe this game are "epic fail."', "big part of why my group is no longer playing-drm...you have to play on their laggy, unreliable servers, no hardcore until this is resolved-don't farm for item, buy them at the AH-implemented crafting system, that is worthless - buy your items at the AH-don't farm for gold, buy it at the AH-character customization is very limited, once you reach inferno your already limited customization is usually reduced to 1 build with MINOR variations-rune system is gone, yet even less customization-every class has about -+24 abilities, 1/3 of these are actually useful-some entire classes are just crap - hi witch doctor-inferno is pretty much just for ranged characters.", 'People who actually wanted to play the game were without enough gold to buy items needed to progress.', 'THAT IS NOT GOOD GAMEPLAY.Also, as of yesterday (Friday 5/26/2012), thousands of players on Hell difficulty mode have had their accounts completely "emptied":  their characters have lost all items on their character or in their stash, and have no gold either.', '!As stated Inferno is so ridiculously difficult and the loot generally so bad that the ONLY WAY to progress is to use the Auction House.I only managed to beat the game by bidding low gold on items and shopping intelligently, but it took wayyyy longer than it should have.', "The game isn't skill dependent, it is only gear based.PROBLEM IS that the gold prices of items have flown through the roof due to inflation, botters, and exploiters.", "the gold's auction house.It helps to improve your character.The worst of the game?", 'I remember shelving the first Diablo because I died somewhere it was impossible to recover my equipment and gold, so figured there was no further point.', "You don't share gold or have to fight other players for your items.", "Blizzard's Battle.net serve as the platform for the game, giving you an online auction house for in-game gold and another for real money trading.", 'Destroying a barrel or rock and getting a gold seems really stupid.', 'So, gold is saved in not having to level it through all characters but only JC is viable until after lvl 60 is obtained and other BS plans are found.', 'Plus, this game is already riddled with gold farmers.', "For those that don't know what they are, they are players that are hired and paid to farm the game for gold (currency) that it then sold on the internet for real money.", 'There are actually items on the AH that go for millions of gold that are considered decent but not great items.', 'The auciton house (gold) is constantly down or buggy.']

column2: ["I don't mind so much (I just read a book).I have played multiplayer a few times and popping in and out is rather seamless.", "I haven't felt the need to play multiplayer so much because I am still learning the ins and outs of the game play and different classes.I do actually find it fun and interesting to experiment with different combinations of class skills and armor buffs/runes.", 'It helps when you need to kill Diablo and Belial.You get better gear when you play multiplayer games and/or kill elite mobs.You can make private games and not have to deal with the idiots that spammed Diablo 2 games.I loved the plot.', "But what should be a fun experience with neat strangers gets old fast when a couple scammers jump in your game.Two more downsides are that multiplayer servers hold only 4 people (half of Diablo II's limit) and PVP, a much advertised feature, does not actually exist yet.SUPPORTThe dealbreaker for many.", "I don't mind it but I won't call those people wrong either.OVERALLDiablo III is in most respects the game I wanted- an action-packed hack'n'slash with adequate graphics, great sound, and fun multiplayer.", "Thus, I only have played single player so far, so I can't opine about any multiplayer aspects.", 'I don\'t get a sense like i did in D2 that this is "my unique character build".- replay ability ( i fear that once i level up about 3-4 different characters there will be no need for me to start a new "build" of the same class with different stats, skills b/c i can just change or upate the skills of my current character)  something i did countless times in Diablo 2- can only handle 4 players in multiplayer (D2 had 8)Overall still very fun and i feel blizzard is really committed to making everything balanced and feels right no
